go-1W5d5UHIWop_RTyJAAAAAA==,google,https://stantec.jobs/winnipeg-mb/materials-testing-technologist/B2533DC0650F4700B5C9B82FBE3561C7/job/?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,Materials Testing Technologist,Stantec,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-06,contract,,,,,,False,,,,,"Materials Testing Technologist - ( 25000011 )
Description

Build the foundation for a lasting and successful career in geotechnical construction materials testing and inspection by starting with a good team. From field and laboratory testing, forensic investigation, to geotechnical drilling and pile installation monitoring on vast array of construction projects in all industry sectors, our team does work that’s rock solid. We perform quality assurance and quality control services on new and rehabilitation commercial and infrastructure projects. We push the boundaries as leaders and experts in our field and encourage our fellow team members to do the same. Join our team today!
Your Opportunity

The Stantec Geotechnical Group in Winnipeg, MB is seeking two Materials Testing Technicians/Technologists to work in our materials and geotechnical laboratory. This position will act as support to both our field and laboratory operations in construction materials testing & inspection services. If you are an excellent communicator, enjoy independent and team environments, the opportunity to mentor junior staff, and are driven by providing high-level quality deliverables on a variety of geotechnical project settings, this is a great role for you. Apply now and redefine your personal best!
Your Key Responsibilities
• Perform construction materials testing & inspection services on concrete, mortar, asphalt, aggregate, and soils in field and laboratory settings, including but not limited to:
• Fresh and hardened concrete monitoring and testing
• Fill placement and compaction monitoring and testing
• Deep and shallow foundation construction
• Pile inspection and monitoring
• Forensic investigation of concrete structures
• Assisting in resolution of technical issues on construction sites
• Preparation and testing of concrete and asphalt mix designs
• Participate in proficiency testing ensuring accurate testing and reporting of results
• Interacting with suppliers/producers, contractors, consultants, and owners, both in the private and public sector
• Operating and maintaining fleet vehicle
• Operating computerized and digital testing equipment
• Operating and maintaining moisture-density gauges (class 7 radioactive dangerous good)
• Continuing to improve your technical abilities and certifications within the framework of the laboratory and field areas of practice
• Preparation of field and laboratory test reports
• Capable of lifting 25 kg test samples as required by the applicable test procedure
• Capable of lifting heavy equipment as required while performing field testing and inspection
• Promotion of our health and safety culture, client relations, training and mentoring of junior staff, equipment resources maintenance and management, and other related duties will be expected

The successful candidate will join our group of over 25 geotechnical professionals in Winnipeg and receive mentorship and training from our experienced team of technologists, engineers-in-training, and professional engineers.
Qualifications
Your Capabilities and Credentials
• Knowledge of advanced concrete and soil testing procedures would be an asset
• CCIL Certification for aggregate, asphalt, concrete, and soils would be an asset
• Have knowledge of sampling techniques and construction methodology
• Energetic, team-oriented player with a commitment to superior client service with a strong ability to work independently
• Available to work overtime and on weekends, including out of town projects typically for 1 to 2 days, but possibly as long as 2 to 3 weeks
• Strong communication skills, both written and verbal
• Excellent interpersonal and organizational abilities
• Highly organized, and demonstrate a flexible approach to work assignments, as you may be required to work overtime depending on our clients’ needs
• Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and able to coordinate multiple tasks simultaneously
• Detail-oriented with attention and emphasis on accuracy and efficiency
• Computer skills in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, Outlook)
• A valid class 5 drives license and clean driver’s abstract
Education and Experience
• Hold a technician/technologist diploma from a recognized college
• Minimum 1 year prior experience in geotechnical laboratory and field testing of construction materials including, but not limited to: aggregates, asphalt, concrete, and soil
• Current certification or eligibility for certification with CTTAM with designation as C.Tech. or C.E.T.
• Have experience and knowledge with relevant standardized testing procedures such as ASTM, AASHTO, and CSA
• Have experience with MI (Manitoba Infrastructure) and City of Winnipeg projects and associated field and laboratory testing procedures
Fieldwork may include exposure to the elements including inclement weather.

This description is not a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that may be required of the employee and other duties, responsibilities and activities may be assigned or may be changed at any time with or without notice.
Stantec is a place where the best and brightest come to build on each other’s talents, do exciting work, and make an impact on the world around us. Join us and redefine your personal best.

Benefits Summary: Regular full-time and part-time employees will have access to health, dental, and vision plans, a well-being program, health care spending account, wellness spending accounts, group registered retirement savings plan, employee stock purchase program, group tax-free savings account, life and accidental death & dismemberment (AD&D) insurance, short-term/long-term disability plans, emergency travel benefits, tuition reimbursement, professional membership fee coverage, and paid time off.
Temporary/casual employees will have access to group registered retirement savings plan, employee stock purchase program, and group tax-free savings account.
The benefits information listed above may not apply to union positions because benefits for such positions are governed by applicable collective bargaining agreements.
Primary Location : Canada-Manitoba-Winnipeg
Organization : BC-1233 EnvSvcs-CA GeoTech West
Employee Status : Regular
Job Level : Entry Level
Travel : Yes, 20 % of the Time
Schedule : Full-time

We prohibit discrimination in decisions concerning recruitment, hiring, referral, promotion, compensation, fringe benefits, job training, terminations or any other condition of employment. Shared Health leads the planning and coordinates the integration of patient\-centered clinical and preventive health services across Manitoba. The organization also delivers some province\-wide health services and supports centralized administrative and business functions for Manitoba health organizations.
**Position Overview**

Under the general direction of the Laboratory Supervisor/Manager/Director or Designate, the Charge Medical Laboratory Technologist is responsible for the daily operation of their section of the laboratory. Areas of responsibility will include administrative, supervisory, technical and educational. The incumbent will maintain a safe environment in accordance with professional and provincial guidelines and ensure compliance with quality assurance programs and maintain standards put forth by Accreditation. Functions are conducted in accordance with the Mission and Values of Shared Health Diagnostic Services, current policies, procedures and applicable legislation.

* Successful completion of the CMLTM Prior Learning Assessment process for a discipline specialty, as deemed by the Employer may also be considered.
* Advanced academic achievement (e.g., A.R.T. or B.Sc.) preferred.
* Relevant courses or seminars preferred.

* Current registration or eligible for registration with the College of Medical Laboratory Technologists of Manitoba (CMLTM) required.
* Current membership with the Canadian Society for Medical Laboratory Science (CSMLS) considered an asset.

* Must be able to communicate effectively in English, both written and oral.
* Windows computer environment required.
* Microsoft Office programs required.
* Workplace Health and Safety Program or training preferred.
* Leadership skills to coordinate workflow, supervise and promote teamwork.
* Communication skills to handle professionally all lab communications and interactions with other health care professionals at various levels from both within and outside the laboratory.
* Apply technical knowledge to interpretation of results, troubleshooting, and assessing of methods.
* Follow oral and written instructions precisely with attention to detail.
* Demonstrated effective oral and written communication skills required.
* Demonstrated ability to work both independently and as a team member.
* Proficient analytical skills.
* Work under pressure.
* Maintains confidentiality with all information entrusted to the position.
* Fluent language skills (written and oral) in both French and English may be required.
* Ability to perform duties as described.

* Working shifts, weekends, and holidays may be required.
* Participating in standby and callback duty may be required.

Women’s Health Clinic (WHC) provides accessible, woman\-centred services, creates strategic partnerships and advocates for system change. We work toward the vision of having equitable health and wellness services within and beyond WHC, delivered through a feminist lens. All our work is guided by our values – choice, inclusion, social justice, innovation and integrity.
**WHC EXPECTATIONS:**

Every employee is expected to contribute to the mission, vision and values of WHC, and the achievement of its strategic plan through collaboration and teamwork. Employees are expected to consistently attend work, function within WHC’s principles of services, contribute to the quality of our services for clients and look for ways to improve our overall effectiveness and enhance client experience. Employees will respect each other, clients and members of the public and create an environment where clients have the information, knowledge and support they need to achieve their individual health and wellness goals.
**WHC PROMISE:**

WHC will provide employees with a respectful, healthy and safe work environment and compensate and recognize employees in a fair and meaningful way. We will provide employees with opportunities to participate in planning and decision\-making and to communicate your concerns, ideas and suggestions. We will listen and be responsive. We will support employee growth and development through a culture of coaching, learning and encouragement.

The Laboratory Assistant 2 position will assist with routine laboratory functions, such as preparing client samples for analysis and routine lab maintenance. You will be working independently and in a team environment, with an emphasis on providing quality and efficient service to internal clients.
Specific Responsibilities
- Process samples in a timely manner, to meet client Turnaround Times (TAT) and holding requirements
- Sample Preparation
- Sample Weighing, filtering and dispensing
- Archive and disposal of samples
- Glassware, bottle and material preparation
- Operates basic preparation equipment
- Operate basic lab support equipment
- Complete basic extractions, digestions, clean-ups

- Review work lists, data entry, log registry
- Interpretation of lab info in LIMs
- Performs basic analytical methods
- Assist with calibration of basic instrumentation
- Assist with training

- Review and provide input for SOP's
- Preform general routine operation of basic equipment
- Assist with the preparation of standards, stocks and materials

- Ability to work independently and as part of a team

- Completion of high school diploma or equivalent required
- Some experience working in a fast-paced, production, and/or preparation environment
- Knowledge from post-secondary science courses and/or basic laboratory safety is an asset
- Experience working with chemicals or in a laboratory setting (ex. school) is an asset, but not required.
Physical Demands
- Manual dexterity to perform intricate and/or repetitive tasks
- Wear issued personal protective equipment (PPE) as required
- Ability to stand for a full shift
- Ability to lift up to 30 lbs./14 kg on a regular basis and carry for short distances
- You may be exposed to unpleasant odours
- Please note that ALS operates 24/7 and will require day, afternoon, and graveyard shift work including weekends.

gd-1009614384203,glassdoor,https://www.glassdoor.ca/job-listing/j?jl=1009614384203,,Sr Expense Analyst,The Canada Life Assurance Company,Winnipeg,2025-01-29,,direct_data,yearly,51400.0,95200.0,CAD,False,,,organic,talentacquisitioncanada@canadalife.com,"Permanent Full Time
An exciting opportunity is now available for the role of **Senior Expense Analyst**, reporting to Manager, Expense Analysis, Performance Management, Workplace Solutions.

This position plays a key role in the planning, control, and analysis of Workplace Solutions’ expenses and provides insights to support decision making for staffing, expense pricing and claim settlement expense reserve.

The successful candidate will be responsible for (a) building and maintaining staffing forecast model for key operational areas for Group Life \& Health and Group Retirement Services businesses and (b) analyzing data related to expenses within, and allocated to, Workplace Solutions (WS).
**What you will do**
* Staffing Models
+ Track and analyze work volume for key operational areas (e.g., disability and life claims) and conduct volume reprojection
+ Work closely with business areas to stay current with trends, developments and operational changes that may impact staffing level and productivity
+ Update staffing model and recommend hiring plan to ensure the appropriate staffing level for achieving desired operational results
+ Participate in annual budget and multi\-year projection process for key operational areas assigned
* Expense Studies
+ Update in\-depth expense studies applicable to the full range of product and segment within Workplace Solutions
+ Prepare submission to Industry surveys regarding WS’s expenses
+ Maintain and update expense allocation process by segment and product as well as periodically calibrating the process to expense studies
* Develop and/or maintain work procedures and controls, and ensure effective applications
* Verbal and oral communication of analysis results to business partners and senior leaders with the aid of dashboards/graphs/charts/PowerPoint presentations
* Support ad\-hoc expense analysis
**What you will bring**
* Post\-secondary education in actuarial science, commerce, related field, and/or related work experience
* Excellent analytical and problem\-solving skills
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Excel and Access
* Experience in building complex financial models in Excel would be an asset
* Strong organizational and time management skills
* Committed to delivering results in the required timeframe
* Ability to communicate with all levels and work within a team environment
* Experience with data visualization application (e.g., PowerBI, Tableau, etc.) would be an asset
* Knowledge about GLH and GRS businesses an asset, but not required

The base salary for this position is between **$51,400** **\- $ 95,200** annually. This represents base salary only and does not represent other variable compensation components of our total compensation ( i.e. annual bonus, commission etc). If you are selected to move forward in our recruitment process, your recruiter will be able to discuss additional details of our total rewards program with you.

gd-1009615334520,glassdoor,https://www.glassdoor.ca/job-listing/j?jl=1009615334520,,"Senior Analyst, ALM Planning & Development",The Canada Life Assurance Company,Winnipeg,2025-01-29,,direct_data,yearly,58600.0,97700.0,CAD,False,,,organic,talentacquisitioncanada@canadalife.com,"Permanent Full Time

The Asset/Liability Management (ALM) department is responsible to the ongoing process of formulating, implementing, monitoring, and revising strategies/tactics related to assets and liabilities in order to achieve financial objectives, given a set of risk limits and constraints. ALM also supports various financial reporting, liability valuation, product pricing and capital reporting requirements, working with various stakeholders across the company.

ALM Planning \& Development is a unit within the ALM department that is responsible for research, analysis, coordination, planning, project management and the development of enhancements to policies, procedures and tools, in support of ALM Canada’s goals and priorities.
**Position Overview:**
There are two general areas of responsibility associated with this position, as follows:
* Project Management – Includes oversight, monitoring, reporting and coordination of key departmental projects and initiatives. Will also include execution and leadership of assigned projects.

* Planning \& Budgeting – Preparing budgets/plans for Canadian Division investment activity (i.e. purchases/sales of assets across various types and business segments). Will also entail monitoring of execution of the plans and risk/performance analysis and reporting.

The successful candidate will be able to efficiently consolidate, analyze and synthesize information from various sources. Effective collaboration, coordination and communication are central to the role.
**What you will do**
* Project Management Activities
+ Assist in the annual (and ad hoc) prioritization and planning of departmental projects and initiatives
+ Monitor, consolidate information and prepare progress reports on key projects that are executed by ALM staff
+ Lead the execution of assigned projects and initiatives
* Planning/Budgeting Activities
+ Collect information on requirements, constraints and desired outcomes that will help inform the development of investment plans/budgets
+ Synthesize information, perform analysis and draft plans/budgets
+ Collect feedback, collaborate with stakeholders and strive to reach consensus on plans/budgets
+ Communicate plans/budgets to stakeholders and monitor and report on execution
+ Assess risks and performance related to plans/budgets
**What you will bring**
* Strong communication (verbal and written) and collaboration skills
* Excellent organizational \& time management skills, with an ability to manage multiple priorities
* A positive attitude and a commitment to learning and continuous improvement
* Proven analytical and problem\-solving abilities
* Proficiency in the Microsoft Office suite, particularly Excel
+ Experience in other data analysis, analytics or reporting software is an asset
* University Degree majoring in management, finance, statistics, actuarial mathematics, accounting, or a similar discipline
* Progress toward a professional designation (CFA, CPA, FCIA, FSA, PMP, etc.) is an asset

The base salary for this position is between **$58,600** **\- $97,700** annually. This represents base salary only and does not represent other variable compensation components of our total compensation ( i.e. annual bonus, commission etc). If you are selected to move forward in our recruitment process, your recruiter will be able to discuss additional details of our total rewards program with you.

Career opportunities will be open a minimum of 5 business days from the date of posting, closing dates will vary depending on the search activity. All applications received will be reviewed on a rolling basis.

go-d9Xbutmpe4qBtnNIAAAAAA==,google,https://ca.trabajo.org/job-2891-78e66a55a2801e048b6eb4b07ca5ccbe?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,Revenue Analyst,Canad Inns,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-14,,,,,,,False,,,,,"A revenue analyst is a special type of accountant who keeps track of a company's revenue and looks for ways to improve it. This analysis is multifaceted. The revenue analyst tracks revenue over time and determines the direction of the trend. He determines how a company's revenue compares to competitors in the industry. The analyst breaks down revenue by individual product and service and determines which goods are making the company money and which are not. He matches revenues to expenses for each business segment to determine the relative profitability of each segment. A revenue analyst must possess an almost preternatural attention to detail and be highly accurate with his work.

Revenue analysts are responsible for taking large sets of numerical data and extracting from them valuable information about the company's revenue that management can use to make business decisions. The amount of specialization for a revenue analyst varies from position to position, with large companies often employing more specialized analysts and smaller companies hiring fewer analysts but training them on the entire breadth of the field.

Some revenue analysts take a micro approach to analyzing data. In other words, they draw conclusions from examining strictly company data. Their reports are mínimally influenced by external forces or broader economic data. For this type of revenue analyst, common job duties include matching revenues to expenses for various business segments
column2: tracking the revenues of a company product or service, or for the company as a whole, over time and charting the trend
column3: and brainstorming potential ways to increase revenue without affecting a concomitant increase in expenses.

• *The qualifications and experience we’re looking for**:
- Bachelor's degree, or completion of a community college diploma (minimum two years) in electronics technology, is required.
- Extron certifications CTS and CTI are required.
- Dante certification is an asset.
- Three years directly related job experience in audio visual equipment maintenance is required while maintaining the following minimum requirements:

- One year of experience working in infrastructure as a network sysadmin performing investigation, configuration, design, development, maintenance and support, with enterprise level systems within a large business environment is required.

- One year of experience with Microsoft Windows-based products and services (AD), Windows Server operating systems (Windows 2016, 2019, 2022), and enterprise level Microsoft platform-based solutions in higher education or large business environments is required.
- AV systems implementation, maintenance, troubleshooting, and design experience is required.
- Experience with TCP/IP fundamentals and understanding of common network protocols including: TCP, UDP, HTTP, FTP, DNS, SIP, RTP is required.
- Demonstrated network troubleshooting skills including the ability to diagnose and resolve complex network configuration, hardware or software system problems is required.
- Extron product experience is required.
- Audio tech experience is an asset.
- Cabling experience is an asset.
- Knowledge of scripting using Python, Powershell or other scripting platform is an asset.
- ITIL experience is an asset.
- An acceptable equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered.
- Must be self-motivated and possess excellent problem-solving skills.
- Demonstrated workload organization and prioritization skills required.
- Demonstrated teamwork/collaboration skills required.
- Ability to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing, with users of varying levels of technical expertise is required.
- Ability to diagnose and resolve hardware, software and system problems is required.
- Ability to develop strong interpersonal working relationships.
- Satisfactory work record, including satisfactory attendance and punctuality, is required.
• *Why the University of Manitoba?**

Along with being one of Manitoba’s top employers, we are proud to provide a collaborative and enriching work environment. In addition to a strong compensation package with a competitive salary, the University provides an exceptional workplace that includes:

in-f8995b2a8d962ca9,indeed,https://ca.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=f8995b2a8d962ca9,https://jobs.canadalife.com/job/Winnipeg-Senior-Analyst%2C-ALM-Planning-&-Development-MB/1165326001/?feedId=414833&utm_source=Indeed,"Senior Analyst, ALM Planning & Development",Canada Life,"Winnipeg, MB, CA",2025-01-28,fulltime,,,,,,False,,,,talentacquisitioncanada@canadalife.com,"Permanent Full Time

The Asset/Liability Management (ALM) department is responsible to the ongoing process of formulating, implementing, monitoring, and revising strategies/tactics related to assets and liabilities in order to achieve financial objectives, given a set of risk limits and constraints. ALM also supports various financial reporting, liability valuation, product pricing and capital reporting requirements, working with various stakeholders across the company.

ALM Planning \& Development is a unit within the ALM department that is responsible for research, analysis, coordination, planning, project management and the development of enhancements to policies, procedures and tools, in support of ALM Canada’s goals and priorities.
**Position Overview:**
There are two general areas of responsibility associated with this position, as follows:
* Project Management – Includes oversight, monitoring, reporting and coordination of key departmental projects and initiatives. Will also include execution and leadership of assigned projects.

* Planning \& Budgeting – Preparing budgets/plans for Canadian Division investment activity (i.e. purchases/sales of assets across various types and business segments). Will also entail monitoring of execution of the plans and risk/performance analysis and reporting.

The successful candidate will be able to efficiently consolidate, analyze and synthesize information from various sources. Effective collaboration, coordination and communication are central to the role.
**What you will do**
* Project Management Activities
+ Assist in the annual (and ad hoc) prioritization and planning of departmental projects and initiatives
+ Monitor, consolidate information and prepare progress reports on key projects that are executed by ALM staff
+ Lead the execution of assigned projects and initiatives
* Planning/Budgeting Activities
+ Collect information on requirements, constraints and desired outcomes that will help inform the development of investment plans/budgets
+ Synthesize information, perform analysis and draft plans/budgets
+ Collect feedback, collaborate with stakeholders and strive to reach consensus on plans/budgets
+ Communicate plans/budgets to stakeholders and monitor and report on execution
+ Assess risks and performance related to plans/budgets
**What you will bring**
* Strong communication (verbal and written) and collaboration skills
* Excellent organizational \& time management skills, with an ability to manage multiple priorities
* A positive attitude and a commitment to learning and continuous improvement
* Proven analytical and problem\-solving abilities
* Proficiency in the Microsoft Office suite, particularly Excel
+ Experience in other data analysis, analytics or reporting software is an asset
* University Degree majoring in management, finance, statistics, actuarial mathematics, accounting, or a similar discipline
* Progress toward a professional designation (CFA, CPA, FCIA, FSA, PMP, etc.) is an asset

The base salary for this position is between **$58,600** **\- $97,700** annually. This represents base salary only and does not represent other variable compensation components of our total compensation ( i.e. annual bonus, commission etc). If you are selected to move forward in our recruitment process, your recruiter will be able to discuss additional details of our total rewards program with you.

Career opportunities will be open a minimum of 5 business days from the date of posting, closing dates will vary depending on the search activity. All applications received will be reviewed on a rolling basis.

in-ee9103da6b3228d4,indeed,https://ca.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=ee9103da6b3228d4,https://jobs.canadalife.com/job/Winnipeg-Manitoba-Sr-Expense-Analyst-MB-R3C-1V3/1164936401/?feedId=414833&utm_source=Indeed,Sr Expense Analyst,Canada Life,"Winnipeg, MB, CA",2025-01-27,fulltime,,,,,,False,,,,talentacquisitioncanada@canadalife.com,"Permanent Full Time
An exciting opportunity is now available for the role of **Senior Expense Analyst**, reporting to Manager, Expense Analysis, Performance Management, Workplace Solutions.

This position plays a key role in the planning, control, and analysis of Workplace Solutions’ expenses and provides insights to support decision making for staffing, expense pricing and claim settlement expense reserve.

The successful candidate will be responsible for (a) building and maintaining staffing forecast model for key operational areas for Group Life \& Health and Group Retirement Services businesses and (b) analyzing data related to expenses within, and allocated to, Workplace Solutions (WS).
**What you will do**
* Staffing Models
+ Track and analyze work volume for key operational areas (e.g., disability and life claims) and conduct volume reprojection
+ Work closely with business areas to stay current with trends, developments and operational changes that may impact staffing level and productivity
+ Update staffing model and recommend hiring plan to ensure the appropriate staffing level for achieving desired operational results
+ Participate in annual budget and multi\-year projection process for key operational areas assigned
* Expense Studies
+ Update in\-depth expense studies applicable to the full range of product and segment within Workplace Solutions
+ Prepare submission to Industry surveys regarding WS’s expenses
+ Maintain and update expense allocation process by segment and product as well as periodically calibrating the process to expense studies
* Develop and/or maintain work procedures and controls, and ensure effective applications
* Verbal and oral communication of analysis results to business partners and senior leaders with the aid of dashboards/graphs/charts/PowerPoint presentations
* Support ad\-hoc expense analysis
**What you will bring**
* Post\-secondary education in actuarial science, commerce, related field, and/or related work experience
* Excellent analytical and problem\-solving skills
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Excel and Access
* Experience in building complex financial models in Excel would be an asset
* Strong organizational and time management skills
* Committed to delivering results in the required timeframe
* Ability to communicate with all levels and work within a team environment
* Experience with data visualization application (e.g., PowerBI, Tableau, etc.) would be an asset
* Knowledge about GLH and GRS businesses an asset, but not required

The base salary for this position is between **$51,400** **\- $ 95,200** annually. This represents base salary only and does not represent other variable compensation components of our total compensation ( i.e. annual bonus, commission etc). gd-1009614822461,glassdoor,https://www.glassdoor.ca/job-listing/j?jl=1009614822461,,NATURAL GAS ODOURIZATION PROGRAM COORDINATOR,Manitoba Hydro,Winnipeg,2025-01-29,,direct_data,hourly,38.0,53.0,CAD,False,,,organic,,"**NATURAL GAS ODOURIZATION PROGRAM COORDINATOR**
**WINNIPEG, MB**
***Manitoba Hydro is consistently recognized as one of Manitoba's Top Employers!***
***Great Benefits***
* Competitive salary and benefits package.
* Defined\-benefit pension plan.
* Nine\-day work cycle which normally results in every other Monday off, providing for a balanced approach to work, family life
and community.
Manitoba Hydro is a leader among energy companies in North America, recognized for providing highly reliable service and
exceptional customer satisfaction. Join our team of Manitoba's best as we continue to build a company that supports innovation,
commitment, and customer service, while actively supporting a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace.
We are seeking an experienced and highly motivated Natural Gas Odourization Program Coordinator to join the Natural Gas System
Control \& Maintenance Department in Winnipeg, MB. You will perform various and complex duties associated with the odorization
program functions on a wide range of complex equipment and associated controls.
***Responsibilities:***
* Research and implement industry best practices for equipment and operation of odorization of natural gas systems, including
but not limited to pipeline ""pickling"" and odorant injection, monitoring, control, and measurement systems.
* Assist in the modernization of odorization testing methods, including but not limited to, use of chromatograph, DTEX units, and
analysis of chemical reports to determine proper odorant levels.
* Responsible for preparing technical monthly reports, compiling and analyzing historical operational information to optimize
odorant levels, testing frequency, and injection rates.
* Responsible for the odorant spill control program, odor control systems, and disposal of odorant\-related obsolete equipment.
* As subject matter expert, act as odorant spill response coordinator, provide training to field staff, recommend safe working
practices, and develop related documentation.
* Responsible for the maintenance of Transport Canada odorant trailer certifications to assure safe transportation of odorant,
inspection, maintenance, and audit of spill response materials and supplies.
* As subject matter expert, provide technical guidance and, as required, act as liaison between field staff, other Manitoba Hydro
departments, and manufacturers on matters pertaining to odorization concerns, apparatus problems, and odor concentration
process.
* Research, implement, and maintain methods to measure heat value, determine gas specifications, and odorization analysis to
ensure accuracy and compliance.
* Assist in the installation and calibration of odorant\-related equipment, including laboratory gas quality equipment.
* Research, implement, and maintain foreign particles samples methods to ensure system integrity.
* Develop documentation and provide training, coaching, auditing functions, and support to field personnel on natural gas safety
and odorization processes.
* Analyze odorization systems instrumentation and equipment data and historical failure information to produce equipment
end\-of\-life strategies and obsolescence plans or produce equipment failure reports.
* Participate in risk analysis work activities and develop engineering solutions for various natural gas odorization issues and to
improve systems reliability.
* Perform other related duties as assigned.
***Qualifications:***
* Successful completion of a two\-year Engineering Technology Diploma in Control and Instrumentation or a related field from a
recognized technical institution, eligible for CTTAM certification, with a minimum of two years of directly related experience.
* Knowledge and experience in chemistry process would be an asset.
MANITOBA HYDRO IS COMMITTED TO DIVERSITY AND EMPLOYMENT EQUITY
Reference Code: CO56958305\-01
* A solid understanding of gas properties and chemical instrumentation principles with two years of proven experience in
technical equipment maintenance.
* Considered an asset to have knowledge of applicable Manitoba Hydro and regulatory body standards, codes (Gas
Measurement, Odorization), policies, and procedures (TDG, WHIMIS, H2S Alive, Confined Space, Quality Assurance,
Environmental Practices).
* Must obtain and maintain a current Personnel Risk Assessment and a ""clear"" security rating in accordance to Manitoba Hydro
policy P513\.
* Must have an advanced knowledge of personal computers and related software.
* Proven ability to work independently, accept responsibility, and possess initiative to lead the gas specifications and
odorization program.
* Possess a valid Manitoba Class 5 Driver's Licence.
***Salary Range***
Starting salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience. The range for the classification is $38\.99\-$53\.97 Hourly,
***Apply Now!***
Visit www.hydro.mb.ca/careers to learn more about this position and to apply online.
The deadline for applications is **FEBRUARY 10, 2025**.
We thank you for your interest and will contact you if you are selected for an interview.

***during the recruitment process.***

River Ridge 1 Retirement Residence, a part of All Seniors Care Living Centres, seeks an experienced professional to lead our Health and Wellness program.
The successful candidate will be responsible for developing and implementing a comprehensive activity program that caters to the diverse needs and interests of our residents.
About the Role:
• Diploma in recreation/leisure studies is required.
• Course(s) in Gerontology and Activities/Recreation are advantageous.
• Proven leadership and organizational skills are essential.
• Excellent communication skills are necessary for effective collaboration with staff and residents.
• Prior experience working in a retirement residence, particularly with Independent and Assisted Living/Memory Care residents, is highly valued.
• Familiarity with program development principles is beneficial.

go-rPatIFPYjA43ffi3AAAAAA==,google,https://ca.linkedin.com/jobs/view/natural-gas-odourization-program-coordinator-at-manitoba-hydro-4137299005?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,NATURAL GAS ODOURIZATION PROGRAM COORDINATOR,Manitoba Hydro,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-18,,,,,,,False,,,,,"NATURAL GAS ODOURIZATION PROGRAM COORDINATOR
WINNIPEG, MB
Manitoba Hydro is consistently recognized as one of Manitoba's Top Employers!
Great Benefits
• Competitive salary and benefits package.
• Defined-benefit pension plan.
• Nine-day work cycle which normally results in every other Monday off, providing for a balanced approach to work, family life and community.

Manitoba Hydro is a leader among energy companies in North America, recognized for providing highly reliable service and exceptional customer satisfaction. Join our team of Manitoba's best as we continue to build a company that supports innovation, commitment, and customer service, while actively supporting a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace.

We are seeking an experienced and highly motivated Natural Gas Odourization Program Coordinator to join the Natural Gas System Control & Maintenance Department in Winnipeg, MB. You will perform various and complex duties associated with the odorization program functions on a wide range of complex equipment and associated controls.
Responsibilities:

• Research and implement industry best practices for equipment and operation of odorization of natural gas systems, including but not limited to pipeline ""pickling"" and odorant injection, monitoring, control, and measurement systems.
• Assist in the modernization of odorization testing methods, including but not limited to, use of chromatograph, DTEX units, and analysis of chemical reports to determine proper odorant levels.
• Responsible for preparing technical monthly reports, compiling and analyzing historical operational information to optimize odorant levels, testing frequency, and injection rates.
• Responsible for the odorant spill control program, odor control systems, and disposal of odorant-related obsolete equipment.
• As subject matter expert, act as odorant spill response coordinator, provide training to field staff, recommend safe working practices, and develop related documentation.

• Responsible for the maintenance of Transport Canada odorant trailer certifications to assure safe transportation of odorant, inspection, maintenance, and audit of spill response materials and supplies.

• As subject matter expert, provide technical guidance and, as required, act as liaison between field staff, other Manitoba Hydro departments, and manufacturers on matters pertaining to odorization concerns, apparatus problems, and odor concentration process.
• Research, implement, and maintain methods to measure heat value, determine gas specifications, and odorization analysis to ensure accuracy and compliance.
• Assist in the installation and calibration of odorant-related equipment, including laboratory gas quality equipment.
• Research, implement, and maintain foreign particles samples methods to ensure system integrity.
• Develop documentation and provide training, coaching, auditing functions, and support to field personnel on natural gas safety and odorization processes.

• Analyze odorization systems instrumentation and equipment data and historical failure information to produce equipment end-of-life strategies and obsolescence plans or produce equipment failure reports.
• Participate in risk analysis work activities and develop engineering solutions for various natural gas odorization issues and to improve systems reliability.
• Perform other related duties as assigned.
Qualifications:

• Successful completion of a two-year Engineering Technology Diploma in Control and Instrumentation or a related field from a recognized technical institution, eligible for CTTAM certification, with a minimum of two years of directly related experience.
• Knowledge and experience in chemistry process would be an asset.
• A solid understanding of gas properties and chemical instrumentation principles with two years of proven experience in technical equipment maintenance.

• Considered an asset to have knowledge of applicable Manitoba Hydro and regulatory body standards, codes (Gas Measurement, Odorization), policies, and procedures (TDG, WHIMIS, H2S Alive, Confined Space, Quality Assurance, Environmental Practices).
• Must obtain and maintain a current Personnel Risk Assessment and a ""clear"" security rating in accordance to Manitoba Hydro policy P513.
• Must have an advanced knowledge of personal computers and related software.
• Proven ability to work independently, accept responsibility, and possess initiative to lead the gas specifications and odorization program.
• Possess a valid Manitoba Class 5 Driver's Licence.
Salary Range
Starting salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience. The range for the classification is $38.99-$53.97 Hourly, $74,709.44-$103,415.78 Annually.
Apply Now!
Visit www.hydro.mb.ca/careers to learn more about this position and to apply online.
The deadline for applications is FEBRUARY 10, 2025.
We thank you for your interest and will contact you if you are selected for an interview.
This document is available in accessible formats upon request. Please let us know if you require any accommodations during the recruitment process.",,,,,,,,,program coordinator,2025-01-29

The University of Manitoba is committed to being a leader in sustainability. The Engagement and Projects Coordinator will support the mandate of the Office of Sustainability to assist the University in achieving its Sustainability Strategy and Climate Action Plan goals related to waste reduction and prevention. This role identifies opportunities to advance the organization’s goals in relation to waste reduction and prevention and collaborate with the university community to successfully deliver key projects and activities. - Must be able to work within time and budget constraints.
- Tact and diplomacy skills required.
- Strong written competencies including report and grant writing skills required.
- Strong verbal communication skills that support dialogue with the various campus stakeholders required.
- Strong partnership and relationship building skills, to work with multiple and diverse stakeholders with various mandates and differing viewpoints required.
- Must be able to work with graphic programs such as Adobe CS/Adobe Express and social media platforms.
- Knowledge of software systems to support the position.
- Proficiency with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, Projects) is required.
- Flexible and adaptable with troubleshooting and problem-solving abilities required.
- Ability to conduct research independently required.
- Ability to plan, organize and administer projects required.
- Ability to build relationships, and work collaboratively with the OOS team, university students, staff and faculty and community partners required.
- Ability to frame issues and design effective and energetic engagement with students, staff and faculty required.
- Use knowledge and experience to use influence to advance projects and other sustainability efforts.
- Ability to use creative thinking to identify and execute opportunities required.
- Ability to meet, engage and build collaborative relationships with stakeholders required.
- Satisfactory work record, including satisfactory attendance and punctuality, is required.
- Familiarity with the post-secondary setting is preferred.
• *Why the University of Manitoba?**

Along with being one of Manitoba’s top employers, we are proud to provide a collaborative and enriching work environment. In addition to a strong compensation package with a competitive salary, the University provides an exceptional workplace that includes:
- Comprehensive group benefits and pension plan.
- Competitive vacation time.
- Employee and Family Assistance Program.
- A full spectrum of professional development opportunities.
• *Closing Date: October 18, 2024**

The Family Support Coordinator provides direct services to families in their private residence through ongoing assessment, service intervention planning, crisis intervention, case management and Family Support Worker placements. The Coordinator also provides direct supervision to a team of In-Home Family Support Workers, including supervision on all aspects of Family Support Worker performance.
Listed below is a summary of the qualifications and responsibilities of the position.

- Supervise Family Support Workers within assigned case load, providing schedule details, coaching, feedback, performance assessments and performance management.
- Perform case management, referrals, and advocacy work on behalf of the clients with other service providers.
- Conduct home visits to follow up client progress and to ensure high quality of service provision.
- Assess for imminent risks to client family and Support workers. Develop a safety plan and/or referral to appropriate service to address imminent risk.
- Communicate within the agency and to community to improve access to suitable programs
- Bachelor of Social Work degree is required, with current registration with the Manitoba College of Social Workers.
- Minimum of two years’ related experience working in the social services sector with children, youth
and/or parents impacted by poverty, trauma, mental illness, intimate partner violence, child welfare involvement, addictions, disability, racism and colonization.
- Mental Health First Aid is required
- Case management and service planning experience is required.
- Deescalating Potentially Violent Situations or Non-Violent Crisis Intervention is an asset
- Experience working together with parents to build and strengthen parent-child relationships.
- Experience identifying and reporting indicators of child abuse or a child in need of protection
- Experience in supervising and coaching employees is preferred.
• _Other combinations of education and experience will be given due consideration._ _Current registration/membership with a relevant professional association or regulatory body is required._
- Knowledge of attachment theory and child development

- Knowledge and understanding of the impact of poverty, trauma, mental health-related issues, domestic violence, child welfare involvement, addictions, disability, racism and colonization on the functioning of families
- Ability to practice participant centered work and to work from a trauma informed approach
- Knowledge of local community needs and resources is required
- Demonstrated problem solving and crisis/risk assessment and intervention skills is required
- Demonstrated communication and conflict management skills including writing skills, listening and observation skills
- Proven ability to respectfully collaborate within a team
- Demonstrated time management skills and attention to detail
- Ability to deal with competing priorities and a busy environment

- Demonstration of cultural competency to work effectively and respectfully with people from different cultures and diverse backgrounds, including consideration of how social, historical contexts and imbalance of power have impacted people’s experiences
- Ability to practice cultural humility

zr-2--WORjrYy6fNV2dWWruOA,zip_recruiter,https://www.ziprecruiter.com/jobs//j?lvk=2--WORjrYy6fNV2dWWruOA,,Professional Intern - HR,Birchwood,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-28,contract,direct_data,hourly,21.0,21.0,CAD,,,,organic,,"**Professional Intern \- Human Resources, Birchwood**
**Full\-Time Summer Internship Position**
**Start date**: April (Flexible), **End Date**: End of August
**Closing date:** March 31, 2025

The Professional Intern – Human Resources works closely with several business operations within Birchwood. The successful candidate will assist the Learning and Development team, HR Services and Recruitment team with day\-to\-day activities within Birchwood. This role provides a valuable opportunity for individuals seeking to complete their Human Resources degree and pursue their CPHR designation.
This position will be a part of the Birchwood Professional Intern program where students will:
* Network and connect with other intern students
* Participate in leadership and professional development training
**What you will do:**
· Birchwood’s United Way campaign – design, develop a plan and help execute team member engagement
· Analyze data to uncover valuable insights that enhance learning and development strategies.
· Develop creative skills by designing engaging eLearning content for our team members.
· Gain hands\-on experience with HRIS and LMS systems, building sought\-after skills for today’s job market.
· Work on real projects that directly impact the success of our Sales \& Service teams.
· Collaborate with experienced HR and L\&D professionals, gaining mentorship and industry knowledge.
· Contribute to a dynamic and supportive work environment that strengthens your resume.
· Support recruitment efforts by posting job openings, screening resumes, and coordinating interviews.
· Assist with onboarding by preparing paperwork and organizing orientation materials.
**Qualifications:**
· Pursuing post\-secondary education in the field of Human Resources
· Knowledge of basic Human Resources theories and best practices
· Ability to troubleshoot quickly, identify trends and recommend solutions
· Ability to thrive in a collaborative environment and work on cross\-functional teams
· High attention to detail, proven time management, and organizational skills
· Working knowledge of Microsoft and other applications
· Valid 5F driver's license and own transportation to and from work as some Birchwood locations are not on a bus route
· The Learning and Development team is located out of the Birchwood Ford on Regent Ave

Birchwood is Manitoba’s largest automotive retailer network. Our 23 franchises include two state\-of\-the\-art collision repair centres and four Birchwood Credit Solutions locations, and offer sales, services, and parts to meet our customers’ automotive needs. We’re a recognized leader in the retail automotive industry, not only for our diverse workforce reflecting our community, but also for our unparalleled commitment to team members, customers, partners, and neighborhoods. At Birchwood, our days begin and end with gratitude, personal leadership, trust, respect, continuous improvement, and generosity.

Birchwood is committed to creating a diverse workplace and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status",,,,,,,,,program coordinator,2025-01-29

**Store Pricing Coordinator**

The individual in this position is responsible for the administrative functions of store operations and the integrity of store\-level pricing. Accordingly, you will report directly to the Assistant Store Manager and Store Manager.
Among the varied responsibilities of this challenging position are:
**Store Systems**
* Maintain store hardware systems, including point\-of\-sale systems, operational software programs and communication networks
* Perform regular cleaning and maintenance of equipment (e.g. cleaning MSR hardware)
* Perform regular system backups as per the established procedures and schedule
* Function as the primary store contact with the Information Technology department, including problem reporting and resolution, and systems and software deployment
* Maintain Problem Incident Report logs
* Responsible for printing in store signage and placing in store
* Responsible for pricing maintenance throughout the entire store
**Customer Service**
* Support the company mission statement, To Provide a Superior Shopping Experience Everyday

You will exhibit strong administrative skills, technical aptitude, combined with professionalism and be able to maintain confidentiality, especially regarding company pricing information. You will also practice effective communication, training, and coordination of efforts within the Store Systems and Administration team

If you have a demonstrated ability to work quickly and accurately under pressure and with little supervision, display a positive attitude and are solutions oriented, and practice strong communication skills, both verbal and written, and an ability to relate to all levels of personnel within the company, then we have the opportunity for you to excel!

* Company matched RRSPs (Helping you plan for your future
* Employee Discount Program (Sharing our success)
* Ongoing In\-House Training \& Education Courses (Lifelong learning)
* Employee Family Assistance Program (Free confidential counseling and support)
* Employee Recognition Program (Tangible rewards for great work!)
* Community Involvement (Giving back to our communities)
Applicants must be available to work a flexible schedule, Monday to Sunday and be available to start their shift as early as 5am everyday.
If you possess the necessary skills and expertise and would like to join an exciting team of professionals,

**Apply Now!**London Drugs is an equal opportunity employer dedicated to building an inclusive and diverse workforce. We are committed to building a company that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.
We will provide accommodations during the recruitment process upon request.

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work applicable to this position and are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required. Be advised, London Drugs DOES NOT use third party recruitment services.

London Drugs may collect, use, and/or disclose your personal information (including the information in this application) where it is reasonable for establishing, managing or terminating an employment relationship. This includes the use or disclosure of your personal information to persons inside or external to our organization, for the purpose of checking references or gathering other information to support an assessment of your candidacy.

To protect yourself, do not respond to unsolicited job offers from individuals or e\-mail addresses, and never disclose any sensitive details about your identity (including personal or financial) to anyone you do not know or trust or on any unverified website, or website you do not trust.",,,,,,,,,program coordinator,2025-01-29

gd-1009614506398,glassdoor,https://www.glassdoor.ca/job-listing/j?jl=1009614506398,,Project Manager - Commissioning,BGIS,Winnipeg,2025-01-29,,,,,,,False,,,organic,,"**Who We Are**

BGIS is a leading provider of customized facility management and real estate services. With our combined team of over 6, 500 globally, we relentlessly focus on enabling innovation through the services we deliver, while actively looking for new opportunities that will enable innovation for our clients’ businesses. Globally, we manage over 320 million square feet of client portfolios across 30,000\+ locations in North America, Europe, Middle East, Australia and Asia. Further information is available at www.bgis.com
**SUMMARY**

The **Commissioning Oversight Specialist** provides technical review and recommendations related to design, specifications, construction, and turnover of projects to ensure project quality and the effective integration into building operations and maintenance. The Commissioning Oversight Specialist works with technical team members, third party consultants, and contractors.
**KEY DUTIES \& RESPONSIBILITIES**
**Deliverables**
* Oversee the development, planning and implementation of the commissioning oversight process within project scope, schedule, budget and BGIS/Client procedural requirements.

* As a specialist, provide oversight on basis of design , specifications and drawings including commissioning specifications, contractor engagement, systems start\-up \& performance verification testing coordination, operations, and maintenance documentation.
**Team Support**

* Communicates with Commissioning Oversight Manager, Project Managers, Property Managers, BGIS technical personnel, 3rd party commissioning agents, consultants, and other resources to meet the commissioning oversight deliverables for a project.
* Works as a team to ensure continuous improvement of the commissioning oversight delivery process.
* Provides ongoing operational support to the property team, including building assessments and capital planning support.
* Supports facility operations teams with re\-commissioning and retro commissioning activities.
* Effectively communicates with both internal and external clients
* Skilled in technical report writing.
* Other duties as assigned
**KNOWLEDGE \& SKILLS**
* University or college degree in related field, electrical, mechanical, building systems engineering or building envelope is preferred.
* Experience in building operations.
* Experience in commissioning related activities.
* Familiar with National and Provincial building codes and standards
* Familiar with modern practices and typical building equipment/systems and site services.
* Strong understanding of the construction sector.
* Strong analytical and problem\-solving skills
* Ability to develop, analyze and understand complex processes
* Sound judgement skills based on observation of objective evidence
* Ability to perform with minimum direct supervision
* Ability to communicate in French and English is an asset
**Licenses and/or Professional Accreditation**
* Certified Commissioning Professional from BCxA, ASHRAE or equivalent certification or be able to apply to obtain such certification
* Member of Professional Engineers Association is an asset
* Engineering Technician or College diploma in Engineering technology or any other equivalent designation is an asset
* Valid Driver’s License

At BGIS we believe that diversity and inclusion is a key business driver, such that we never lose sight of its importance as it is woven into the fabric of our organization. We are committed to maintaining a barrier\-free recruitment process by providing equal employment opportunities through recruiting and retention of individuals of all backgrounds. We recognize that promoting diversity is an essential component of our continuing pursuit for organizational success!

BGIS is an equal opportunity employer and we welcome you to apply for a position with us! If you require accommodation during the recruitment process, please contact us at askHR . Upon request for accommodation, we will consult with the applicant in question and provide, or arrange for the provision of, a suitable accommodation in a manner that takes into account the applicant’s accessibility needs due to disability.",,https://www.glassdoor.ca/Overview/W-EI_IE1098670.htm,https://media.glassdoor.com/sql/1098670/bgis-squareLogo-1622038549271.png,,,,,,project manager,2025-01-29

gd-1009615505849,glassdoor,https://www.glassdoor.ca/job-listing/j?jl=1009615505849,,Project Manager,MOBIA Technology Innovations,Winnipeg,2025-01-29,,direct_data,yearly,70000.0,70000.0,CAD,False,,,organic,,"**Location:** Remote with Occasional Travel to Northwest Territories
About MOBIA

MOBIA Technology Innovations is a Canadian\-owned business and systems integrator with over 37 years of experience. We serve our clients and the Canadian market through five specialized business units: Broadband and Wireless Services, Managed Services, Hybrid Infrastructure Solutions, Cybersecurity, and Digital Transformation Services.
Our long\-standing relationships with industry\-leading technology partners enable us to deliver innovative solutions that drive positive business outcomes for our clients.
The Opportunity

MOBIA is currently recruiting a Project Manager to join our team remotely. This role is dynamic for a driven professional with strong leadership skills and a customer\-focused approach. You will ensure the successful execution of projects, delivering consistent, on\-time results of the highest quality.
**As a Project Manager, you will play a key role in:**
* Managing customer satisfaction.
* Overseeing project budgets, resource allocation, and vendor relationships.
* Planning, monitoring, and documenting all project phases.
* Delivering results using a traditional waterfall project management approach, ideal for telecom\-related projects.
This position emphasizes resource, task, budget/material, and vendor management. A technical aptitude and background in the Telco Voice/ISP/Broadband network space will be essential to your success.
Key Responsibilities
* Manage a portfolio of telecom technical projects, ranging from small\-scale initiatives to large, complex builds or commissioning projects.
* Develop and maintain project plans, including scope statements, delivery schedules, resource allocation, communication plans, goals, milestones, and deadlines.
* Track project stages, mitigate risks, and escalate roadblocks as necessary.
* Coordinate and oversee all tasks required to initiate, execute, and close projects.
* Provide detailed project documentation, reporting, and follow\-up for internal and external stakeholders.
* Facilitate regular customer meetings and maintain consistent communication with all team members, clients, and stakeholders.
* Ensure completed projects meet specifications and are thoroughly documented.
* Monitor project budgets, track material costs, and ensure compliance with invoice and financial forecasting requirements.
Skills and Qualifications
* A Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Science, or Engineering.
* Minimum of 5 years experience in Project Management, Project Coordination, or Implementation Management.
* Leadership experience and team coaching skills are an asset.
* Experience managing projects using Waterfall methodology
* Technical aptitude in the telecom industry are definite assets
* Proven ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously, including schedules and budgets.
* Exceptional communication, relationship\-building, and organizational skills to excel in a fast\-paced environment.
* Proficiency in the MS Office suite and the ability to quickly learn new software.
* Ability to travel as required.
* PMP certification is an asset.
* Bilingualism in French and English is an asset.
Why MOBIA?
At MOBIA, we empower businesses through digital transformation and thought leadership. Our innovative approach has earned us recognition, including:
* Canada’s Best Managed Companies 2023 – Deloitte
* Canada Regional Partner of the Year 2023 – Arctic Wolf
* Canada’s Top Growing Companies 2022 – The Globe and Mail
* Canada’s Top 10 Cyber Security Solutions Providers 2022 – The Cyber Security Review
What We Offer
We value the well\-being and professional growth of our team, providing:
* Comprehensive health and dental insurance.
* Employee Assistance Program.
* RRSP/TFSA contribution programs.
* Professional development opportunities.
* Regular company events fostering fun and community engagement.
Diversity and Inclusion
MOBIA is an Equal Opportunity Employer, celebrating diversity and fostering an inclusive environment for all employees.
How to Apply

We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Please note: MOBIA does not accept unsolicited resumes from third\-party vendors or recruitment agencies.",,https://www.glassdoor.ca/Overview/W-EI_IE835877.htm,https://media.glassdoor.com/sql/835877/mobia-technology-innovations-squarelogo-1461073842802.png,,,,,,project manager,2025-01-29

gd-1009615100926,glassdoor,https://www.glassdoor.ca/job-listing/j?jl=1009615100926,,IT Project Manager,HUB Technology Solutions Ltd,Winnipeg,2025-01-29,,direct_data,hourly,37.0,43.0,CAD,False,,,organic,,"**IT Project Manager**

Are you passionate about delivering IT solutions? Do you have the technical expertise and leadership skills to drive complex projects to success? We want to hear from you if you're ready to take the lead in delivering exceptional results with a dynamic team.
Are you a great communicator? Can you speak in a language people can easily understand and quickly make personal connections to grow relationships?
Do you enjoy a collaborative, supportive team environment? Do you have a passion for helping team members and clients solve problems?
Are you detail\-orientated and able to run and track multiple tasks simultaneously?
I know that is a lot of questions, but is your answer YES to all of them? Then we have the career for you if you have these must\-haves:
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, both written and verbal (in English).
* Client service expertise to deliver legendary service the HUB way.
* Exceptional ability to prioritize and execute tasks under pressure.
* University degree or college diploma in a related field or equivalent practical experience.
* At least five years of delivering IT infrastructure solutions (Microsoft Server, Networking, etc.).
* At least two years of project management experience.
If everything is good, then apply for this position. If you want to go “over the top,” include a link to a quick, less than 3\-minute personal introduction video.
Here is the traditional job posting if you are interested in reading it:
**Job Description**
**Title:** IT Project Manager
**Reports To:** Vice President of Operations
**Summary of Position:**

The IT Project Manager oversees projects and manages a small team, emphasizing strong communication and interpersonal skills. This role involves setting project objectives, planning technical delivery, fostering a positive team environment, and ensuring quality and customer satisfaction.
**Accountabilities:**
* Communicate effectively with project teams and stakeholders.
* Mentor and lead project team members.
* Foster key business relationships with clients and third\-party vendors.
* Lead all project phases from initiation to completion.
* Define and manage project scope, goals, budget and outcomes with leadership and stakeholders.
* Conduct project retrospectives to identify successful practices and areas for improvement.
* Adherence and understanding of HUB’s defined processes and help develop new ones.
* Maintaining a commitment to business quality and delivering legendary client service.
* Resolving client inquiries expeditiously and professionally.
* Efficient communication skills, in both written and verbal forms, to keep clients and management aware of work status, progress, and problem\-resolution
* Ensure accurate data entry in HUB’s Professional Service Automation software.
* Maintain a clean and safe work environment.
* Adhere to HUB’s timekeeping and attendance policies.
* Work at HUB’s office during regular business hours, Monday to Friday from 8:30 am to 5:00 pm CST except holidays.
* Uphold HUB’s Employee Code of Conduct.
**Qualifications:**
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, both written and verbal, in English.
* Client service expertise is essential.
* Exceptional ability to prioritize and execute tasks under pressure.
* At least five years of delivering IT infrastructure solutions (Microsoft Server, Networking, etc).
* University degree or college diploma in a related field or equivalent practical experience.
* At least two years of direct project management experience.
* PMI certifications are highly regarded.
* Microsoft Certifications (e.g. MCSE) are preferred.
* Valid Manitoba Class 5F Driver’s License and access to a vehicle for company use.
* Legal entitlement to work in Canada.
**Performance Evaluation:**
Performance evaluations will be conducted at least every 90 days, and potential adjustments to salary or compensation will be assessed by the company at its discretion.
**About Us:**
HUB began in 1991 because our CEO, Troy McLennan, realized how much business owners struggled to understand and use IT to their advantage. Instead, it was stressful and complicated.
As a business owner, Troy experienced sleepless nights, worrying about technology, frustrated about unresolved issues, and stressed about investing in tech but not getting value from it.

We are a team of innovative information technology experts committed to removing your IT burden and communicating with you in a language you can understand. Our motto is: Technology is complicated. It is hard for you to keep up, and that is frustrating. HUB Technology Solutions makes technology simple and stress\-free.

If you want to demonstrate your attention to detail, add the word ""kaizen"" anywhere in our cover letter or resume.",,https://www.glassdoor.ca/Overview/W-EI_IE3475655.htm,,,,,,,project manager,2025-01-29

Director of PMO Job Overview

The Director of Project Management Office will play a critical role in shaping and overseeing the company's entire project management function. Key responsibilities include developing clear strategies, implementing best practices, and ensuring seamless delivery of all client-facing projects and programs.
Key Responsibilities:

• Ensure consistent execution, fostering collaboration among various teams and stakeholders, regardless of project size, complexity, or budget.

• Develop and manage PMO budgets, planning resources for multiple concurrent projects.
• Oversee the effective utilization of PSA and project management tools to monitor cost, quality, and timelines.
• Performance Management & Reporting
• Track key performance metrics, producing clear and concise reports for executive leadership, clients, and other stakeholders.
• Regularly review project milestones, budgets, and deliverables to identify risks early and propose corrective actions as needed.
• Risk & Compliance Management
• Integrate robust risk assessment and mitigation strategies into every project, especially those with security or regulatory requirements.
• Ensure alignment with industry guidelines, particularly for MSSP environments where cybersecurity and data protection are critical.
• Team Leadership & Mentorship
• Recruit, develop, and inspire a high-performing PMO team, providing coaching and career advancement opportunities.
• Encourage a culture of continuous learning, innovation, and accountability, helping staff adapt to evolving business and technology needs.
• Stakeholder Engagement & Communication
• Maintain strong relationships with senior leadership, clients, and third-party partners, keeping them informed of project status, risks, and outcomes.
• Collaborate across departments, making sure diverse project teams share knowledge, leverage best practices, and work toward common objectives.
• Continuous Improvement & Innovation
• Stay updated on emerging trends, tools, and methodologies in PMO management, IT services, and cybersecurity.
• Promote forward-thinking solutions and adaptive strategies, ensuring the PMO evolves alongside the company's growth and market changes.",,,,,,,,,project manager,2025-01-29

go-azaYtLkNgJk6WOe3AAAAAA==,google,https://ca.bebee.com/job/46fd49d810b7e2e8d6c0c1f9dfdd8504?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,Telecommunications Product Lifecycle Manager,Valley Fiber Ltd,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-17,,,,,,,False,,,,,"Job Title: Product Manager – Telecommunications Lifecycle Management
Overview:

Valley Fiber Ltd. is a leading provider of telecommunications services, and we're seeking an experienced Product Manager to lead our product lifecycle management efforts. This role involves driving product strategy, innovation, and ensuring seamless execution of product changes that enhance customer experience and align with business goals.
Key Responsibilities:

1. Lead the end-to-end management of products, from concept through to launch, growth, maturity, and eventual phase-out. Ensure that product performance is continually assessed and optimized based on customer feedback and market trends.

2. Define and develop long-term product strategies that align with business objectives and customer needs. Identify opportunities for innovation, product enhancement, and differentiation in the market.

3. Map the customer journey to better understand touchpoints and areas where product experience can be improved. Work closely with cross-functional teams to enhance each stage of the journey and ensure product offerings are aligned with customer expectations.

4. Lead the creation and execution of go-to-market plans for new product features, enhancements, or changes. Coordinate with Sales, Marketing, and Customer Care teams to ensure smooth product launches and successful integration into the existing customer base.

5. Identify areas for product improvement, leveraging customer data, analytics, and industry trends. Drive continuous product optimization to enhance performance, customer satisfaction, and competitive positioning.

6. Conduct thorough market research and competitive analysis to inform product strategy. Understand industry trends, competitor offerings, and customer preferences to make informed decisions about product direction.

7. Act as the primary liaison between Product, Sales, Marketing, and Customer Care teams to ensure alignment on product changes, customer impact, and go-to-market plans. Work closely with engineering and operations to ensure product changes are implemented smoothly and effectively.

8. Develop and manage communication plans for product changes that impact customers. Ensure all stakeholders are informed and prepared to support the changes, and that customers are clearly informed of product updates in a timely and customer-centric manner.
Requirements:
• Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, Product Management, or related field

• You work with and provide support to other members of the Remediation Program Management Group in sharing health and safety, project management, project completion and client service responsibilities

• Strong field experience is considered an asset

WSP is one of the world's leading professional services firms. Our purpose is to future proof our cities and environments.

Here is the traditional job posting if you are interested in reading it:
Job Description
Title:IT Project Manager
Reports To:Vice President of Operations
Summary of Position:

The IT Project Manager oversees projects and manages a small team, emphasizing strong communication and interpersonal skills. This role involves setting project objectives, planning technical delivery, fostering a positive team environment, and ensuring quality and customer satisfaction.
Accountabilities:
Communicate effectively with project teams and stakeholders.
Mentor and lead project team members.
Foster key business relationships with clients and third-party vendors.
Lead all project phases from initiation to completion.
Define and manage project scope, goals, budget and outcomes with leadership and stakeholders.
Conduct project retrospectives to identify successful practices and areas for improvement.
Adherence and understanding of HUBs defined processes and help develop new ones.
Maintaining a commitment to business quality and delivering legendary client service.
Resolving client inquiries expeditiously and professionally.
Efficient communication skills, in both written and verbal forms, to keep clients and management aware of work status, progress, and problem-resolution
Ensure accurate data entry in HUBs Professional Service Automation software.
Maintain a clean and safe work environment.
Adhere to HUBs timekeeping and attendance policies.
Work at HUBs office during regular business hours, Monday to Friday from 8:30 am to 5:00 pm CST except holidays.
Uphold HUBs Employee Code of Conduct.
Qualifications:
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, both written and verbal, in English.
Client service expertise is essential.
Exceptional ability to prioritize and execute tasks under pressure.
At least five years of delivering IT infrastructure solutions (Microsoft Server, Networking, etc).
University degree or college diploma in a related field or equivalent practical experience.
At least two years of direct project management experience.
PMI certifications are highly regarded.
Microsoft Certifications (e.g. MCSE) are preferred.
Valid Manitoba Class 5F Drivers License and access to a vehicle for company use.
Legal entitlement to work in Canada.
Performance Evaluation:
Performance evaluations will be conducted at least every 90 days, and potential adjustments to salary or compensation will be assessed by the company at its discretion.
About Us:
HUB began in 1991 because our CEO, Troy McLennan, realized how much business owners struggled to understand and use IT to their advantage. Instead, it was stressful and complicated.
As a business owner, Troy experienced sleepless nights, worrying about technology, frustrated about unresolved issues, and stressed about investing in tech but not getting value from it.

We are a team of innovative information technology experts committed to removing your IT burden and communicating with you in a language you can understand. Our motto is: Technology is complicated. It is hard for you to keep up, and that is frustrating. HUB Technology Solutions makes technology simple and stress-free.
