Reporting to the Finance Director, the Facilities Maintenance Manager will be responsible for ensuring that MSP facilities are operated and maintained in a safe, efficient and effective manner. Managing supplies, cleaning and staff. This position will have a lead role in project management of structural capital projects (new and existing buildings).This position works collaboratively with internal stakeholders, trade / construction professionals.
• *KEY RESULT AREAS**
• *Daily Maintenance Services**

Lead and supervise delivery of highly efficient and effective daily maintenance services for MSP buildings. Fully understand the operation, features, strengths, and shortcomings of existing facilities.

Make recommendations that will increase ease of use for MSP staff and clients. Develop metrics and key performance indicators for maintenance services. Work cooperatively to ensure cohesive and consistent customer service. Manage annual operating budget for facility repairs and maintenance.
• *Agency-Wide Maintenance Plan**

Lead in development of a proactive maintenance plan that describes current conditions of MSP buildings and facilities. The plan shall make recommendations for each building and its individual building systems with respect to projected remaining service life and estimated costs to repair, renovate, or replace. Keep current and resulting plan to keep short term, mid-range, and long-range recommendations with respect to maintenance efforts and corresponding annual expenditures required to maintain MSP facilities at a high level.

Be a champion for the development within MSP of a detailed facilities management database of MSP owned/operated buildings. The database shall track size and detailed condition within each building.
These databases shall be maintained current at all times. Database will provide a variety of facilities space utilization and conditions reports to the Finance Director.

Create and routinely provide reports that measure and monitor the maintenance activities and costs.

Track maintenance and facility improvement projects by type and regularly report progress on schedules, costs, scope etc. Make recommendations for continual improvement. Be active in professional organizations to learn of new best practices.

go-CZ3yrlwDTdHPkkdyAAAAAA==,google,https://ca.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-proposal-writer-at-colliers-project-leaders-canada-4099649635?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,Senior Proposal Writer,Colliers Project Leaders | Canada,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-14,,,,,,,False,,,,,"Overview

At Colliers Project Leaders, we de liver capital project solutions to fulfill our clients’ needs across the built environment. The work we do makes a difference in communities and for the people who live there. We have a passion for it.

Our commitment to realizing our clients' vision inspires us to look beyond the immediate – to the possibilities of what we can achieve together. We are 18,000 projects and counting – improving lives and helping shape the growth of sustainable, progressive and inclusive communities.
Your role
Join our team as a Senior Proposal Writer with our Proposals Team!

As the Senior Proposal Writer, you are responsible for telling the story of how we can help our clients meet their real property needs. You lead the timely delivery of proposals for various internal teams, writing, editing, coordinating, and formatting content into clear submissions that are responsive to the client’s requirements.

Using your organizational and communication skills, you manage the many moving parts of a submission, by working effectively with a wide range of people, developing strong working relationships with your teams as you do so.
Responsibilities
• Lead the development of professional, high-quality, compelling proposals that effectively educate and inspire action on the part of customers and prospects

• Strategically manage the proposal response from receipt of RFP to the delivery of the final product, including writing content and editing submissions to ensure the proposal is accurate, concise, and effective
• Define and manage the proposal response plan, schedule, and internal communications associated with the proposal development including follow-up with the contributors
• Identify and voice concerns associated with the proposal preparation process and response, as related to issues of compliance and risk
• Actively participate in and lead proposal strategy meetings, researching internal and external information, and distilling into win strategies to be executed in your proposal response
• Participate in trend analysis, proposal debriefings and other similar opportunities to ensure continuous quality improvement and to identify enhancements for proposal content and process
• Support collaboration across the Proposal Team, through updates to our proposal systems and databases of content
Qualifications

• Minimum of 5 years of experience in in reading and responding to Request for Proposal (RFP) documents and developing proposal / bid submissions that respond to their requirements, ideally in the Engineering, Procurement and Construction (EPC) and/or the professional services industries
• A post-secondary education in Communications, Marketing, English, Writing, Journalism or equivalent field of study
• Advanced working knowledge of MS Office products with strong Word proficiency
• Exceptional business writing, editing, and proofreading skills
• Working knowledge of Adobe Creative Suites software, in particular InDesign, is a strong asset.
Approximate Base Salary Range for Role: $80,000 CAD to $95,000 CAD.

Base Salary pay ranges are determined by role, level, and location and reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire base salaries for the position. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Annual bonus opportunities are in addition to base salary.

Don’t have every single qualification? We know that some people are less likely to apply for a job unless they are a perfect match. At Colliers Project Leaders, we’re not looking for “perfect matches.” We’re looking to welcome people to our diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace. So, if you’re excited about this role but don’t have every single qualification, we encourage you to apply anyway. Whether it’s this role or another one, you may be just the right candidate.
What You Can Expect
• An opportunity to truly impact our communities
• A flexible work environment
• A comprehensive onboarding experience
• Significant professional development, training, and a mentorship program
• A paid volunteer day
• An environment where people feel welcome, heard and included, regardless of their differences
• And much more!
Join our team of difference-makers and help shape the growth of dynamic communities.
Disclaimer

Colliers Project Leaders is part of Colliers (NASDAQ, TSX: CIGI), a leading diversified professional services and investment management company, with more than 17,000 professionals operating in 63 countries.
Colliers Project Leaders has suspended our COVID-19 vaccination requirement. In circumstances where our clients have a different COVID-19 vaccination policy, the Clients’ requirements will supersede.

Colliers Project Leaders is an equal opportunity employer and celebrates diversity in its workforce. Colliers encourages applications from all qualified individuals and will accommodate applicants' disability-related needs, up to the point of undue hardship, throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. If you require a disability-related accommodation to participate in the recruitment process, please advise the assigned Talent Acquisition Business Partner.
Colliers Project Leaders standard recruitment process requires applicants to be subjected to formal background and reference checks prior to their hiring.",,,,,,,,,project manager,2025-01-29

go-wCt_g-dIf-HXygFcAAAAAA==,google,"https://www.ziprecruiter.com/c/Brookfield-Global-Integrated-Solutions-(BGIS)/Job/Project-Manager-Commissioning/-in-Winnipeg,MB?jid=01143cef9ce1c2ca&utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic",,Project Manager - Commissioning,Brookfield Global Integrated Solutions (BGIS),"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-13,contract,,,,,,False,,,,,"Who We Are

BGIS is a leading provider of customized facility management and real estate services. With our combined team of over 6, 500 globally, we relentlessly focus on enabling innovation through the services we deliver, while actively looking for new opportunities that will enable innovation for our clients' businesses. Globally, we manage over 320 million square feet of client portfolios across 30,000+ locations in North America, Europe, Middle East, Australia and Asia. Further information is available at www.bgis.com
SUMMARY

The Commissioning Oversight Specialist provides technical review and recommendations related to design, specifications, construction, and turnover of projects to ensure project quality and the effective integration into building operations and maintenance. The Commissioning Oversight Specialist works with technical team members, third party consultants, and contractors.
KEY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
Deliverables
• Oversee the development, planning and implementation of the commissioning oversight process within project scope, schedule, budget and BGIS/Client procedural requirements.

• As a specialist, provide oversight on basis of design , specifications and drawings including commissioning specifications, contractor engagement, systems start-up & performance verification testing coordination, operations, and maintenance documentation.
Team Support

• Communicates with Commissioning Oversight Manager, Project Managers, Property Managers, BGIS technical personnel, 3rd party commissioning agents, consultants, and other resources to meet the commissioning oversight deliverables for a project.
• Works as a team to ensure continuous improvement of the commissioning oversight delivery process.
• Provides ongoing operational support to the property team, including building assessments and capital planning support.
• Supports facility operations teams with re-commissioning and retro commissioning activities.
• Effectively communicates with both internal and external clients
• Skilled in technical report writing.
• Other duties as assigned
KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS
• University or college degree in related field, electrical, mechanical, building systems engineering or building envelope is preferred.
• Experience in building operations.
• Experience in commissioning related activities.
• Familiar with National and Provincial building codes and standards
• Familiar with modern practices and typical building equipment/systems and site services.
• Strong understanding of the construction sector.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
• Ability to develop, analyze and understand complex processes
• Sound judgement skills based on observation of objective evidence
• Ability to perform with minimum direct supervision
• Ability to communicate in French and English is an asset
Licenses and/or Professional Accreditation
• Certified Commissioning Professional from BCxA, ASHRAE or equivalent certification or be able to apply to obtain such certification
• Member of Professional Engineers Association is an asset
• Engineering Technician or College diploma in Engineering technology or any other equivalent designation is an asset
• Valid Driver's License

go-85kEaAtksQRcdLTAAAAAAA==,google,https://ca.trabajo.org/job-2891-b4d22119783b527c3ea33898e7736e71?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,Restoration Project Manager,"Paul Davis Winnipeg, MB","Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-13,,,,,,,True,,,,,"**About us**

Across North America, Paul Davis is helping families and businesses repair their properties and pick up the pieces following an emergency. • *Position**: Restoration Project Manager
• *Reports To**:General Manager
• *General Description**

As a Project Manager, you will manage the renovation, as well as control and communicate the budget effectively. This means you will spend a good deal of time in the field to see your projects get completed properly. You will act as a liaison between the Insurance Company and the Property Owner/Manager, managing the claim from start to finish, ensuring each project runs smoothly. This position requires an individual who is organized and committed to being successful. Strong leadership and people management skills are a must as is the ability to communicate effectively with both clients and management.

Due to the nature of our work and the demands of our clients, flexible working hours are required though a typical work week is Monday-Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. You will also be required to participate in the weekly On-Call Rotation.
• *Nature & Scope**
Performs a variety of in duties including:
- Accept claims directly from insurance adjusters and brokers
- Perform site inspections, assess damages, accurately measure and sketch areas, take photos and upload to Encircle software, and ensure all necessary information is collected
- Educate homeowners on the claim process and give the realistic timeline expectations of when the emergency and rebuild work will be completed
- Ensure industry KPIs are met or exceeded
- Create an estimate for each job in Xactimate
- Daily communication with the Project Managers Assistant on job updates, budgets, concerns, and to ensure timelines are being met
- Manage multiple projects at a time
- Perform site visits and ensure safety standards are met
- Perform bi-weekly Work in Progress meetings and Compliance meetings with the Project Managers Assistant
- Build new relationships with the industry personnel such as insurance adjusters, brokers, and subtrades
- Remain current with market pricing for materials, supplies & labour
- Review all final estimates to confirm accuracy of work completed
- Manage costs to ensure projects are completed on budget
- Assist accounting staff with unpaid invoices including following up with clients on overdue accounts
- Send job files for invoicing
• *Team Compensation and Benefits**:
- Ongoing Leadership Development Program and industry events
- One on One mentorship
- Access to Paul Davis University and regular training opportunities
- Cell phone and laptop provided by company
- Health, dental and vision insurance
- Vacation time
- Annual Salary - wage to be discussed, based on experience
- Bonus Pay - based on performance
• *Team Qualifications (Requirements)**:
- Dedication to customer service
- Must be able to prioritize and manage time
- Excellent written and verbal communication skills
- Problem solving and priority management skills.
- Fluent in English
- Valid driver's license
- Have the ability to work overtime, if needed
- Minimum 2 years of restoration and/or construction experience
- Minimum 1 year of previous project management experience
- Proficiency using Outlook, Encircle, Xactanalysis, and Xactimate
- IICRC Certifications are an asset
Work remotely
- No
• *Job Types**: Full-time, Permanent

At Wood Products Unlimited, we take pride in being more than just a woodworking company in Winnipeg. We specialize in manufacturing and installing custom kitchens, closets, and millwork. Our commitment to excellence extends beyond our products. We believe in valuing people and relationships.

For us, business is all about building and nurturing relationships. We understand that work is an essential part of life, but life is not all about work. That's why we've implemented a 10-hour, four-day workweek. Our work hours run from Monday to Thursday, allowing our team to enjoy Fridays off. We've made this choice to reduce driving time, provide more personal time for our dedicated employees, and foster a balanced and fulfilling life.
• *Position Details**:

Full-time, 6-Month Term, Monday to Thursday, 7:00 am - 5:00 pm (Schedule hours and wages are negotiable). The temporary position could potentially turn into a permanent role based on performance and business needs.
• *Responsibilities**:
- Create precise shop drawings using Mozaik based on design team input and site measurements.
- Detect and rectify any issues that may arise during the drawing preparation process.
- Utilize drawings to prepare quotes and actively participate in the quoting process with customers.
- Order materials necessary for projects.
- Maintain effective communication with fellow drafters, production staff, residential, and commercial customers.
• *Skills and Abilities**:
- Proficiency in technical drawing software, such as AutoCAD or Mozaik (reflecting the software used at WPU).
- Experience creating shop drawings and architectural drawings.
- Understanding of furniture design and architectural principles.
- Ability to interpret and work from technical specifications and blueprints.
- Strong attention to detail and accuracy in drawings.
- Strong communication skills with the capacity to collaborate effectively within a team.
- Experience with 3D modeling software is a plus.
- Ideally, possess a diploma or certificate in drafting or a related field.

If you are a skilled Drafter and Project Coordinator looking to join a dynamic team in the woodworking industry, we encourage you to apply. Your expertise will play a vital role in delivering high-quality custom furniture and cabinetry projects for our clients. We look forward to having you on board to help us achieve our mission of customer satisfaction and excellence in woodworking.
• *Salary**: From $18.00 per hour
• *Benefits**:
- Company events
- Flexible schedule
- On-site parking
Flexible Language Requirement:
- French not required
Schedule:
- 10 hour shift
- Day shift
Supplemental pay types:
- Overtime pay

- Drafting: 1 year (required)
Work Location: In person",,,,,,,,,project manager,2025-01-29

Are you a great communicator? Can you speak in a language people can easily understand and quickly make personal connections to grow relationships?
Do you enjoy a collaborative, supportive team environment? Do you have a passion for helping team members and clients solve problems?
Are you detail\-orientated and able to run and track multiple tasks simultaneously?
I know that is a lot of questions, but is your answer YES to all of them? Then we have the career for you if you have these must\-haves:
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, both written and verbal (in English).
* Client service expertise to deliver legendary service the HUB way.
* Exceptional ability to prioritize and execute tasks under pressure.
* University degree or college diploma in a related field or equivalent practical experience.
* At least five years of delivering IT infrastructure solutions (Microsoft Server, Networking, etc.).
* At least two years of project management experience.
If everything is good, then apply for this position. If you want to go “over the top,” include a link to a quick, less than 3\-minute personal introduction video.
Here is the traditional job posting if you are interested in reading it:
**Job Description**
**Title:** IT Project Manager
**Reports To:** Vice President of Operations
**Summary of Position:**

The IT Project Manager oversees projects and manages a small team, emphasizing strong communication and interpersonal skills. This role involves setting project objectives, planning technical delivery, fostering a positive team environment, and ensuring quality and customer satisfaction.
**Accountabilities:**
* Communicate effectively with project teams and stakeholders.
* Mentor and lead project team members.
* Foster key business relationships with clients and third\-party vendors.
* Lead all project phases from initiation to completion.
* Define and manage project scope, goals, budget and outcomes with leadership and stakeholders.
* Conduct project retrospectives to identify successful practices and areas for improvement.
* Adherence and understanding of HUB’s defined processes and help develop new ones.
* Maintaining a commitment to business quality and delivering legendary client service.
* Resolving client inquiries expeditiously and professionally.
* Efficient communication skills, in both written and verbal forms, to keep clients and management aware of work status, progress, and problem\-resolution
* Ensure accurate data entry in HUB’s Professional Service Automation software.
* Maintain a clean and safe work environment.
* Adhere to HUB’s timekeeping and attendance policies.
* Work at HUB’s office during regular business hours, Monday to Friday from 8:30 am to 5:00 pm CST except holidays.
* Uphold HUB’s Employee Code of Conduct.
**Qualifications:**
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, both written and verbal, in English.
* Client service expertise is essential.
* Exceptional ability to prioritize and execute tasks under pressure.
* At least five years of delivering IT infrastructure solutions (Microsoft Server, Networking, etc).
* University degree or college diploma in a related field or equivalent practical experience.
* At least two years of direct project management experience.
* PMI certifications are highly regarded.
* Microsoft Certifications (e.g. MCSE) are preferred.
* Valid Manitoba Class 5F Driver’s License and access to a vehicle for company use.
* Legal entitlement to work in Canada.
**Performance Evaluation:**
Performance evaluations will be conducted at least every 90 days, and potential adjustments to salary or compensation will be assessed by the company at its discretion.
**About Us:**
HUB began in 1991 because our CEO, Troy McLennan, realized how much business owners struggled to understand and use IT to their advantage. Instead, it was stressful and complicated.
As a business owner, Troy experienced sleepless nights, worrying about technology, frustrated about unresolved issues, and stressed about investing in tech but not getting value from it.

We are a team of innovative information technology experts committed to removing your IT burden and communicating with you in a language you can understand. Our motto is: Technology is complicated. It is hard for you to keep up, and that is frustrating. HUB Technology Solutions makes technology simple and stress\-free.

If you want to demonstrate your attention to detail, add the word ""kaizen"" anywhere in our cover letter or resume.",,https://ca.indeed.com/cmp/Hub-Technology-Solutions-Ltd,,,,,,,project manager,2025-01-29

Our Client is an industry leader in the drywall, roofing and siding business and is looking to bring on a leader for their siding division based in Edmonton, Alberta! **Operations Manager \- Siding** is responsible for overseeing and optimizing the operations of the siding division, driving its growth and ensuring seamless project execution. This role focuses on managing day\-to\-day activities, leading Project Managers, Site Supervisors, Labor teams, and Estimators, while implementing strategies to enhance productivity, profitability, and customer satisfaction.

With an emphasis on residential and commercial projects, the Operations Manager will collaborate with Architects, Specifiers, Developers, Contractors, Engineers, and Designers to support project requirements and position the company as a leader in siding solutions. As the primary liaison with vendor representatives, the role ensures strong partnerships to achieve competitive pricing and exceptional quality standards.
**Key Responsibilities**
**Operational Leadership**
* Oversee all aspects of the siding division's operations, including scheduling, inventory management, custom order processing, and project coordination.
* Develop and implement operational strategies to enhance efficiency, ensure on\-time delivery, and exceed client expectations.
* Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure operational success and identify areas for improvement.
* Ensure compliance with health and safety standards across all projects and worksites.
* Manage vendor relationships, ensuring timely procurement of materials at competitive prices.
**Project Management**
* Supervise the planning and execution of siding projects from inception to completion, ensuring alignment with budgets, timelines, and quality standards.
* Coordinate with project coordinators, site supervisors, and labor teams to ensure smooth project workflows.
* Oversee estimators in preparing accurate take\-offs and quotes for siding projects.
* Address project challenges proactively, resolving issues to maintain client satisfaction and operational efficiency.
**Strategic Growth**
* Contribute to the division’s growth by identifying new business opportunities and areas for market expansion.
* Collaborate with senior management to align operational goals with overall business objectives.
* Drive innovation within the division by exploring new products, technologies, and methods to enhance competitiveness.
**Requirements**
**Experience**
* 10\+ years of experience in operations management, construction, or a related field, with a proven track record of delivering results in a fast\-paced environment.
* Extensive experience in project management, preferably within the building materials, siding, or construction industry.
* Strong project management skills, with the ability to oversee multiple projects simultaneously.
* Solid understanding of construction processes, siding products, and building methods is highly desirable.
* Demonstrated ability to lead and inspire teams, fostering a culture of accountability and excellence.
* Strong relationship\-building skills to work effectively with internal teams, clients, and vendors.
* Proficient in MS Office, CRM, and ERP systems.
* Highly organized with strong time management and problem\-solving skills.
**Education and Training**
* Post\-secondary education in business, construction management, or a related field preferred.
* Formal training in operations, project management, or construction is an asset.
**Compensation and Benefits**
* Competitive base salary.
* Annual incentive plan tied to company performance.
* Comprehensive health benefits.
* Vehicle allowance.",,,,,,,,,project manager,2025-01-29

zr-x13PNK7jpSmZeQ0pwJ5tEQ,zip_recruiter,https://www.ziprecruiter.com/jobs//j?lvk=x13PNK7jpSmZeQ0pwJ5tEQ,,IT Project Manager,HUB Technology Solutions Ltd,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-28,fulltime,,,,,,,,,organic,,"Salary: $37 to $43/hour
**IT Project Manager**

Are you passionate about delivering IT solutions? Do you have the technical expertise and leadership skills to drive complex projects to success? We want to hear from you if you're ready to take the lead in delivering exceptional results with a dynamic team.
Are you a great communicator? Can you speak in a language people can easily understand and quickly make personal connections to grow relationships?
Do you enjoy a collaborative, supportive team environment? Do you have a passion for helping team members and clients solve problems?
Are you detail\-orientated and able to run and track multiple tasks simultaneously?
I know that is a lot of questions, but is your answer YES to all of them? Then we have the career for you if you have these must\-haves:
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, both written and verbal (in English).
Client service expertise to deliver legendary service the HUB way.
Exceptional ability to prioritize and execute tasks under pressure.
University degree or college diploma in a related field or equivalent practical experience.
At least five years of delivering IT infrastructure solutions (Microsoft Server, Networking, etc.).
At least two years of project management experience.
If everything is good, then apply for this position.If you want to go over the top, include a link to a quick, less than 3\-minute personal introduction video.
Here is the traditional job posting if you are interested in reading it:
**Job Description**
**Title:**IT Project Manager
**Reports To:**Vice President of Operations
**Summary of Position:**

The IT Project Manager oversees projects and manages a small team, emphasizing strong communication and interpersonal skills. This role involves setting project objectives, planning technical delivery, fostering a positive team environment, and ensuring quality and customer satisfaction.
**Accountabilities:**
Communicate effectively with project teams and stakeholders.
Mentor and lead project team members.
Foster key business relationships with clients and third\-party vendors.
Lead all project phases from initiation to completion.
Define and manage project scope, goals, budget and outcomes with leadership and stakeholders.
Conduct project retrospectives to identify successful practices and areas for improvement.
Adherence and understanding of HUBs defined processes and help develop new ones.
Maintaining a commitment to business quality and delivering legendary client service.
Resolving client inquiries expeditiously and professionally.
Efficient communication skills, in both written and verbal forms, to keep clients and management aware of work status, progress, and problem\-resolution
Ensure accurate data entry in HUBs Professional Service Automation software.
Maintain a clean and safe work environment.
Adhere to HUBs timekeeping and attendance policies.
Work at HUBs office during regular business hours, Monday to Friday from 8:30 am to 5:00 pm CST except holidays.
Uphold HUBs Employee Code of Conduct.
**Qualifications:**
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, both written and verbal, in English.
Client service expertise is essential.
Exceptional ability to prioritize and execute tasks under pressure.
At least five years of delivering IT infrastructure solutions (Microsoft Server, Networking, etc).
University degree or college diploma in a related field or equivalent practical experience.
At least two years of direct project management experience.
PMI certifications are highly regarded.
Microsoft Certifications (e.g. MCSE) are preferred.
Valid Manitoba Class 5F Drivers License and access to a vehicle for company use.
Legal entitlement to work in Canada.
**Performance Evaluation:**
Performance evaluations will be conducted at least every 90 days, and potential adjustments to salary or compensation will be assessed by the company at its discretion.
**About Us:**
HUB began in 1991 because our CEO, Troy McLennan, realized how much business owners struggled to understand and use IT to their advantage. Instead, it was stressful and complicated.
As a business owner, Troy experienced sleepless nights, worrying about technology, frustrated about unresolved issues, and stressed about investing in tech but not getting value from it.

We are a team of innovative information technology experts committed to removing your IT burden and communicating with you in a language you can understand. Our motto is: Technology is complicated. It is hard for you to keep up, and that is frustrating. HUB Technology Solutions makes technology simple and stress\-free.
If you want to demonstrate your attention to detail, add the word ""kaizen"" anywhere in our cover letter or resume.",,,,,,,,,project manager,2025-01-29

zr-c2qRaIzMFzkUVd0K6d9RdQ,zip_recruiter,https://www.ziprecruiter.com/jobs//j?lvk=c2qRaIzMFzkUVd0K6d9RdQ,,Engineering Manager for IAM (Identity and Access Management),Canonical - Jobs,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-28,,,,,,,,,,organic,,"Canonical is seeking an experienced engineering manager to build high\-performing Go and Python services and secure identity and access management solutions that will be used across all company products. From Ubuntu One SSO to Juju, LXD and MAAS your team will define the way Canonical users, clients and community members access their favorite open source applications.

This is an opportunity for a software engineering manager with a passion for distributed systems operations to help us transform the future of identity management at Canonical. Experience in the identity and access management (IAM) field is desirable but not required. You will work with upstream open source projects, alongside internal teams to deliver high quality software that can be deployed on bare metal, public cloud and Kubernetes.

As the identity team engineering manager you will bring significant software development experience, Kubernetes knowledge and a keen eye for software design, performance and security. You will be responsible for working with product management to define the technical vision for the products, managing the team backlog, reviewing code and coaching younger team members.

You will also be involved in all the aspects of the software development process: you will design software, write high\-quality code and tests, provide insightful code reviews, write documentation and help to troubleshoot issues.

In addition to the engineering behind the project itself, you'll have the chance to work with industry\-leading teams inside Canonical, ensuring your work is backed by rock\-solid data stores, and highly observable using our Kubernetes\-based Observability stack. You'll work with broader open source communities, participating in ""hackfest"" events, webinars and conferences.

* Experience with Go and Python software development
* Ability to design and implement complex, distributed system
* Experience working with container technology and Kubernetes
* Strong understanding of software/infrastructure security and performance
* Experience designing and/or operating large scale distributed systems
* Knowledge of identity and access management technologies and standards is desirable but not essential

Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open\-source community to deliver Ubuntu, the world's best free software platform. Our services help businesses worldwide reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.

If you require information in an alternate format, or if you require an accommodation to participate in the hiring process, please contact humanresources@rrc.ca.
**Strategy Coordinator (Term Full\-Time)**
**Research Partnerships \& Innovation**
**POSITION TYPE**: Full\-Time, Term Position Available (anticipated March 17, 2025 up to March 31, 2030\)
**SALARY**: $62,337 \- $87,859 per annum
**POSITION LOCATION**: Notre Dame Campus (Winnipeg, MB)

At RRC Polytech we aspire to have a workforce that is representative of the diversity within our communities. For this hiring process, a preference hiring practice will be applied. First consideration will be given to applicants who self\-identify within their application as one or more of the following equity\-deserving group(s): Women, Indigenous Peoples, Persons with Disabilities, Racialized Persons, Persons of the 2SLGBTQlA\+ Community. First consideration will also be given to internal applicants. For more information about our hiring practices, please visit: www.rrc.ca/hr/work/hiring\-process/.

Employment support is available to both internal and external candidates who self\-identify as Indigenous (First Nations, Métis, or Inuit) seeking employment at Red River College Polytechnic. For guidance on the application process, interview preparation, or to discuss accommodation needs, applicants are invited to contact our Indigenous Recruitment Consultant at humanresources@rrc.ca.
**ELIGIBILITY LIST**: This competition may be used to establish a 6 month eligibility list of qualified candidates for future vacancies.
**DUTIES**

The Strategy Coordinator contributes to the academic, research and strategic initiatives of Research Partnerships and Innovation (RPI). The Strategy Coordinator is responsible for developing standard framework practices and processes to ensure the department objectives are met. Using college change management and project management practices, the Strategy Coordinator works collaboratively with internal and external stakeholders and is responsible for leading projects with a results\-oriented focus to meet project goals and deadlines. The incumbent will direct, organize, monitor and report on all projects and initiatives.

This position will have a focus on strategic coordination duties to support the Lab to Market Director, Executive, Steering Committees and Advisory council responsible for implementing the over $24 million Lab to Market project awarded to RRC Polytech to lead and distribute across hub partners. The position will provide support to the Lab to Market Executive Committee, advisory councils, and Director, Lab to Market. Tasks include liaison and communications to institutions, partners and funders
column2: reports and briefings to Lab to Market Executive Committee
column3: events management for annual Summit, Steering committee and Network stakeholders.

go-88ZVVMwznXiK7SVWAAAAAA==,google,https://ca.bebee.com/job/deabbb5455af53e573d52286a44f783c?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,Neuroscience Research Fellowships,Canadian Association for Neuroscience,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-19,,,,,,,False,,,,,"About the Opportunity

The Canadian Association for Neuroscience invites applications for Postdoctoral Fellowships in Stem Cells and Regenerative Neuroscience. This exciting opportunity is part of a renowned research program led by Dr. Soheila Karimi, focusing on neural regeneration and stem cell research.

Our team is recognized internationally for its contributions to cellular and pharmacological therapeutic approaches in preclinical models. We employ an array of advanced approaches, including micro-surgical techniques, stem cell transplantation, transgenic models, neural stem cell/neural tissue culture, and high-throughput transcriptomics and proteomics.
Research Areas
• Uncovering the endogenous mechanisms of neural stem cells differentiation in MS and spinal cord injury.\
• Development of stem cell and pharmacological therapies for enhancing neuronal and oligodendrocytes replacement in progressive MS.\
• Neural stem transplantation in spinal cord injury.\
• Investigating the modulatory roles of reactive astrocytes, microglia, and matrix remodeling in spinal cord injury and MS.\
• Uncovering immune mechanisms and developing immunomodulatory therapies in MS.\
Key Responsibilities

As a Postdoctoral Fellow, you will be involved in studying neurodegeneration, neuroprotection, neural repair, neural stem cells, glial cells, and neuroinflammation in MS and/or SCI. Your responsibilities will include:
• Performing cell culture methods involving isolation and maintenance of rodent neuronal and primary cultures as well as human cell lines.\
• Conducting molecular and cellular biology techniques, such as Western blotting, qPCR, immunohisto/cytochemistry, and RNA seq analysis.\
• Designing and optimizing experimental assays.\
• Maintaining accurate records and contributing to manuscript preparation.\
• Collaborating with colleagues to advance research projects.\
What We Offer

We provide a highly competitive salary, commensurate with qualifications and experience, along with access to state-of-the-art facilities and resources. Our dynamic community values reconciliation, sustainability, diversity, and inclusion. As one of Manitoba's Top Employers and Canada's Best Diversity Employers, we offer outstanding employee benefits and opportunities for growth and professional development.

You will have the chance to collaborate with renowned scholars and scientists at the national and international levels. Our supportive environment fosters intellectual stimulation, creativity, and innovation. Join our network and contribute to advancing neuroscience research.",,,,,,,,,research assistant,2025-01-30

go-jSY_fJQEEF57kkNOAAAAAA==,google,https://ca.trabajo.org/job-2891-418fa935359bc62164594b28a7c1348d?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,Child Health Research Technician,University of Manitoba,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-18,,,,,,,False,,,,,"The University of Manitoba is a driving force of innovation, discovery and advancement. Our momentum is propelled by our campus community - UM faculty, staff and students whose determination and curiosity shape our world for the better. Our teaching, learning and work environment is uniquely strengthened and enriched by Indigenous perspectives. With two main campuses in Winnipeg, satellite campuses throughout Manitoba, and world-wide research, UM’s impact is global.

Discover outstanding employee benefits, experience world-class facilities and join a dynamic community that values reconciliation, sustainability, diversity, and inclusion. We are one of Manitoba’s Top Employers and one of Canada’s Best Diversity Employers. At the University of Manitoba, what inspires you can change everything.
• *The opportunity**:

The incumbent will be responsible to Initiate and conduct research on issues of child and youth health relating to Dr. Roberta Woodgate’s INGAUGE research program. The incumbent will take a holistic and multidisciplinary approach to issues of healthcare and access to healthcare, understanding and articulating how they are connected in today’s complex world. Act as a spokesperson for Dr. Woodgate’s research program, responding to media requests and providing information and comment to the media on issues of child and youth health. Assist in shaping the priorities of Dr. Woodgate’s research program with writing of grant proposals to various agencies, including development of budget. Ensure smooth and efficient day-to-day operation of multiple research projects. Monitors the progress of research activities
column2: develops and maintains records of research activities, preparing periodic and ad hoc reports as required by investigators, administrators, and funding agencies. Assigns and directs work of research support staff, ensuring deadlines are met and research protocol and regulatory requirements of the U of M and funding agencies are followed**.**

column1: • *The qualifications and experience we’re looking for**:
- PhD in a health-related or social sciences fields with three years = directly related experience.
- Masters degree in a health-related or social sciences fields with five years = directly-related experience.
- Experience designing, proposing, conducting and carrying out in-depth and complex research projects including intervention research, is required.
- Experience utilizing qualitative and arts-based data collection and analysis, and artistic knowledge dissemination is required.
- Experience in conducting population-level health and social research using administrative data sets is required.
- Experience working with children and youth in research and a commitment to the engagement of young people in research is required.
- Experience in integrated knowledge translation engaging multiple audiences and users of knowledge in the research process is required.
- Highly competent with MS Office, qualitative and quantitative data management and analysis software is required.
- Experience in designing, proposing, conducting and carrying out systematic reviews is required.
- An acceptable equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered.
- Ability to communicate complex material in accessible forms to a variety of audiences is required.
- Strong academic writing skills (ability to write rigorous research reports and policy briefs) and popular/accessible writing skills (ability to write concise pieces for media, blogs) are required.
- Ability to analyze and then articulate ideas from INGAUGE ideas and research findings with clarity and nuance, is required.
- Must have a sophisticated understanding of complex social issues and personal commitment to human-rights based approach to research.
- Ability and willingness to develop positive working relationships, working effectively part of a dynamic team with academic and non-academic groups, is required.
- Must be self-motivated and be able to work independently.
- Ability to supervise financial records and budgets is required.
- Ability to supervise research coordinators and work with administrative staff is required.
- Ability to demonstrate insight when looking at complex social issues and policy concerns is required.
- Ability to learn new processes and techniques, as well as tolls for use in research and data visualization and presentation is required.
- Satisfactory work record, including satisfactory attendance and punctuality, is required.
• *Why the University of Manitoba?**

Along with being one of Manitoba’s top employers, we are proud to provide a collaborative and enriching work environment. In addition to a strong compensation package with a competitive salary, the University provides an exceptional workplace that includes:
- Comprehensive group benefits and pension plan.
- Competitive vacation time.
- Employee and Family Assistance Program.
- A full spectrum of professional development opportunities.
• *Closing",,,,,,,,,research assistant,2025-01-30

go-ZGq24Ab-utN2FesLAAAAAA==,google,https://ca.trabajo.org/job-2891-3061216c06522ae191d0b036bbcee007?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,"Research Assistant, Developmental Psychology Lab",University of Winnipeg,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-14,,,,,,,True,,,,,"Research Assistants are normally students, in a University of Winnipeg undergraduate program, employed to assist with tasks related to research. Work is performed within defined guidelines and under supervision of a more senior researcher or faculty member.
• *Position Overview**:
• *Duties**:
- Prepare equipment and materials for research: the Research Assistant will maintain lab equipment and spaces (e.g., set up computers or other office furniture
column2: move paper records for storage or disposal). They will also be responsible for keeping testing supplies stocked.

column1: - Assist in data collection, data entry, analysis, and interpretation. This lab conducts research primarily with young children (aged 3-7). The Research Assistant will find and contact schools and daycares, and will arrange for the lab to go testing at places that have agreed to a visit. They will constantly be maintaining and updating a database of locations. They will be responsible for scheduling lab members for these testing appointments and arranging travel from UW to the school/daycare and back. Employee will also run human participants (children and adults) through studies that we will design.
- Perform academic research, standard tests and experiments: the Research Assistant will help design experiments and test human participants.

- Assist with duties related to the production of articles, publications, reports and presentations: the Research Assistant may assist with the preparation of manuscripts that will be submitted for publication.
- Prepare literature reviews: the Research Assistant may be asked to search for relevant papers on Google Scholar.

- Assist in the acquisition of research materials and supplies: the Research Assistant will be responsible for keeping the lab stocked with critical supplies (e.g., paper, stickers, certificates, pens). They will also be responsible for maintaining lab equipment (e.g., charging laptops and tablets).

- Perform data/word processing, routine computations, and record keeping: the Research Assistant will be responsible for maintaining a detailed and well-organized database of schools, daycares, and other community organizations that we might visit. They will also be responsible for managing and organizing all forms (digital or paper) that we send and receive.
• *Qualifications**:
- Academic major: Honours Psychology.
- Specific courses completed: PSYC-2200 mandatory, PSYC-3200 and PSYC-4100 preferred. Coursework in developmental or cognitive psychology preferred.
- Overall GPA: Excellent academic record preferred.
- Software: MS Office (Word, Excel, Powerpoint), Qualtrics, and R preferred.
- Experience working with the community, and especially with young children or families, is an asset.

- Preference will be given to applicants with experience working in a research lab that studies early childhood cognition, especially if they have worked on projects that align with those done in the Thinking and Reasoning Lab.
• *Condition(s) of Employment**:
- **Must be legally entitled to work in Canada.**:
- Employees will need to pass a vulnerable sectors check with the Winnipeg Police Service and a Child Abuse Check with the Province of Manitoba.

- Employees may also need to provide proof of vaccinations (COVID-19, MMR, T-DAP, Varicella, TB) or be willing to get these vaccinations. This will depend on the expectations of the daycares and schools we arrange to visit.
- This work requires travel to places other than UW. For instance, children will be tested at daycares and schools in the community. The employee must be willing to travel to these locations.
The period of work will be from **September 16, 2024 - May 31, 2025 **and the estimated total hours of work will be **0-400 hours**.
• *_ Note_**_: This position is represented by the Public Service Alliance of Canada - Research Capacity Unit._

• *Note**: Some work described in this posting will be conducted remotely but the employee should expect to be in the lab (in-person) at least two days per week.",,,,,,,,,research assistant,2025-01-30

go-JrDplRWqgPmpiRswAAAAAA==,google,https://ca.trabajo.org/job-2891-49368fd9da30c48c41868e0a65ec5da0?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,"Research Associate, a Study On Incivility in",University of Winnipeg,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-13,,,,,,,True,,,,,"**This is a term position ending January 31, 2025**
• *Research Associates**:
• *Position Overview**:
The research associate will work on a project studying incivility in academia.
• *Duties and Responsibilities**:
- Review qualitative data arising from interviews.
- Check the transcript data for errors and omissions.
- Manage the data in NVivo.
- Assist with interpretation of thematic results and triangulation with other qualitative interview transcripts.
- The researcher may also wish to assist in knowledge mobilization through the publication of study results.
• *Qualifications**:
• *Condition(s) of Employment**:
- **Must be legally entitled to work in Canada.**
This position **is not** eligible for extended health benefits, **including** pension.
• *_ Note_**_: This position is represented by the Public Service Alliance of Canada - Research Capacity Unit._
• *Note**: The work described in this posting will be conducted remotely during this time /in-person.",,,,,,,,,research assistant,2025-01-30

go-zuctuAzqZlmCl1VQAAAAAA==,google,https://ca.linkedin.com/jobs/view/analyst-i-qc-laboratory-services-term-at-emergent-biosolutions-4136855187?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,"Analyst I, QC Laboratory Services (Term)",Emergent BioSolutions,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-28,,,,,,,False,,,,,"Those who join Emergent BioSolutions feel a sense of ownership about their future. You will excel in an environment characterized by respect, innovation and growth opportunities. Here, you will join passionate professionals who advance their scientific, technical and professional skills to develop products designed-to protect life.
Job Summary

In this 18 month role, you will perform GMP or GLP compliant testing as required to support Raw Material testing, In-process, Finished Product Release & Stability or nonclinical / clinical studies, as well as assay or process validations.
Maintain laboratory documentation and perform preventative maintenance on laboratory equipment per established procedures
Responsibilities
• Receive test samples, standards and reagents.
• Perform routine basic QC analysis (e.g. TOC, pH, water content, bench chemistry, etc.) following written procedures and limited non-routine testing with supervisory oversight
column2: report results and complete LIMS data entry in a timely manner.

column1: • Perform detailed technical and data integrity review of QC data as required.
• Perform preventative maintenance / calibration on basic laboratory equipment in accordance with established procedures.
• Execute critical reagent and standard qualification studies and maintain adequate inventory of supplies.
• Maintain a clean and sanitary work area in accordance with standard laboratory practice and procedures.
• Maintain laboratory records and inventory for supplies and reagents.
• Adhere to all effective STM’s/SOPs and safety requirements and document laboratory work consistent with cGMP requirements.
• Make detailed observations during performance of experimental tasks.
• Contribute to troubleshooting/investigation efforts under supervisory oversight.
• Model the organizational core values through day-to-day actions
The above statements are intended to describe the general nature of work performed by those in this job. It is not an exhaustive list of all duties, and other duties may be assigned.
Education, Experience & Skills
• Bachelors Degree in a scientific discipline required.
• 2 years directly related experience in a recognized professional or technical/scientific field and experience in a pharmaceutical cGMP environment is an asset, but is not required.
• Basic knowledge of Microsoft Office - Word, Excel.
• Basic knowledge of pharmaceutical GLPs and GMPs.
• Knowledge of laboratory techniques and safety precautions.
• WHMIS and biohazard safety awareness.
• Competent in laboratory safety and generally-accepted lab practice, including maintaining adequate written laboratory records.
• Ability to work in a fast paced and highly regulated environment.
• Able to multi-task and adapt to changing priorities.
• Able to communicate and articulate information in both written and verbal forms.
• Strong organizational and interpersonal skills
column2: can work collaboratively with others.

go-GRTqSoyWKCY3WO-tAAAAAA==,google,https://ca.trabajo.org/job-2891-81ec607fda97cf2f49236dfbbc6b54ba?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,Manager - Business & Quality Assurance,CNL - Whiteshell,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-17,contract,,,,,,False,,,,,"Are you looking for a role that will challenge you?
Would you like to make a difference in the Environment?

If you answered yes, our Whiteshell Laboratories (WL) site located near Pinawa, Manitoba is looking for a **Manager, WL Business and Quality Assurance**. Do you like to work in an environment where you will be responsible for finance, budgeting and monitoring, performance and business reporting, and more? This position additionally works within the parameters of contract deliverables, in accordance with applicable regulations, the WL Total Cost Agreement (TCA), the WL Site Licence, and CNL project management, central technical authority, and business management programs. If this has you interested, then this may be the job for you

Canadian Nuclear Laboratories (CNL) employees perform all duties in accordance with established health and safety and regulations/guidelines, policies and procedures (i.e. utilizing personal protective equipment as per safe work procedures). Notifying management or supervisor of all occurrences, injuries, illnesses or safety and health concerns which are likely to harm themselves, their co-workers or any other on the premises in a timely manner and in accordance with established reporting requirements.
• *What will you be doing?**
- Preparing and monitoring monthly, quarterly and annual client performance reports, and other executive and Board communications.
- Managing, reviewing, monitoring, and analyzing common element budgets, variances, trends, risks, and performance.

- University degree in a discipline related to business or finance.

- Knowledge of project costing and earned value management.
- Demonstrated experience and success in leading multi-disciplined teams.

- Familiarity with Quality Assurance, particularly CSA N285 is desired.
- Experience in the use of Performance Assurance and continuous improvement tools is an asset.
- Excellent communication skills and ability to interact, collaborate, and maintain successful working relations at all levels within the organization and external stakeholders
- Strong administrative and organizational skills and the ability to develop, measure, and assess goals

Controls Specialist

This position is an integral part of the SolutionAir team. The successful candidate will have a broad set of technical skills and ready to make an impact on the development of this business unit. Within our Technical Service team, the candidate will help support field installed units, both monitoring, and troubleshooting custom air handling equipment from a controls perspective. Additionally, the candidate will relay field information back to the design team in a clear and concise manner and be involved in the design of new control platforms.
**The successful candidate's responsibilities will include:**
* Communicating with the development engineering team.
* Mapping out programming strategy to meet unit requirements.
* Applying, testing and providing service for programming strategies adopted by the team.
* Creating supporting documentation in Azure.
* Training Application Engineers.
* Supporting the development of products.
* Supporting of HVAC system testing in production, laboratories or job sites.
* Training others in controls operation, programming and troubleshooting.
**The ideal candidate for this position will have:**
* A university/college degree in Mechanical, Electrical, Electronics or equivalent experience.
* 3\+ years in product design and development of large mechanical, commercial, or HVAC equipment is considered an asset.
* Knowledge of HVAC controls equipment and Building Management Systems (BMS) and Building Automation and Controls (BAC) networks preferred.
* Experience with BMS protocols such as BACnet, Modbus, etc. preferred.
* Knowledge of programming in Structured text and function blocks.
* Knowledge of SDLC and Azure DevOps is considered an asset
* Strong interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills.
* Demonstrated strong analytical skills, especially breaking down complex requirements.
* Excellent time management and project management skills.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to communicate at all levels of the organization.
* The proven ability to take ownership of tasks and from start to delivery, including analysis, estimating, implementation, testing and documentation.
* The proven ability to work in a team environment with various stakeholders and roles including business analyst, architect, project manager, and quality assurance.
* A strong commitment to professional development.
Should this excellent opportunity interest you, please submit your resume, including salary expectations.

Andrea Toyne
753 McDermot Ave
Responsibilities:
- Consults and provides services to principal investigators, research staff, and all others who seek clinical research data management solutions through CHI.
- Provides guidance on the process of accessing clinical research data management software (e.g. REDCap) available through CHI.
- Provides information and resources on setting up and maintaining clinical research databases at CHI.
- Enforces REDCap project management processes and account management processes.
- Investigates software solutions for the development and maintenance of electronic databases.
- Documents clinical research data management processes and solutions.
- Ensures that technical assistance is provided throughout the database development and implementation phases of a research project.
- Liaises with stakeholders and establishes clinical studies and administrative databases in REDCap, maintains the databases within a secure environment, and provides ongoing technical support.
- Ensures quality data is collected by monitoring the usage of established REDCap databases and adhering to data lifecycle management principles.
- Provides training in clinical research data management.
- Develops and delivers workshops, seminars, and other training events and materials to existing and potential users of clinical research data management software.
- Schedules and coordinates training events in consultation with relevant user and stakeholder groups.
- Responds to REDCap enquiries from the research community and troubleshoots research database issues.
- Participates in activities to oversee the implementation and maintenance of CHI's clinical research data management software.
- Works with CHI staff to define the mandate, priorities, key activities, and structures of clinical research data working groups established by CHI.
- Provides support for clinical research data working groups established by CHI, sets agendas, and ensures that meeting minutes are maintained.
- Attends and participates in clinical research data user group meetings.
- Ensures that CHI staff have up-to-date information about CHI's clinical research data management activities.
- Performs other related duties, as assigned.
Qualifications:
MINIMUM FORMAL EDUCATION/TRAINING:
- Master's degree in data science, epidemiology, biostatistics, computer science, health information management, experimental social sciences, or a related discipline.
EXPERIENCE:
- A minimum of one-year experience in data collection form development, survey administration, and/or research database management is required.
- Knowledge of electronic data collection processes and software, such as REDCap, is a strong asset.
- Experience with clinical trials and the associated data collection is an asset.
- An acceptable equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered.
SKILLS AND ABILITIES:
- Expertise in principles and practices of clinical data and databases management is required.
- Working knowledge of research data management software (e.g. REDCap), MS-Office, and statistical software (e.g. SAS and/or R) is required.
- Familiarly with data validation methods is an asset.

- Familiarly with International Council on Harmonization-Good Clinical Practice (ICH-GCP), the Personal Health Information Act, and the Tri-Council Policy on the Ethical Conduct for Research Involving Humans is an asset.
- Good oral and written communication skills and strong analytical skills are required.
- Ability to set priorities, multi-task and work effectively under time-constrains required.
- Must be able to work in complex team environment with researchers, clinicians, and representatives from external agencies, such as government departments.
- Must be able to work independently with mínimal supervision.
- Ability to diagnose and resolve software and system problems is required.
- Ability to develop strong interpersonal working relationships is required.
- Demonstrated ability to provide excellent customer service is required.
- Satisfactory work record, including satisfactory attendance and punctuality
Additional Information:

The University of Manitoba is committed to the principles of equity, diversity & inclusion and to promoting opportunities in hiring, promotion and tenure (where applicable) for systemically marginalized groups who have been excluded from full participation at the University and the larger community including Indigenous Peoples, women, racialized persons, persons with disabilities and those who identify as 2SLGBTQIA+ (Two Spirit, lesbian, gay, bisexual, trans, questioning, intersex,",,,,,,,,,data analyst,2025-01-30

Our stores offer a broad range of products and services with an emphasis on food. Our value offer is to be the best local shopping choice for everyday household and local lifestyle needs. Check out northwest.ca for more information.
• *Your Role**:

- Billing to be sent to head office for all internet and telephone services until billing goes to Avema
- Ensure monthly telephone and data circuit usage is monitored and be able to explain variations on the monthly bills
- Explain the exception and/or take action on problem areas and be able to provide long distance information down to line level detail
- Ensure monthly billing is sent to accounts payable on time to avoid late payments
- Triage service desk tickets related to telephone/internet issues in staff house which includes corporate services present in staff houses (eg. Starlink)
- Log tickets with service provider, follow through to resolution and perform backup support for corporate telecom analyst
- Understand the devices and systems available on the market today. Look for solutions that can maintain ease of management, Control costs, and Reduce physical phone lines (IP phones for example)
- Understand the capabilities of currently owned technologies. Use or recommend changes where cost savings or user functionality can be enhanced
- Provide guidance to all users regarding their telephony and wireless data needs when they are given a new device/plan/or changes to their plan
column2: and

column1: - Develop and/or review policies for management approval regarding telecom related technologies.

column1: go-fG1zRfuGyCqm5yaQAAAAAA==,google,https://ca.trabajo.org/job-2891-99bb9890a06d73c57c11c292a7b13197?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,Divisional Coordinator of Women's Ministries,The Salvation Army,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-19,fulltime,,,,,,False,,,,,"The Salvation Army is an international Christian church. Its message is based on the Bible
column2: its ministry is motivated by love for God and the needs of humanity.

column1: • *Mission Statement** The Salvation Army exists to share the love of Jesus Christ, meet human needs and be a transforming influence in the communities of our world.
• *Core Values** The Salvation Army Canada and Bermuda has four core values:
• *Hope**:We give hope through the power of the gospel of Jesus Christ.
• *Service**:We reach out to support others without discrimination.
• *Dignity**: We respect and value each other, recognizing everyone’s worth.
• *Stewardship**:We responsibly manage the resources entrusted to us.
• *Position Purpose Summary**:

The role of the Divisional Coordinator of Women’s Ministries is to assist the Divisional Director of Women’s Ministries (DDWM) in giving oversight, direction and encouragement to the women officers and leaders of Women’s Ministries groups in the division.
This is a permanent full time position at 30 hours per week.
• *KEY RESPONSIBILITIES**:
• *Written and Verbal Communication/Reporting**
- Handle all correspondence related to Women's Ministries responsibilities to and from corps
- Responsible for creating and submitting Women’s Ministries reports to THQ within 10 days after each event (e.g., Camp/Retreat/Conference and Promotion Week/Women’s Sunday) in consultation with DDWM
- Create program and resource material to women and empower them to be agents of transformation in their communities and around the world
- Research and provide resource material specific to women - digital and hard copies, supported by the THQ Women’s Ministries Dept
- Keep divisional woman up to date with service opportunities including social justice issues (e.g., human trafficking, domestic violence, promotion and training of BRAVE for children in care)
- Ensure Women's Ministries corps and divisional statistics are recorded through SAMIS monthly

- Ensure annual reviews of Women's Ministries are conducted, and results monitored when the Area Commanders do the Corps Review. Ensure WM Integrated Rolls are updated, and the changes are included in SAMIS (may be done in partnership with ACs)
- Ensure that the June Change report is submitted to DHQ when officers are being transferred
• *Meetings and Events**
- Plan, organize and execute specific events for the women of the division (camps, including annual Women’s camp(s), retreats, conferences, BRAVE)
- Plan, prepare agenda items, and lead quarterly Divisional Women’s Ministries Committee(s) meetings in consultation with DDWM
- Work with Divisional Youth Secretaries to help plan and host Family Camp
- Visit women’s groups providing support and encouraging new initiatives which align with the territorial vision and strategy. Encouraging partnerships within communities to accomplish the mission
- Engage in opportunities to special at women’s events and gatherings.
- Meet occasionally with the DDWM and Area Commanders (AC) to discuss mission outcomes as it relates to Women’s Ministries in the Division.
- Ensure proper procedures are followed when guests are invited for WM special events. (e.g., if guest is from outside of the territory, invitations must go through the Chief Secretary’s Office)
- Monitor the frequency of women officers’ specialling
- Encourage corps to hold Women’s Ministries Promotional Week gatherings
- Visit corps (in-person or virtually) women’s groups providing support and encouragement.
- Encourage groups and individuals to participate in the Territorial, Divisional and Sponsorship Projects (completing THQ reports where necessary).
• *Training**
- Encourage leadership in Women’s Ministries by training, teaching, equipping, and mentoring women to take the lead in their community
- Encourage corps to hold Women’s Ministries Promotion Week or Women’s Sunday
- Encourage participation in the World Day of Prayer
- Encourage women to be involved in their local communities by representing The Salvation Army on a board, i.e., homelessness or domestic violence
- Encourage groups and individuals to participate in Sponsorship Projects supported by THQ
- Involvement with Fellowship of the Silver Star as requested by the DDWM. Ensure that the Silver Star database is updated annually as requested by THQ
- Support corps officers and local leadership in a pastoral and practical manner
- Promote the curriculum for girls ages 12-17 called “Grow” throughout the division in partnership with the youth department
- Be an advocate for Women’s Ministries continued support of Others - Trade for Hope
- Create and/or promote focused ministry to women (in all areas of community/society)
- Engage women of all ages for mission advancement
• *Online and Social Media**
- Provide online opportunities to engage the corps officers and women in the division
- Maintain and develop resources for Facebook, Women’s Ministries website, Ministry Helps, and othe",,,,,,,,,program coordinator,2025-01-30

go-4WKvy5RBPWoJdYLzAAAAAA==,google,https://ca.trabajo.org/job-2891-091bf840650719227f7373e5800956d7?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,IT Asset Coordinator,TEK Group,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-17,,,,,,,False,,,,,"Receives approved work order / request for standard computer hardware from client representative(s) or the Deployment Planner Scheduler.
• *Manages computer equipment hardware that can be allocated from in-house stock**:
- Allocates appropriate computer equipment hardware from storage location
- Arranges delivery of allocated computer equipment hardware from the storage location to the staging location or to an address as stated on the work order.
• *Manages computer equipment, such as additional computer options, sundry items or non-standard computer equipment, that are ordered on a work request**:

- Coordinates with procurement representative to monitor the delivery time for when computer equipment hardware is being shipped to and received at the staging location or to an address as stated on the work order.
• *Coordinates work orders for computer equipment hardware that is being delivered to the staging location**:
- Confirms when all computer equipment hardware is received for each work order
- Initiates service request to assign Installation Technician to go to the staging location to perform IT Hardware configuration and installation activities

- Receives notification from Installation Technician when IT Hardware configuration for each work order is complete and that computer equipment hardware is either re-packed and prepped for pickup by the in-house mailroom for delivery to external site or been deployed for in-building setup installation, as indicated in the work request

- For installations at a location that is not a staging location building, Deployment Coordinator contacts end user to notify computer equipment is coming and to confirm with end user when all IT Hardware has been received at the end user location
- Contacts end user to schedule a date/time for the IT Hardware installation
- Initiates service request to assign Installation Technician to perform on-site installation on scheduled date/time
- Act as a point of contact to re-schedule on-site installation when necessary (such as when the availability of the end user or Installation Technician changes or when there are delivery delays)
- Receives notification from the assigned Installation Technician when on-site installation is complete, and if there are any unresolved issues
column2: arranges to notify the Deployment Planner Scheduler or authorized Representative for appropriate follow up action as necessary

column1: - Performs follow up with Asset Management staff within two weeks after the on-site installation to confirm that any existing IT Hardware (replace request) from end user location have been returned to the surplus location, where applicable.
- Maintains all scheduled and pending work requests and records relevant information.

- Information tracked include the work request number, date when work request is received, date when computer equipment hardware is received at the staging location (where applicable), date when computer equipment is received at an address as stated on the work order (where applicable), dates when Installation Technician is scheduled and completes pre-configuration work in the staging location (where applicable), and dates when Installation Technician is scheduled and completes the installation (where applicable)
- Works with the Deployment Planner Scheduler to manage and ensure that all work orders are scheduled and completed within a timely manner, and to avoid potential backlogs
column2: escalates with appropriate authorized representatives as necessary to address any issues that may arise.

event, social media, or content marketing (blogs, promotional materials, website edits and

- Completion of Non-Violent Crisis Intervention and/or De-escalating Potentially Violent Situations.
- Experience working with marginalized, vulnerable populations required.
- A minimum of four years’ experience providing direct service in a social services capacity is required.
- A minimum of five years’ experience administering programs including planning, developing, implementing and evaluating program offerings.
- A minimum of two years’ experience supervising, providing leadership and evaluating the work of other is preferred.
Other combinations of education and experience will be given due consideration.
• *Knowledge, Skills and Abilities**
- Extensive knowledge of programs and services across the city that our population would benefit from.
- Excellent interpersonal and communication skills including oral presentation skills, writing skills, listening and observation skills
column2: present ideas and concepts persuasively in speaking before groups, with employees, participants and partners.

column1: - Ability to work collaboratively within a team, with other community and related service organizations to achieve Family Dynamics’ goals and objectives.
