Position Number: 20053720
Posting End Date: Open until filled
City: Winnipeg
Employer: Concordia Hospital
Site: Concordia Hospital
Department / Unit: Recreation - CGH
Job Stream: Clinical
Union: MAHCP
Anticipated Start Date - End Date: ASAP - Indefinite
Reason for Term: Other Leave
Anticipated Shift: Days
Work Arrangement: In Person
Daily Hours Worked: 8.00
Annual Base Hours: 1950

Grow your career in the Winnipeg Health Region! Our team provides a spectrum of health care services through an integrated network of sites, services and organizations. We’re united by a shared commitment to excellent and equitable health care.
Position Overview

As a member of the interdisciplinary team, the incumbent is responsible for assessing, planning, implementation, and evaluating therapeutic recreation programs for individuals experiencing developmental, cognitive, emotional, social, physical and/or coping difficulties through group and/or individual programs that include: Therapeutic recreation interventions to improve functional abilities, well-being and facilitate independence in positive leisure pursuits. Leisure education to enhance and promote life-long recreation skills and attitudes. Recreation participation to promote health and personal growth through leisure and recreation experiences. Community re-integration to aid and support in removing physical and psychological barriers that impede participation in recreation programs and services offered in the community. The incumbent fosters professional practice and quality client care through the supervision of volunteers, continuing professional development, research, quality improvement and promotion of therapeutic recreation.
Experience
• 1-2 years’ experience working with individuals/groups in a health care environment preferred.
• Must have extensive knowledge of social, recreational and leisure programming and recreation resources.
Education (Degree/Diploma/Certificate)
• Undergraduate degree in Recreation with major course work in therapeutic recreation.
Certification/Licensure/Registration
• Membership in Therapeutic Recreation Manitoba and/or Canadian Therapeutic Recreation Association.
• Certification with the Therapeutic Recreation Certification Council preferred.
• Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR) Training requirements for this position shall in be in accordance with the Employer policy.
Qualifications And Skills
• Ability to establish and maintain good interpersonal relationships.
• Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills.
• Must be able to work cooperatively with other disciplines and demonstrate professional judgment and initiative.
• Must have personal maturity and the ability to accept responsibility for actions and decisions.
• Must demonstrate initiative, resourcefulness, creativity, sound judgment and problem-solving skills in all areas of practice.
• Ability to organize and complete assignments with a minimum of supervision.
• Willingness to adapt to new concepts, techniques and best practice in the academic and clinical fields of health care knowledge.
• Demonstrated ability to work independently and interdependently.
• Computer literacy as appropriate.
Physical Requirements
• May encounter aggressive and/or agitated clients/visitors/staff.
• May be exposed to infectious diseases, blood and body fluids, toxic materials, noise, allergens, physical and emotional stress.
• May be occasionally required to work extended hours.
• May be required to work a variety of shifts including weekends.
This term position may end earlier as outlined in your collective agreement.

This position requires a current satisfactory Criminal Records Check (including Vulnerable Sector Search), Child Abuse Registry Check and Adult Abuse Registry Check as conditions of employment. The successful candidate will be responsible for any service charges incurred. A security check is considered current if it was obtained no more than six (6) months prior to the start of employment.

Please note that an employee is not permitted to hold two or more positions across the WRHA legal entity that combine to equal more than 1.0 EFT. The WRHA legal entity includes Churchill Health Centre, Deer Lodge Centre, Golden West Centennial Lodge, Grace Hospital, Middlechurch Home of Winnipeg, Pan Am Clinic, River Park Gardens, Victoria General Hospital, WRHA corporate programs, and WRHA community health services.
Interviewed candidates may be called upon to participate in a skills assessment.
Any application received after the closing time will not be included in the competition.
We welcome applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request during the assessment and selection process.",,,,,,,,,program coordinator,2025-01-30

go-nmQE_xmOUzZ2SNNnAAAAAA==,google,https://ca.trabajo.org/job-2891-84dbaa29cec3c4d2dc9ee39476b159cd?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,"Program Coordinator, Wii Chiiwaakanak Learning",University of Winnipeg,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-13,,,,,,,False,,,,,"**This is a term position ending October 10, 2025**

Wii Chiiwaakanak means ""partners"" in Anishinabemowin and is an outreach initiative through The University of Winnipeg that provides educational, learning and capacity building opportunities in Winnipeg’s inner city. The Wii Chiiwaaknak Learning Centre provides the community with free and open access to computers at the RBC Community Learning Commons, the community classroom, free after school community learning programs,, cultural and language programs, and STEM outreach programs and events.
• *Responsibilities**:
- Coordinates all logistics for program promotion, partnership development, and for all workshops/activities for specialized year-round community focused programs.
- Drafts and manages all program registration forms, and confirms participants for all Indigenous language, cultural, and STEM programs and events.
- Generates final program documents for participants utilizing registrations and evaluations. Prepares reports summarizing the program.
- Assesses STEAM workshops/activities using evaluations with students and teachers on an annual basis.
- Identifies and develops new age-appropriate STEAM related workshops/activities for youth.
- Recruit and train volunteers with the guidance of the Director, to assist with STEAM workshops and activities.
- Ensures program facilitators and instructors have all necessary supplies and equipment required for the delivery of programs.
- In conjunction with the Director, develops and executes program recruitment strategies and identifies new potential community partners.
- Purchases supplies, materials and equipment, ordering food, and arranging for media and print services, if needed, for all programming and events.
- Maintaining inventory of all equipment and supplies on a regular basis.
- Point of contact for access and/or booking of our community spaces such as the computer lab and classroom.
- Assists the Director in drafting the annual report content, photos, statistics and program coordinator letter.
- Monitors and reconciles budget for all outreach programming and tracks expenditures to stay within allocated funding.
- Reports on budget-related anomalies.
- Supports patrons of the Learning Centre using the computers as needed.
- Responsible for program-related hiring including: orientation, training, scheduling summer staff of 15-20 students and volunteers from partnering organizations,, and others duties as required.
- Recruits and manages volunteers, UW faculty and staff, external program facilitators, and community partners to assist with special events and summer programming.
- Supervises Office Assistant.
- Ensures that all external facilitators and volunteers work effectively and sensitively with people from a diverse variety of backgrounds.
• *Qualifications**:
- Post-secondary degree, diploma, or equivalent experience in program coordination
- 3 years directly related administrative experience including working in an environment that supports diverse community needs.
- Leadership and coordination experience in an educational setting is an asset.
- Must have a good understanding of the inner-city and Indigenous communities - including knowledge of Indigenous peoples, language, and culture - in Winnipeg as well as available community supports.
- Minimum of 2 years experience building community partnerships with under served communities
- Experience developing STEAM-related workshops and activities for youth that are age appropriate is an asset.
- Familiar with school systems in Winnipeg and identifying ways to address barriers to participation.
- Must have demonstrated organizational skills in program planning, development, and volunteer coordination.
- Must have proven ability to work with and in multi-cultural communities/settings.
- Excellent written and oral communication skills.
- Must have excellent working knowledge of Microsoft Office programs.
- Excellent interpersonal, negotiating, and conflict-resolution skills to deal effectively with a wide variety of situations.
- Must have strong interpersonal skills such as open-mindedness, flexibility, and an ability to work as part of a team.
- Must show initiative with the demonstrated ability to coordinate multiple projects at one time.
- Demonstrated sensitivity to the needs and issues of a diverse community and inner city/newcomer community challenges.
- Must have demonstrated ability to work with youth.
• *An equivalent combination of education, experience, skills, knowledge and abilities may be considered.

- Must be legally entitled to work in Canada.
- Must be able to work additional hours as needed.
- Must have a driver's license.

go-taPZZ5cLuqe9ZWkZAAAAAA==,google,https://stantec.jobs/winnipeg-mb/project-manager/EC45321020494DC78775F141B624D72A/job/?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,Project Manager,Stantec,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-13,contract,,,,,,True,,,,,"Project Manager - ( 2400048N )
Description

The buildings that make up the landscape of our daily lives seem like permanent fixtures, fastened to a time and place. But what if that didn’t have to be true? What if our built environment — where we live, learn, play, and conduct business — carried us forward instead?

Our Buildings practice keeps people at its heart, recognizing that our shared journey forward is shaped by the meaningful and responsive places we design. From iconic designs to monumental groundbreakings, join us to bring transformational building solutions to life. Every day we apply our expertise, creativity, and passion to propel communities into the future—join us!
Your Opportunity

Our Winnipeg office is seeking Project Managers with proven experience in large complex projects (Healthcare, Commercial, Institutional, Recreational, Transportation, and Education) to join our multidisciplinary team.
Your Key Responsibilities
Project Management:
• Create and execute project execution plans, including work plans, resource plans, risk management plans etc.
• Manage day-to-day operational aspects of a project and scope
• Prepares monthly executive reports for internal and client leaders
• Assume responsibility for project delivery excellence in partnership with the Principal-in-Charge
• Ensure project documents, including contracts and additional service requests are approved, and filed in accordance with Stantec PM Frameworks.
Project Accounting
• Update project financials on a regular basis (weekly, bi-weekly, monthly) using Stantec’s PM Frameworks
• Manage project budget and schedule including tracking and reporting of team hours and expenses
• Determine appropriate revenue/gross margin recognition and analyzes bill rates and utilization targets for project teams
• Ensure timely and accurate invoicing and monitors receivables and collection of invoices.
Communications:
• Facilitate and holds regular team and client meetings
• Keep project team well informed of changes and updates
• Effectively communicate relevant project information to the client and project Principal in Charge
• Deliver engaging, formative, well-organized presentations both verbally and in writing
• Resolve and/or escalates issues in a timely fashion
• Understand how to communicate difficult/sensitive information.
Leadership:
• Identify opportunities for improvement and makes constructive suggestions for change
• Remain engaged and knowledgeable regarding emerging industry practices
• Comply with and help to enforce Stantec policies and procedures
• Actively support Stantec’s Safer Together and Safety programs and is required to complete all Health and Safety documentation for the project team.
Teamwork:
• Effectively utilize each team members to his/her fullest potential
• Motivate team to work together efficiently
• Mitigate team conflict and communication challenges
• Consistently acknowledge and appreciate team members and their contributions
• Keep track of lessons learned and shares those lessons with team members, peers, and clients
Technical Understanding:
• Possess general understanding of building design and construction processes
• Possess understanding of Stantec multi-disciplinary capabilities and leverage all internal resources effectively
• Regularly seek continuing education opportunities to increase knowledge base.
Client Management:
• Manage day-to-day client interaction, evaluate and manage client expectations
• Seek opportunities to increase client satisfaction and develop lasting relationships with clients
• Communicate effectively with clients to identify needs, evaluate alternative solutions, and deliver value added services
• Build a knowledge base of each client’s business, organization, and objectives.
Business Development:
• Identify business development and additional service opportunities for all Stantec disciplines as they relate to a specific project, program, or client
• Engages in proposal efforts, including completing project scoping and pricing.
Qualifications
Your Capabilities and Credentials
• Minimum of 3 years experience managing large, complex projects in Healthcare, Commercial, Retail, Institutional, Recreational, Transportation or Education
• Minimum of 10 years’ experience in building design or construction related careers.
• Professional designation and/or PMP preferred.
• Ability to travel to project sites, including remote locations, on a periodic basis
Education and Experience
• Bachelor or Master’s degree in project management, architecture, engineering, interior design, or equivalent in work experience.

This description is not a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that may be required of the employee and other duties, responsibilities and activities may be assigned or may be changed at any time with or without notice.
Stantec is a place where the best and brightest come to build on each others’ talents, do exciting work, and make an impact on the world around us. Join us and redefine your personal best.

Benefits Summary: Regular full-time and part-time employees will have access to health, dental, and vision plans, a well-being program, health care spending account, wellness spending accounts, group registered retirement savings plan, employee stock purchase program, group tax-free savings account, life and accidental death & dismemberment (AD&D) insurance, short-term/long-term disability plans, emergency travel benefits, tuition reimbursement, professional membership fee coverage, and paid time off.
Temporary/casual employees will have access to group registered retirement savings plan, employee stock purchase program, and group tax-free savings account.
The benefits information listed above may not apply to union positions because benefits for such positions are governed by applicable collective bargaining agreements.

Organization : BC-1445 Buildings-CA Manitoba
Employee Status : Regular
Job Level : Individual Contributor
Travel : No

Stantec is in compliance with local, state and federal laws and regulations and ensures equitable opportunities in all aspects of employment. The role of the Delivery Coordinator is to ensure that when a customer leaves with their new purchase, they are 100% completely satisfied with the transaction and they become the last person to impact the customer experience. The ideal candidate has excellent communication, organizational and interpersonal skills and is truly customer\-focused. The Delivery Coordinator works closely with the sales team and the customer to schedule and organizes the delivery where they will spend time with the customer explaining the features and functions of the vehicle.
**Shift Details:** Monday/Tuesday 10:00 am \- 7:00 pm, 9:00 am \- 6:00 pm the rest of the week including Saturdays. Sundays off and either Wednesday or Thursday off.
**Qualifications**:
• Focus on customer needs, and a passion for delivering exceptional customer service
• Automotive industry experience is considered an asset
• Demonstrated ability to nurture collaborative working relationships with team members within the dealership
• Exceptional communication skills (in person, on the phone, by email, written)
• Well organized – able to set priorities, develop a work schedule, monitor progress towards goals, and deliver on commitments
• Proficiency in working with Microsoft Office, Excel, and other applications
• Valid Class 5 driver’s license, clean driving record, and own transportation to and from work are required
**What Birchwood Can Offer You:**
• Competitive compensation – in addition to salary, many roles have bonus and commission incentives that reward you for success
• Full benefits package including vacation time, company\-paid extended health, dental/vision coverage, and employee assistance – with flex plan options
• RSP Matching program – Birchwood will match up to $5,000 of your regular earnings after 1 year of employment
• Employee referral bonus program – refer your friends to Birchwood and receive a referral bonus
• Career development opportunities \& internal promotions
• Learning \& development opportunities
• Wellness program
• Corporate discounts \& group savings plan
• Volunteer program – Dollars for Doing
• Company events – Birchwood Bucks, Circle of Excellence, holiday parties

Birchwood is Manitoba’s largest automotive retailer. Our 24 franchises are in addition to four state\-of\-the\-art collision repair centres and four Birchwood Credit Solutions locations. We offer sales, services, and parts to meet our customers’ automotive needs. We’re a recognized leader in the retail automotive industry, not only for our diverse workforce reflecting our community, but also for our unparalleled commitment to team members, customers, partners, and neighbourhoods. At Birchwood, our days begin and end with gratitude, personal leadership, trust, respect, continuous improvement, and generosity.

Birchwood is committed to creating a diverse workplace and is proud to be an equal\-opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. Reasonable accommodation is available to applicants with disabilities upon request. Please email your request to: recruitment@birchwood.ca",,,,,,,,,program coordinator,2025-01-30

gd-1009616934538,glassdoor,https://www.glassdoor.ca/job-listing/j?jl=1009616934538,,Project Coordinator,TENTEN Kitchens,Winnipeg,2025-01-30,,direct_data,hourly,28.0,38.0,CAD,False,,,organic,,"**Company Description**
**TENTEN Kitchens \- We Build Beautiful Kitchens for Wonderful People**
We have a smart, fun team. If you can grow skills in others and help everyone else to be successful you should be working with TENTEN Kitchens.

We love what we do and build consistently fabulous interior renewal projects. We are a Better / Best Quality Builder and employ people who are in the top 10 percent in their field. We do great work, celebrate successes, and take pride in building a better kitchen.
Our customers are raving fans. Success starts and finishes with our people. We through great parties.
TENTEN strives to be a desirable employer. We want to attract, retain and grow great people. We have a relatively young group. Is this what you are looking for?
**Job Description \- Project Coordinator \- Residential Interior Construction**
***What You’ll Do:***
* Own the Details – Track project schedules, budgets, permits, material orders, and contractor timelines to ensure everything stays on course.
* Keep Everyone Aligned – Communicate with clients, subcontractors, and vendors to make sure expectations are clear and deadlines are met.
* Solve Problems Proactively – Identify potential roadblocks before they become issues and find solutions to keep things moving.
* Ensure Quality \& Compliance– Maintain project documentation, ensure work meets company standards, and verify that all permits and inspections are completed.
* Drive Efficiency \- Improve processes, eliminate inefficiencies, and help us execute projects with precision and speed.
***Who You Are:***
* Meticulous \& Detail\-Oriented – You notice the small things that others miss and have a system for tracking everything.
* Task \& Process Focused – You enjoy following structured processes and improving them when needed.
* Accountability\-Driven – You take ownership, follow up relentlessly, and ensure deadlines are met.
* Clear Communicator – You keep teams informed, ask the right questions, and ensure alignment.
* Problem\-Solver – You don’t just identify issues—you fix them before they impact progress.
***What You Bring:***
* Experience in project coordination, construction management, or a related field (residential construction experience preferred).
* Strong organizational skills with a proven ability to manage multiple projects at once.
* Proficiency in project management software and a knack for keeping detailed records. We use Slack currently. We will be upgrading as required.
* Ability to work independently while keeping teams accountable
* Familiarity with permits, construction schedules, and vendor management is a plus.
* You need a valid drivers license and a reliable, presentable vehicle.
* *(I would prefer someone who is enrolled or willing to enroll in a Project Management program. Al Keith)*
**The test of your ability to do the job would be how well you fit with the team and your skill in tangibly moving projects forward.**
We are growing and looking for someone who shares our passion for great work, and can derive a high level of satisfaction from great work we build together.
**Why work for TENTEN Kitchens?**
* We do work that you will be proud of. Every day.
* We have a great team with an exceptionally high level of skill \- this is a great place to grow and learn.
* This position has a *significant annual bonus* tied to measurable outcomes.
* We close annually between approximately Dec 21 to Jan 6\.
* We offer some level of flex for special circumstances.
* $300 annual benefit
* RRSP program
* Paid sick / family days

Our work is very rewarding for the right person. If you think you could love this job let me know and we can chat about it. I am hoping to find someone who can grow with us for years to come. I am happy to answer specific questions.
If you’re the type of person who thrives in structure, **loves getting things done,** and ensures no detail is overlooked I want to hear from you!
I love what we do more and more each year.""
Al Keith
TENTEN Kitchens

gd-1009617009229,glassdoor,https://www.glassdoor.ca/job-listing/j?jl=1009617009229,,Senior Advisor - Project Audits,Manitoba Government,Winnipeg,2025-01-30,,direct_data,yearly,106935.0,131124.0,CAD,False,,,organic,hr@legassembly.mb.ca,"**Senior Advisor \- Project Audits**
SF3 Senior Officer 3
Regular/full\-time
Office of the Auditor General
Corporate Services
Winnipeg MB
Advertisement Number: 43723
Closing Date: February 14, 2025

The Manitoba government recognizes the importance of building an exemplary public service reflective of the citizens it serves, where diverse abilities, backgrounds, cultures, identities, languages and perspectives drives a high standard of service and innovation. The Manitoba government supports equitable employment practices and promotes representation of designated groups (women, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, visible minorities).
Employment Equity is a factor in selection for this competition. Consideration will be given to Indigenous people, visible minorities and persons with disabilities.
*Posted on behalf of the Office of the Auditor General Manitoba*

*The Office of the Auditor General (OAG) is an independent office of the Legislative Assembly, established under The Auditor General Act. At the OAG, we pride ourselves on positively influencing public sector performance through impactful audit work and reports. Our work goes beyond the bottom line. As legislative auditors, we serve the Manitoba Legislative Assembly, and in turn, all Manitobans. We offer an exciting and rewarding work environment by providing challenging assignments, training and development opportunities, a comprehensive benefits package and a healthy work/life balance. A healthy work/life balance to us means overtime is a rarity, flexible work arrangements are available and the option of voluntary reduced work schedules.*
Conditions of Employment:
* Must be legally entitled to work in Canada
* A satisfactory Criminal Record Check
Qualifications:
Essential:
* Professional designation (i.e. CPA, CIA, CISA, MPA) with a minimum 5 years post designation work experience
* Extensive experience leading a team of auditors in conducting audits that are non\-financial statement audits such as performance audits, internal audits, forensic audits, and investigations.
* Strong project management skills with a history of delivering projects on time and within budget.
* Experience in team building and collaboration with a history of bringing stakeholders together to achieve common goals.
* Excellent communication skills to clearly articulate messaging to a variety of stakeholders.
* Ability to use critical thinking and professional judgement in delivering strongly supported and credible reports.
* Experience applying and monitoring audit methodology and professional standards in an audit team.
* Highly effective interpersonal skills with ability to establish, engage and maintain strong relationships with various stakeholders.
* Experience improving audit processes and procedures to enhance consistency and efficiency.
Desired:
* Extensive knowledge of government, public sector management and external issues that may impact both.
Duties:

*The Advisor is responsible for advising teams and executive sponsors on determining appropriate objectives and criteria for performance audits, preparing audit proposals, the quality of project audits, the appropriate application of the Office’s audit methodology to these audits, and drafting the audit report. The Advisor advises on multiple project audits in various stages of completion.*

*The Advisor works with the Executive Leadership Group and audit teams to improve performance audit processes and procedures to enhance consistency and efficiency, while remaining in alignment with audit standards. This will include continual identification of improvements and developing procedures and aids (templates) that assist staff with conducting performance audits efficiently and effectively.*

go-taPZZ5cLuqe9ZWkZAAAAAA==,google,https://stantec.jobs/winnipeg-mb/project-manager/EC45321020494DC78775F141B624D72A/job/?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,Project Manager,Stantec,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-13,contract,,,,,,True,,,,,"Project Manager - ( 2400048N )
Description

The buildings that make up the landscape of our daily lives seem like permanent fixtures, fastened to a time and place. But what if that didn’t have to be true? What if our built environment — where we live, learn, play, and conduct business — carried us forward instead?

Our Buildings practice keeps people at its heart, recognizing that our shared journey forward is shaped by the meaningful and responsive places we design. From iconic designs to monumental groundbreakings, join us to bring transformational building solutions to life. Every day we apply our expertise, creativity, and passion to propel communities into the future—join us!
Your Opportunity

Our Winnipeg office is seeking Project Managers with proven experience in large complex projects (Healthcare, Commercial, Institutional, Recreational, Transportation, and Education) to join our multidisciplinary team.
Your Key Responsibilities
Project Management:
• Create and execute project execution plans, including work plans, resource plans, risk management plans etc.
• Manage day-to-day operational aspects of a project and scope
• Prepares monthly executive reports for internal and client leaders
• Assume responsibility for project delivery excellence in partnership with the Principal-in-Charge
• Ensure project documents, including contracts and additional service requests are approved, and filed in accordance with Stantec PM Frameworks.
Project Accounting
• Update project financials on a regular basis (weekly, bi-weekly, monthly) using Stantec’s PM Frameworks
• Manage project budget and schedule including tracking and reporting of team hours and expenses
• Determine appropriate revenue/gross margin recognition and analyzes bill rates and utilization targets for project teams

go-XsgwTDQE_D1AK7n9AAAAAA==,google,https://stantec.jobs/winnipeg-mb/project-controller/C1818E7B9ED94F58BC0E50D5FCB46683/job/?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,Project Controller,Stantec,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-13,contract,,,,,,True,,,,,"Project Controller - ( 240004FD )
Description

Starting a project with the end goal in mind creates meaningful change. This philosophy guides how we approach every transportation infrastructure project - from concept design to construction - with a consistent driver of providing people with better and smarter mobility options. From major expressway and rural roadway projects to transit systems and airport design, our focus is always on providing solutions that respect the local environment. This is how we elevate communities.
Every day we apply our expertise, creativity, and passion to propel communities into the future by bringing transformational solutions to life — join us!
Your Opportunity

Our Winnipeg Transportation Business Centre has a need for a Project Controller in a full-time permanent capacity. As Project Controller you will be working closely with the team of local Project Managers and Transportation Leadership to provide financial support for successful operations of the business by supporting the business center’s financials, as well as supporting project financials for a variety of transportation projects through conformance to Stantec’s ISO requirements, corporate policies, project management framework, and client requirements and standards.

As a Project Controls professional at Stantec, you will utilize your expertise in financial planning, scheduling, cost controls, communications, and problem solving in a fast-paced, professional environment to assist the Transportation team with project delivery and oversight.
Your Key Responsibilities
• Lead timely project financial forecasting, invoicing, and follow-up on accounts payable.
• Assist leadership and project managers with overall support of project financial health including cost forecasting, scope change request, budget monitoring, and support of project schedule.
• Support with document control including pertinent internal and external documentation meeting internal and external quality control processes.
• Assist project managers and leadership with regular project health checks and status reporting, invoicing, provision control, and contract management.
• Respond to internal and external requests for financial forecasting information.
• Coordinate and attend internal and external team meetings and keep detailed meeting minutes.
• Assist project managers and Stantec Financial Services group with preparation of budgets, work breakdown structures, and change orders in conjunction with external and internal requests.
• Assist project managers with preparing, reviewing, and processing timely monthly invoices.
• Undertake project setup procedures within internal financial system.

• Interface with project staff and project managers to regularly develop project forecasts and analyze project schedule and costs to complete the project and ensure that those costs are properly recorded in the financial accounting system.

• Assist project managers and leadership to monitor the progress of large projects on a regular basis to evaluate potential financial risks and ensure financial health and proper tracking in accordance with standards.
• Assist project managers with compliance of Stantec and ISO standards for Project Management.
• Provide general team support / office support functions as required.
• Report to Business Centre Leadership with regards to ongoing financial matters and be responsible to ensure that timely invoicing and financial reporting is completed.
Qualifications
Your Capabilities and Credentials
• Prior experience and background in business analysis and financial analysis.
• Prior experience in documentation control and financial services.
• Strong understanding of all phases of project controls concepts and ability to communicate and work with others.
• Thorough understanding of project accounting and accrual collection.
• Solid understanding of principles and methods related to Earned Value Management.
• Ability to multi-task, manage time, organize, and set priorities and make timely decisions.
• Self-motivated, proactive individual with a strong work ethic, capable of prioritizing and communicating to multiple groups.
• Able to adapt quickly to changing work demands without compromising accuracy and quality of work.
• Excellent written and verbal communications.
• Possess strong problem solving and analytical skills, including attention to detail.
• Positive attitude, with the ability to develop and maintain effective working relationships.
• Must be proficient in MS Office skills, with advanced skills in MS Excel. Experience with Financial/Cost systems (Oracle, Prolog, etc.).
• Engineering consulting industry experience is considered an asset.
Education and Experience
• Technical degree/diploma/certificate or equivalent in accounting, business or related field
column2: or equivalent combination of education and experience.

column1: • Minimum of 3–5 years of experience performing financial analysis, cost management, scheduling, and other project controls functions. Experience with Earned Value Management is considered a strong asset.
• Experience working in transportation, engineering, and/or consulting field is considered an asset.
Position will primarily work in an office setting. This position can be filled through working remote within Western Canada
column2: however a local candidate would be preferred.

Job Profile

Under the direction of the Project Director – Winnipeg Sewage Treatment Program, the Senior Project Engineer is responsible for the execution, completion and implementation of capital projects, including project definition, consultant selection, project management, administration, coordination, start-up and turnover. Projects include engineering studies, designs, construction and contract administration for the upgrading or expansion of the wastewater treatment systems.
As The Senior Project Engineer,you Will
• Initiate projects and ensure execution and products conform to Department and City-wide broad objectives and needs.
• Ensure technical approach complies with appropriate standards and conforms with project objectives.
• Administer human resources.
• Administer capital budgets and expenditures.
• Administer project schedule.
• Disseminate and receive project information.
• Acquire goods and services from outside organizations.
• Develop, initiate and administer risk management procedures.
• Coordinate project execution, approvals and implementation.
• Perform other related duties consistent with the position as assigned.
Your Education And Qualifications Include
• Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering.
• Several years prior experience in engineering planning, design and construction, project management and contract administration.

• Must have knowledge of project management processes and procedures, including project accounting and cost management, scheduling, resource management, risk management, dispute avoidance and dispute resolution.
• Must be familiar with relevant municipal government policies and procedures, including purchasing policies, and legal and contractual requirements.
• Must be familiar with municipal infrastructure and operations, including water and wastewater treatment process operations, collection and distribution and servicing.
• Must have knowledge of construction materials, methods and practices, including job site safety.
• Must have strong demonstrated problem solving and analytical abilities.
• Must have strong interpersonal skills, including leadership, and ability to work in teams, facilitate teambuilding, conduct meetings and strong negotiation skills.
• Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing. Must be proficient at technical writing.
• Must have basic computer skills, including keyboarding, word processing and spreadsheets.

• Demonstrated ability to establish and maintain positive working relationships with employees at all levels of the organization, external contacts and the public, in accordance with the Respectful Workplace Standard.

• IMPORTANT: Applicants who have been educated outside of Canada must have education which is comparable to the minimum qualification in Canada. Applicants submitting foreign credentials require an official academic assessment report issued by a recognized Canadian assessment service https://www.canalliance.org/en/ at application.
Conditions Of Employment
• The successful applicant must maintain legal eligibility to work in Canada. If the successful applicant possesses a work permit, it is their responsibility to ensure the permit remains valid.
• A Police Information Check satisfactory to the employer will be required from the successful candidate, at their expense.
• Must possess and maintain a valid Class 5 Manitoba Driver’s Licence.
• Professional Engineer designation and eligible for registration with Engineers Geoscientists Manitoba, (E.G.M.).
How To Apply
APPLY ONLINE, including all documentation listed below:
• Current resume (Required).
• Cover letter (Required).
• Applications submitted without REQUIRED documentation will not be considered.
• Your application documents must clearly indicate how you meet the qualifications of the position.*
Notes
Online applications can be submitted at http://www.winnipeg.ca/hr/ . For instructions on how to apply and how to attach required documents please refer to our FAQ's or contact 311 .
Hours of Work: 8:30 am to 4:30 pm, Monday through Friday
Employee Group: WAPSO

• The successful applicant will be required to provide a Notice of Driver’s Licence In Force document upon request.
• The successful applicant will be required to complete job specific training required for this position as directed.
Only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.",,,,,,,,,project manager,2025-01-30

*Posted on behalf of the Office of the Auditor General Manitoba*

*The Office of the Auditor General (OAG) is an independent office of the Legislative Assembly, established under The Auditor General Act. At the OAG, we pride ourselves on positively influencing public sector performance through impactful audit work and reports. Our work goes beyond the bottom line. As legislative auditors, we serve the Manitoba Legislative Assembly, and in turn, all Manitobans. We offer an exciting and rewarding work environment by providing challenging assignments, training and development opportunities, a comprehensive benefits package and a healthy work/life balance. A healthy work/life balance to us means overtime is a rarity, flexible work arrangements are available and the option of voluntary reduced work schedules.*
Conditions of Employment:
* Must be legally entitled to work in Canada
* A satisfactory Criminal Record Check
Qualifications:
Essential:
* Professional designation (i.e. CPA, CIA, CISA, MPA) with a minimum 5 years post designation work experience
* Extensive experience leading a team of auditors in conducting audits that are non\-financial statement audits such as performance audits, internal audits, forensic audits, and investigations.
* Strong project management skills with a history of delivering projects on time and within budget.
* Experience in team building and collaboration with a history of bringing stakeholders together to achieve common goals.
* Excellent communication skills to clearly articulate messaging to a variety of stakeholders.
* Ability to use critical thinking and professional judgement in delivering strongly supported and credible reports.
* Experience applying and monitoring audit methodology and professional standards in an audit team.
* Highly effective interpersonal skills with ability to establish, engage and maintain strong relationships with various stakeholders.
* Experience improving audit processes and procedures to enhance consistency and efficiency.
Desired:
* Extensive knowledge of government, public sector management and external issues that may impact both.
Duties:

*The Advisor is responsible for advising teams and executive sponsors on determining appropriate objectives and criteria for performance audits, preparing audit proposals, the quality of project audits, the appropriate application of the Office’s audit methodology to these audits, and drafting the audit report. The Advisor advises on multiple project audits in various stages of completion.*

*The Advisor works with the Executive Leadership Group and audit teams to improve performance audit processes and procedures to enhance consistency and efficiency, while remaining in alignment with audit standards. This will include continual identification of improvements and developing procedures and aids (templates) that assist staff with conducting performance audits efficiently and effectively.*

zr-Wd1-FenpnwGgVQZgURXk4g,zip_recruiter,https://www.ziprecruiter.com/jobs//j?lvk=Wd1-FenpnwGgVQZgURXk4g,,Operations Manager - Siding,DMC Recruitment,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-29,,,,,,,,,,organic,,"**OPERATIONS MANAGER/PROJECTS LEAD \- Siding**Location: Edmonton
Industry: Building Materials and Construction

Our Client is an industry leader in the drywall, roofing and siding business and is looking to bring on a leader for their siding division based in Edmonton, Alberta! **Operations Manager/Projects Lead \- Siding** is responsible for overseeing and optimizing the operations of the siding division, driving its growth and ensuring seamless project execution. This role focuses on managing day\-to\-day activities, leading Project Managers, Site Supervisors, Labor teams, and Estimators, while implementing strategies to enhance productivity, profitability, and customer satisfaction.

With an emphasis on residential and commercial projects, the Operations Manager will collaborate with Architects, Specifiers, Developers, Contractors, Engineers, and Designers to support project requirements and position the company as a leader in siding solutions. As the primary liaison with vendor representatives, the role ensures strong partnerships to achieve competitive pricing and exceptional quality standards.
**Key Responsibilities**
**Operational Leadership**
* Oversee all aspects of the siding division's operations, including scheduling, inventory management, custom order processing, and project coordination.
* Develop and implement operational strategies to enhance efficiency, ensure on\-time delivery, and exceed client expectations.
* Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure operational success and identify areas for improvement.
* Ensure compliance with health and safety standards across all projects and worksites.
* Manage vendor relationships, ensuring timely procurement of materials at competitive prices.
**Project Management**
* Supervise the planning and execution of siding projects from inception to completion, ensuring alignment with budgets, timelines, and quality standards.
* Coordinate with project coordinators, site supervisors, and labor teams to ensure smooth project workflows.
* Oversee estimators in preparing accurate take\-offs and quotes for siding projects.
* Address project challenges proactively, resolving issues to maintain client satisfaction and operational efficiency.
**Strategic Growth**
* Contribute to the division’s growth by identifying new business opportunities and areas for market expansion.
* Collaborate with senior management to align operational goals with overall business objectives.
* Drive innovation within the division by exploring new products, technologies, and methods to enhance competitiveness.
**Requirements**
**Experience**
* 10\+ years of experience in operations management, construction, or a related field, with a proven track record of delivering results in a fast\-paced environment.
* Extensive experience in project management, preferably within the building materials, siding, or construction industry.
* Strong project management skills, with the ability to oversee multiple projects simultaneously.
* Solid understanding of construction processes, siding products, and building methods is highly desirable.
* Demonstrated ability to lead and inspire teams, fostering a culture of accountability and excellence.
* Strong relationship\-building skills to work effectively with internal teams, clients, and vendors.
* Proficient in MS Office, CRM, and ERP systems.
* Highly organized with strong time management and problem\-solving skills.
**Education and Training**
* Post\-secondary education in business, construction management, or a related field preferred.
* Formal training in operations, project management, or construction is an asset.
**Compensation and Benefits**
* Competitive base salary.
* Annual incentive plan tied to company performance.
* Comprehensive health benefits.
* Vehicle allowance.",,,,,,,,,project manager,2025-01-30

column1: **About the Company:**

*Cushman \& Wakefield \| Stevenson \& MMI Asset Management* is a full\-service commercial real estate firm in Winnipeg, Manitoba that provides solutions in brokerage, asset management, property management, and advisory services.

We are looking for an experienced Property Administrator to join our Residential team. If you are a detail\-oriented professional property administrator looking for a fun, hardworking and collaborative team that supports learning and continuous improvement, we want to meet you!
**Summary:**

The Property Administrator, Residential for Cushman \& Wakefield \| Stevenson has the passion and drive to work closely with and provide support to the Property Manager in the overall management of a residential portfolio. The Property Administrator is responsible for the day\-to\-day tasks that ensure smooth delivery of services to clients and tenants. Day\-to\-day tasks include managing maintenance activities, maintaining filing systems and preparation of notices, documentation and financial reports.
The Property Administrator, Residential reports directly to the Vice President, Multi\-Family Property Management.
**Required Skills and Abilities:**
* Post\-secondary degree or college certification in any subject area is required.
* 2\+ years of residential property administration experience required ability to organize information electronically and paper based
column2: is detail and project oriented.

column1: **Duties and Responsibilities:**
* Prepares leases, renewals, security deposit returns, tenant charge backs, tenant claims, and other leasing duties as required.
* Contacts Residential Tenancies Branch as necessary regarding evictions, claims, etc.
* Assists Property Manager in preparing for meetings, and attends said meetings with the Property Manager as necessary.
* Prepares and administers contracts for provision of property services such as cleaning, maintenance, snow removal and landscaping, etc.
* Coordinates the implementation of repairs, maintenance and renovations carried out within all buildings in the portfolio, and monitors progress through to completion.
* Ensures necessary purchase orders are issued, maintained and tracked.
* Completes photocopying, scanning, saving/filing and emailing of weekly management reports as directed by the Property Manager.
* Prepares and submits reports on general conditions, incidents and other aspects of the Residential portfolio in accordance with established procedures.

* Participates in preparing monthly financial statements and annual budgets.
* Provides recommendations to the Property Manager on the most efficient use of time and equipment, in order to manage project costs.
* Prepares tenant correspondence and notices as directed by the Property Manager.
* Answers tenant inquiries as needed and provides assistance to tenants within the portfolio when re\-quired.

zr-dTvbGZ2OR8Qi9yDeQ8Nbvw,zip_recruiter,https://www.ziprecruiter.com/jobs//j?lvk=dTvbGZ2OR8Qi9yDeQ8Nbvw,,"Leisure Travel Advisor - Brandon, MB",Direct Travel,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-29,fulltime,,,,,,,,,organic,,"**Leisure Travel Advisor – Brandon, MB**
Embark on the next step in your career journey with Direct Travel!

As one of the fastest growing Travel Management Companies (TMC) in the world, Direct Travel is committed to reimagining what is possible for the industry, including business travel, personalized experiences, and meetings \& events. Under the forward\-thinking direction of our experienced leadership team, we are rapidly expanding and leveraging next\-generation technologies to deliver on our vision for The Perfect Trip. This is your opportunity to grow your career and be part of a dynamic team that is setting the new standard of travel and service excellence. If you’re passionate about innovation and ready for what’s next, we’d love for you to join us!
**POSITION IS IN\-OFFICE**
**Expedition Expectations**

As key member of the Direct Travel team, Leisure Travel Advisor will be responsible for the successful completion of leisure travel arrangements for Direct Travel clients. This role will work closely with Leisure Travel team members within the Brandon, MB branch and report to the Branch/Regional Manager.
**Passport to Success**
* Provide leisure travel sales by building a clientele of new and existing business
* Build client base through Virtuoso marketing, local events and personal networking
* Sell Direct Travel strategic supplier products
* Plan itineraries, book tickets, and arrange travel accommodations and services
* Research and provide solutions to client travel\-related problems
* Provide excellent customer services to internal and external clients
* Continued education via Virtuoso Travel Academy, internal programs, and travel
**Going the Extra Mile**
* A minimum of two (2\) years of travel agency experience
* Demonstrate professional customer service skills
* Maintaining a favorable company image when interfacing with outside sources
* Proven pursuit of learning and self\-development
* Demonstrate personal and organizational integrity
* Working in a team environment supporting management and staff, following policies, providing feedback, assisting in special projects, and taking on additional responsibility
* Effective oral and written communications skills
* Solid organizational skills that result in enhanced productivity
* Must be able to lawfully work in Canada and have unrestricted work authorization for Canada
* This is not necessarily an exhaustive list of responsibilities, skills, duties, requirements, or efforts associated with the position.
Benefits Onboard

In addition to Medical, Dental, and Vision benefits Direct Travel offers an employee rewards and recognitions program, Total Rewards Package which includes Wellness, Sustainability, DE\&I initiatives, and Mental Health Support.
Our Brand Voyage: About Direct Travel

Direct Travel is a leading provider of corporate travel management services. By leveraging both the expertise of its people and innovative solutions, Direct Travel enables clients to derive the greatest value from their travel program in terms of superior service, progressive technologies, and significant cost savings. The company is led by CEO Christal Bemont and Executive Chairman Steve Singh, noted business investor and founder of Concur. Direct Travel has offices in over 80 locations and is currently ranked among the top providers of travel on Travel Weekly’s Power List. For more information, visit www.dt.com.
*Direct Travel is an EOE/AA/Veteran/People with Disabilities employer*

**If you're ready to chart a new course and advance your career with the valuable moments and travel experiences that await, we welcome you to submit your resume for consideration at Direct Travel.**",,,,,,,,,project manager,2025-01-30

gd-1009617065386,glassdoor,https://www.glassdoor.ca/job-listing/j?jl=1009617065386,,"Strategy Coordinator, Research Partnerships & Innovation",Red River College Polytechnic,Winnipeg,2025-01-30,,direct_data,yearly,62337.0,87859.0,CAD,False,,,organic,"humanresources@rrc.ca, humanresources@rrc.ca","RRC Polytech is committed to accessible employment and to ensuring that our hiring processes are barrier free. If you require information in an alternate format, or if you require an accommodation to participate in the hiring process, please contact humanresources@rrc.ca.
**Strategy Coordinator (Term Full\-Time)**
**Research Partnerships \& Innovation**
**POSITION TYPE**: Full\-Time, Term Position Available (anticipated March 17, 2025 up to March 31, 2030\)
**SALARY**: $62,337 \- $87,859 per annum
**POSITION LOCATION**: Notre Dame Campus (Winnipeg, MB)

At RRC Polytech we aspire to have a workforce that is representative of the diversity within our communities. For this hiring process, a preference hiring practice will be applied. First consideration will be given to applicants who self\-identify within their application as one or more of the following equity\-deserving group(s): Women, Indigenous Peoples, Persons with Disabilities, Racialized Persons, Persons of the 2SLGBTQlA\+ Community. First consideration will also be given to internal applicants. For more information about our hiring practices, please visit: www.rrc.ca/hr/work/hiring\-process/.

Employment support is available to both internal and external candidates who self\-identify as Indigenous (First Nations, Métis, or Inuit) seeking employment at Red River College Polytechnic. For guidance on the application process, interview preparation, or to discuss accommodation needs, applicants are invited to contact our Indigenous Recruitment Consultant at humanresources@rrc.ca.
**ELIGIBILITY LIST**: This competition may be used to establish a 6 month eligibility list of qualified candidates for future vacancies.
**DUTIES**

The Strategy Coordinator contributes to the academic, research and strategic initiatives of Research Partnerships and Innovation (RPI). The Strategy Coordinator is responsible for developing standard framework practices and processes to ensure the department objectives are met. Using college change management and project management practices, the Strategy Coordinator works collaboratively with internal and external stakeholders and is responsible for leading projects with a results\-oriented focus to meet project goals and deadlines. The incumbent will direct, organize, monitor and report on all projects and initiatives.

This position will have a focus on strategic coordination duties to support the Lab to Market Director, Executive, Steering Committees and Advisory council responsible for implementing the over $24 million Lab to Market project awarded to RRC Polytech to lead and distribute across hub partners. The position will provide support to the Lab to Market Executive Committee, advisory councils, and Director, Lab to Market. Tasks include liaison and communications to institutions, partners and funders
column2: reports and briefings to Lab to Market Executive Committee
column3: events management for annual Summit, Steering committee and Network stakeholders.

go-88ZVVMwznXiK7SVWAAAAAA==,google,https://ca.bebee.com/job/deabbb5455af53e573d52286a44f783c?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,Neuroscience Research Fellowships,Canadian Association for Neuroscience,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-18,,,,,,,False,,,,,"About the Opportunity

The Canadian Association for Neuroscience invites applications for Postdoctoral Fellowships in Stem Cells and Regenerative Neuroscience. This exciting opportunity is part of a renowned research program led by Dr. Soheila Karimi, focusing on neural regeneration and stem cell research.

Our team is recognized internationally for its contributions to cellular and pharmacological therapeutic approaches in preclinical models. We employ an array of advanced approaches, including micro-surgical techniques, stem cell transplantation, transgenic models, neural stem cell/neural tissue culture, and high-throughput transcriptomics and proteomics.
Research Areas
• Uncovering the endogenous mechanisms of neural stem cells differentiation in MS and spinal cord injury.\
• Development of stem cell and pharmacological therapies for enhancing neuronal and oligodendrocytes replacement in progressive MS.\
• Neural stem transplantation in spinal cord injury.\
• Investigating the modulatory roles of reactive astrocytes, microglia, and matrix remodeling in spinal cord injury and MS.\
• Uncovering immune mechanisms and developing immunomodulatory therapies in MS.\
Key Responsibilities

As a Postdoctoral Fellow, you will be involved in studying neurodegeneration, neuroprotection, neural repair, neural stem cells, glial cells, and neuroinflammation in MS and/or SCI. Your responsibilities will include:
• Performing cell culture methods involving isolation and maintenance of rodent neuronal and primary cultures as well as human cell lines.\
• Conducting molecular and cellular biology techniques, such as Western blotting, qPCR, immunohisto/cytochemistry, and RNA seq analysis.\
• Designing and optimizing experimental assays.\
• Maintaining accurate records and contributing to manuscript preparation.\
• Collaborating with colleagues to advance research projects.\
What We Offer

We provide a highly competitive salary, commensurate with qualifications and experience, along with access to state-of-the-art facilities and resources. Our dynamic community values reconciliation, sustainability, diversity, and inclusion. As one of Manitoba's Top Employers and Canada's Best Diversity Employers, we offer outstanding employee benefits and opportunities for growth and professional development.

You will have the chance to collaborate with renowned scholars and scientists at the national and international levels. Our supportive environment fosters intellectual stimulation, creativity, and innovation. Join our network and contribute to advancing neuroscience research.",,,,,,,,,research assistant,2025-01-30

go-jSY_fJQEEF57kkNOAAAAAA==,google,https://ca.trabajo.org/job-2891-418fa935359bc62164594b28a7c1348d?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,Child Health Research Technician,University of Manitoba,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-17,,,,,,,False,,,,,"The University of Manitoba is a driving force of innovation, discovery and advancement. Our momentum is propelled by our campus community - UM faculty, staff and students whose determination and curiosity shape our world for the better. Our teaching, learning and work environment is uniquely strengthened and enriched by Indigenous perspectives. With two main campuses in Winnipeg, satellite campuses throughout Manitoba, and world-wide research, UM’s impact is global.

Discover outstanding employee benefits, experience world-class facilities and join a dynamic community that values reconciliation, sustainability, diversity, and inclusion. We are one of Manitoba’s Top Employers and one of Canada’s Best Diversity Employers. At the University of Manitoba, what inspires you can change everything.
• *The opportunity**:

The incumbent will be responsible to Initiate and conduct research on issues of child and youth health relating to Dr. Roberta Woodgate’s INGAUGE research program. The incumbent will take a holistic and multidisciplinary approach to issues of healthcare and access to healthcare, understanding and articulating how they are connected in today’s complex world. Act as a spokesperson for Dr. Woodgate’s research program, responding to media requests and providing information and comment to the media on issues of child and youth health. Assist in shaping the priorities of Dr. Woodgate’s research program with writing of grant proposals to various agencies, including development of budget. Ensure smooth and efficient day-to-day operation of multiple research projects. Monitors the progress of research activities
column2: develops and maintains records of research activities, preparing periodic and ad hoc reports as required by investigators, administrators, and funding agencies. Assigns and directs work of research support staff, ensuring deadlines are met and research protocol and regulatory requirements of the U of M and funding agencies are followed**.**

column1: • *The qualifications and experience we’re looking for**:
- PhD in a health-related or social sciences fields with three years = directly related experience.
- Masters degree in a health-related or social sciences fields with five years = directly-related experience.
- Experience designing, proposing, conducting and carrying out in-depth and complex research projects including intervention research, is required.
- Experience utilizing qualitative and arts-based data collection and analysis, and artistic knowledge dissemination is required.
- Experience in conducting population-level health and social research using administrative data sets is required.
- Experience working with children and youth in research and a commitment to the engagement of young people in research is required.
- Experience in integrated knowledge translation engaging multiple audiences and users of knowledge in the research process is required.
- Highly competent with MS Office, qualitative and quantitative data management and analysis software is required.
- Experience in designing, proposing, conducting and carrying out systematic reviews is required.
- An acceptable equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered.
- Ability to communicate complex material in accessible forms to a variety of audiences is required.
- Strong academic writing skills (ability to write rigorous research reports and policy briefs) and popular/accessible writing skills (ability to write concise pieces for media, blogs) are required.
- Ability to analyze and then articulate ideas from INGAUGE ideas and research findings with clarity and nuance, is required.
- Must have a sophisticated understanding of complex social issues and personal commitment to human-rights based approach to research.
- Ability and willingness to develop positive working relationships, working effectively part of a dynamic team with academic and non-academic groups, is required.
- Must be self-motivated and be able to work independently.
- Ability to supervise financial records and budgets is required.
- Ability to supervise research coordinators and work with administrative staff is required.
- Ability to demonstrate insight when looking at complex social issues and policy concerns is required.
- Ability to learn new processes and techniques, as well as tolls for use in research and data visualization and presentation is required.
- Satisfactory work record, including satisfactory attendance and punctuality, is required.
• *Why the University of Manitoba?**

Along with being one of Manitoba’s top employers, we are proud to provide a collaborative and enriching work environment. In addition to a strong compensation package with a competitive salary, the University provides an exceptional workplace that includes:
- Comprehensive group benefits and pension plan.
- Competitive vacation time.
- Employee and Family Assistance Program.
- A full spectrum of professional development opportunities.
• *Closing",,,,,,,,,research assistant,2025-01-30

go-ZGq24Ab-utN2FesLAAAAAA==,google,https://ca.trabajo.org/job-2891-3061216c06522ae191d0b036bbcee007?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,"Research Assistant, Developmental Psychology Lab",University of Winnipeg,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-13,,,,,,,True,,,,,"Research Assistants are normally students, in a University of Winnipeg undergraduate program, employed to assist with tasks related to research. Work is performed within defined guidelines and under supervision of a more senior researcher or faculty member.
• *Position Overview**:
• *Duties**:
- Prepare equipment and materials for research: the Research Assistant will maintain lab equipment and spaces (e.g., set up computers or other office furniture
column2: move paper records for storage or disposal). They will also be responsible for keeping testing supplies stocked.

column1: - Assist in data collection, data entry, analysis, and interpretation. This lab conducts research primarily with young children (aged 3-7). The Research Assistant will find and contact schools and daycares, and will arrange for the lab to go testing at places that have agreed to a visit. They will constantly be maintaining and updating a database of locations. They will be responsible for scheduling lab members for these testing appointments and arranging travel from UW to the school/daycare and back. Employee will also run human participants (children and adults) through studies that we will design.
- Perform academic research, standard tests and experiments: the Research Assistant will help design experiments and test human participants.

- Assist with duties related to the production of articles, publications, reports and presentations: the Research Assistant may assist with the preparation of manuscripts that will be submitted for publication.
- Prepare literature reviews: the Research Assistant may be asked to search for relevant papers on Google Scholar.

- Assist in the acquisition of research materials and supplies: the Research Assistant will be responsible for keeping the lab stocked with critical supplies (e.g., paper, stickers, certificates, pens). They will also be responsible for maintaining lab equipment (e.g., charging laptops and tablets).

- Perform data/word processing, routine computations, and record keeping: the Research Assistant will be responsible for maintaining a detailed and well-organized database of schools, daycares, and other community organizations that we might visit. They will also be responsible for managing and organizing all forms (digital or paper) that we send and receive.
• *Qualifications**:
- Academic major: Honours Psychology.
- Specific courses completed: PSYC-2200 mandatory, PSYC-3200 and PSYC-4100 preferred. Coursework in developmental or cognitive psychology preferred.
- Overall GPA: Excellent academic record preferred.
- Software: MS Office (Word, Excel, Powerpoint), Qualtrics, and R preferred.
- Experience working with the community, and especially with young children or families, is an asset.

- Preference will be given to applicants with experience working in a research lab that studies early childhood cognition, especially if they have worked on projects that align with those done in the Thinking and Reasoning Lab.
• *Condition(s) of Employment**:
- **Must be legally entitled to work in Canada.**:
- Employees will need to pass a vulnerable sectors check with the Winnipeg Police Service and a Child Abuse Check with the Province of Manitoba.

- Employees may also need to provide proof of vaccinations (COVID-19, MMR, T-DAP, Varicella, TB) or be willing to get these vaccinations. This will depend on the expectations of the daycares and schools we arrange to visit.
- This work requires travel to places other than UW. For instance, children will be tested at daycares and schools in the community. The employee must be willing to travel to these locations.
The period of work will be from **September 16, 2024 - May 31, 2025 **and the estimated total hours of work will be **0-400 hours**.
• *_ Note_**_: This position is represented by the Public Service Alliance of Canada - Research Capacity Unit._

• *Note**: Some work described in this posting will be conducted remotely but the employee should expect to be in the lab (in-person) at least two days per week.",,,,,,,,,research assistant,2025-01-30

**Research Partnerships \& Innovation**
**POSITION TYPE**: Full\-Time, Term Position Available (anticipated March 17, 2025 up to March 31, 2030\)

At RRC Polytech we aspire to have a workforce that is representative of the diversity within our communities. For this hiring process, a preference hiring practice will be applied. Controls Specialist

This position is an integral part of the SolutionAir team. The successful candidate will have a broad set of technical skills and ready to make an impact on the development of this business unit. Within our Technical Service team, the candidate will help support field installed units, both monitoring, and troubleshooting custom air handling equipment from a controls perspective. Additionally, the candidate will relay field information back to the design team in a clear and concise manner and be involved in the design of new control platforms.
**The successful candidate's responsibilities will include:**
* Communicating with the development engineering team.
* Mapping out programming strategy to meet unit requirements.
* Applying, testing and providing service for programming strategies adopted by the team.
* Creating supporting documentation in Azure.
* Training Application Engineers.
* Supporting the development of products.
* Supporting of HVAC system testing in production, laboratories or job sites.
* Training others in controls operation, programming and troubleshooting.
**The ideal candidate for this position will have:**
* A university/college degree in Mechanical, Electrical, Electronics or equivalent experience.
* 3\+ years in product design and development of large mechanical, commercial, or HVAC equipment is considered an asset.
* Knowledge of HVAC controls equipment and Building Management Systems (BMS) and Building Automation and Controls (BAC) networks preferred.
* Experience with BMS protocols such as BACnet, Modbus, etc. preferred.
* Knowledge of programming in Structured text and function blocks.
* Knowledge of SDLC and Azure DevOps is considered an asset
* Strong interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills.
* Demonstrated strong analytical skills, especially breaking down complex requirements.
* Excellent time management and project management skills.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to communicate at all levels of the organization.
* The proven ability to take ownership of tasks and from start to delivery, including analysis, estimating, implementation, testing and documentation.
* The proven ability to work in a team environment with various stakeholders and roles including business analyst, architect, project manager, and quality assurance.
* A strong commitment to professional development.
Should this excellent opportunity interest you, please submit your resume, including salary expectations.

Andrea Toyne
753 McDermot Ave
Responsibilities:
- Consults and provides services to principal investigators, research staff, and all others who seek clinical research data management solutions through CHI.
- Provides guidance on the process of accessing clinical research data management software (e.g. REDCap) available through CHI.
- Provides information and resources on setting up and maintaining clinical research databases at CHI.
- Enforces REDCap project management processes and account management processes.
- Investigates software solutions for the development and maintenance of electronic databases.
- Documents clinical research data management processes and solutions.
- Ensures that technical assistance is provided throughout the database development and implementation phases of a research project.
- Liaises with stakeholders and establishes clinical studies and administrative databases in REDCap, maintains the databases within a secure environment, and provides ongoing technical support.
- Ensures quality data is collected by monitoring the usage of established REDCap databases and adhering to data lifecycle management principles.
- Provides training in clinical research data management.
- Develops and delivers workshops, seminars, and other training events and materials to existing and potential users of clinical research data management software.
- Schedules and coordinates training events in consultation with relevant user and stakeholder groups.
- Responds to REDCap enquiries from the research community and troubleshoots research database issues.
- Participates in activities to oversee the implementation and maintenance of CHI's clinical research data management software.
- Works with CHI staff to define the mandate, priorities, key activities, and structures of clinical research data working groups established by CHI.
- Provides support for clinical research data working groups established by CHI, sets agendas, and ensures that meeting minutes are maintained.
- Attends and participates in clinical research data user group meetings.
- Ensures that CHI staff have up-to-date information about CHI's clinical research data management activities.
- Performs other related duties, as assigned.
Qualifications:
MINIMUM FORMAL EDUCATION/TRAINING:
- Master's degree in data science, epidemiology, biostatistics, computer science, health information management, experimental social sciences, or a related discipline.
EXPERIENCE:
- A minimum of one-year experience in data collection form development, survey administration, and/or research database management is required.
- Knowledge of electronic data collection processes and software, such as REDCap, is a strong asset.
- Experience with clinical trials and the associated data collection is an asset.
- An acceptable equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered.
SKILLS AND ABILITIES:
- Expertise in principles and practices of clinical data and databases management is required.
- Working knowledge of research data management software (e.g. REDCap), MS-Office, and statistical software (e.g. SAS and/or R) is required.
- Familiarly with data validation methods is an asset.

- Familiarly with International Council on Harmonization-Good Clinical Practice (ICH-GCP), the Personal Health Information Act, and the Tri-Council Policy on the Ethical Conduct for Research Involving Humans is an asset.
- Good oral and written communication skills and strong analytical skills are required.
- Ability to set priorities, multi-task and work effectively under time-constrains required.
- Must be able to work in complex team environment with researchers, clinicians, and representatives from external agencies, such as government departments.
- Must be able to work independently with mínimal supervision.
- Ability to diagnose and resolve software and system problems is required.
- Ability to develop strong interpersonal working relationships is required.
- Demonstrated ability to provide excellent customer service is required.
- Satisfactory work record, including satisfactory attendance and punctuality
