Central Testing Laboratory Ltd. has been built on the core values of honesty, integrity, fairness, and loyalty to employees and clients. Our corporate culture provides growth and development opportunities for all employees committed to fulfilling the Company’s vision, and for continuous improvement in quality, processes and instrumental capability. We cultivate a client focused environment with dedication to client service and satisfaction.

We recognize that our greatest asset is our employees. Our management philosophy is committed to value and recognize this asset by investing in and supporting employee involvement, empowerment and training in an environment of goodwill and trust with the highest standards of ethics \& integrity. We support our staff in many different ways including fostering a unique family working environment that is not commonplace in most working environments.

Central Testing Laboratory Ltd. is proud of the reputation we have earned for technical expertise in providing analytical products and services to all segments of industry, government, and the academic world. CTL has developed extensive expertise covering all aspects of the services we provide.
If you are looking to break out of the status quo by joining a great company– where you will have the freedom to put your stamp on the organization …….. ……this may be the place for you !
This job is located at our corporate offices conveniently located on Lagimodiere just south of Marion
Check us out at http://www.ctl.mb.ca/
YOUR JOB PURPOSE
Reporting to the General Manager, you will work cooperatively to prepare samples for further analysis. Help troubleshoot problems, be a leader motivator and innovator.
IN THIS ROLE YOU WILL
* Perform laboratory analysis according to Standard Operating Procedures
* Operate laboratory instruments as required. ie. Ovens, furnaces, balances, centrifuges, etc.
* Scale and pipette calibration as required
* Sample preparation. ie. Grinding, weighing, etc.
* Reagent preparation
* Data processing. ie. Calculations, data review, data entry, etc.
* Ensure ongoing accuracy and technician quality by participating in a laboratory wide proficiency testing program
YOUR SKILLS
* No experience needed
* Organized and able to meet deadlines
* Incredible attention to detail
* Ideally has a knowledge of agriculture, science, food safety and animal nutrition
* Strong written and oral communication skills
TYPE OF PERSON WHO WOULD SUCCEED IN THIS ROLE:
* Directive personality – solves problems in decisive manner.
* Positive and outgoing – interacts with the public in a socially engaging manner
* Detail oriented – but with creative ability to get the job done.
* Customer centric \- Strong drive to help others.
* Approachable and professional.
* Honest, Dependable and a Team Player.
NEXT STEPS:

If your excited about this opportunity and believe you are qualified to join our team, we would love to hear from you. Please send us your resume, along with a cover letter that briefly responds (in separate numbered paragraphs) to the following questions:
1\) Relevant qualifications and work experience
2\) Why you feel you are you a good match for this role
3\) Your salary expectations (ballpark)
\* If you do not include a cover letter – your application will likely not be read

Shared Health leads the planning and coordinates the integration of patient\-centered clinical and preventive health services across Manitoba. The organization also delivers some province\-wide health services and supports centralized administrative and business functions for Manitoba health organizations.
**Position Overview**

Under the general supervision of the Charge or designate, the General Duty Medical Laboratory Technologist is responsible for clinical analysis and reporting on patient samples according to established protocols. The General Duty Medical Laboratory Technologist is also responsible for assisting in general lab projects such as SOPs, chemical inventories, etc. The incumbent will maintain a safe environment in accordance with professional and provincial guidelines and ensure compliance with quality assurance programs and maintain standards put forth by Accreditation. Functions are conducted in accordance with the Mission and Values of Shared Health Diagnostic Services, current policies, procedures and applicable legislation.
**Experience**
* Previous related experience preferred.
**Education (Degree/Diploma/Certificate)**
* Graduate of an approved Medical Laboratory Technology program.
* Successful completion of the CMLTM Prior Learning Assessment process for a discipline specialty, as deemed by the Employer may also be considered.
**Certification/Licensure/Registration**
* Current registration or eligible for registration with the College of Medical Laboratory Technologists of Manitoba (CMLTM) required.
* Current membership with the Canadian Society for Medical Laboratory Science (CSMLS) considered an asset.
**Qualifications and Skills**
* Must be able to communicate effectively in English, both written and oral.
* Windows computer environment required.
* Microsoft Office programs preferred.
* Follow oral and written instructions precisely with attention to detail.
* Demonstrated ability to work both independently and as a team member.
* Proficient analytical skills.
* Work under pressure.
* Maintains confidentiality with all information entrusted to the position.
* Fluent language skill (written and oral) in both French may be required.
* Ability to perform duties as described.
**Physical Requirements**
* Working shifts, weekends and holidays may be required.
* Participating in standby and callback duty may be required.
* Rotate through various workstations as required.
* Exposure to all hazards and dangers incumbent in working in a laboratory.
* For more definitive information, refer to the Job Hazard Analysis Assessment of this position within the specific laboratory.

We have a unique ability to work together to make health care better. If you want to make a difference and contribute to supporting the health of your family, friends and neighbours, please apply today.
Interested candidates should select the ""Apply"" icon below to upload their cover letter, resume and copy of licenses/certification.

**This position requires a current satisfactory Criminal Records Check (including Vulnerable Sector Search), Child Abuse Registry Check and Adult Abuse Registry Check as conditions of employment. Shared Health leads the planning and coordinates the integration of patient-centered clinical and preventive health services across Manitoba. The organization also delivers some province-wide health services and supports centralized administrative and business functions for Manitoba health organizations.
Position Overview

• Reprocesses more complex specialized surgical instruments in preparation for sterilization including: disassembling, manual washing, ultrasonic washing, quality assurance checks such as functionality and cleanliness, and reassembly of complex equipment such as the computerized stereotactic neurological instruments.

• Reassembles the more complex surgical sets with the various instrumentation (e.g. spinal instrumentation). The more complex instrumentation often has specialized handling instructions and often the cost of the equipment prohibits having more than one in the facility.
• Maintains an awareness of the subtle complexities of the instruments from all of the specialties.
• Reads and interprets the slate in order to anticipate surgical requirements for surgical cases on current and future shifts.
• Utilizes a generated pick list to complete instrumentation and consumables required for Case cart.

• Maintains an understanding of the dynamics of sterilization and an ability to operate any sterilization system in use within the department including preparing the device for a particular sterilization technique, operating the sterilizer, and processing monitoring readings, error codes and quality assurance for load releases.
• Maintains an understanding of and adheres to Quality Assurance Policies and Procedures.
• Handles and transports sterile supplies.
• Applies inverting rotation and sterility maintenance principles.
• Interacts in person and/or on the telephone with operating room personnel to ensure supply issues are met.
• Transports soiled surgical instruments and equipment, while ensuring infection control principles are followed.
• Critical problem-solving and decision-making is required including: prioritization of which instrument to process to meet surgical requirement
column2: customer service complaints
column3: dialoging with surgical staff regarding missing instruments
column4: and determining that equipment is functional prior to preparing for sterilization.

column1: • Acts as a liaison with nursing staff when preparing for emergency trauma cases.
Experience
• Previous Medical Device Reprocessing Technician I experience required.
• Previous case cart picking preferred.
Education (Degree/Diploma/Certificate)
• Complete Grade 12 education, Manitoba standards, required.
• Successful completion of a recognized Sterile Processing Technician program required.
Certification/Licensure/Registration
Not Applicable
Qualifications And Skills
• Preference will be given to those applicants competent in an Indigenous language and/or knowledge in Indigenous customs, traditions and values.
• Must understand and apply safety principles to self, staff and patients, and demonstrate good customer service.
• Basic computer skills required.
• Must have a good knowledge of surgical instrumentation, consumable supplies and sterilization techniques.
• Must be fluent in written and verbal English, and possess good interpersonal and communication skills.
• Must be versatile and rotate through and assist with all the assignments.
• Must be capable of working under pressure and performing a wide range of duties that may require independent action.
• Must be able to apply knowledge through experience to organize duties systematically.
• Must be cooperative, alert, accept directions, and be able to function as a team member.
Physical Requirements

• Work involves frequent exposure to infectious body and blood borne organisms when working with soiled equipment and toxic effects when working with ETO sterilizers and Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System (WHMIS) products.
• Position involves meticulous attention to detail with regards to technical and mechanical ability.
• Must maintain a clean and orderly work environment.
• Pushing and pulling sterilizer carts and supply carts as required.
• Bending and stooping.
• Loading and unloading of carts.
• Lifting and positioning of articles in excess of 30 pounds (i.e. OR instrument pans, etc.).
• Repetitive hand arm and shoulder motions and long periods of standing.
• Potential for burns from working with steam sterilizers and hot carts.
This term position may end earlier as outlined in your collective agreement.

Shared Health leads the planning and coordinates the integration of patient\-centered clinical and preventive health services across Manitoba. The organization also delivers some province\-wide health services and supports centralized administrative and business functions for Manitoba health organizations.
**Position Overview**

Under the general supervision of the Charge or designate, the General Duty Medical Laboratory Technologist is responsible for clinical analysis and reporting on patient samples according to established protocols. The General Duty Medical Laboratory Technologist is also responsible for assisting in general lab projects such as SOPs, chemical inventories, etc. The incumbent will maintain a safe environment in accordance with professional and provincial guidelines and ensure compliance with quality assurance programs and maintain standards put forth by Accreditation. Functions are conducted in accordance with the Mission and Values of Shared Health Diagnostic Services, current policies, procedures and applicable legislation.
**Experience**
* Previous related experience preferred.
**Education (Degree/Diploma/Certificate)**
* Graduate of an approved Medical Laboratory Technology program.
* Successful completion of the CMLTM Prior Learning Assessment process for a discipline specialty, as deemed by the Employer may also be considered.
**Certification/Licensure/Registration**
* Current registration or eligible for registration with the College of Medical Laboratory Technologists of Manitoba (CMLTM) required.
* Current membership with the Canadian Society for Medical Laboratory Science (CSMLS) considered an asset.
**Qualifications and Skills**
* Must be able to communicate effectively in English, both written and oral.
* Windows computer environment required.
* Microsoft Office programs preferred.
* Follow oral and written instructions precisely with attention to detail.
* Demonstrated ability to work both independently and as a team member.
* Proficient analytical skills.
* Work under pressure.
* Maintains confidentiality with all information entrusted to the position.
* Fluent language skill (written and oral) in both French may be required.
* Ability to perform duties as described.
**Physical Requirements**
* Working shifts, weekends and holidays may be required.
* Participating in standby and callback duty may be required.
* Rotate through various workstations as required.
* Exposure to all hazards and dangers incumbent in working in a laboratory.
* For more definitive information, refer to the Job Hazard Analysis Assessment of this position within the specific laboratory.

* * Gathers data on newly available properties, transactions, tenants, tenants in the market, and new developments and inputs data into appropriate databases.

* * Performs regular maintenance and updates to property databases by conducting telephone surveys, on\-site surveys, research forums, broker meetings, extracting data from brochures and other marketing materials, contacting civic organizations, outside agents, internet, and other sources.
* * Implements Research processes to assure data quality is in accordance with corporate standards.
* * Responds to ad hoc internal and external client requests for data, graphs, commentary, etc.
* * Maintains accurate property and availability information relating to all properties managed by CBRE entities.

go-hojCJWT2DuuWEXHeAAAAAA==,google,https://ca.trabajo.org/job-2891-ac6ba7670bfb485b31ba67be7e7a0ce0?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,"Research Assistant, Racial Identities in",University of Winnipeg,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-12,,,,,,,False,,,,,"**This posting will be used to hire 2 positions**

Research Assistants are normally students, in a University of Winnipeg undergraduate program, employed to assist with tasks related to research. Work is performed within defined guidelines and under supervision of a more senior researcher or faculty member.
• *Position Overview**:

The Research Assistant (RA) will work with online digital archives and assist with collecting and organizing archival sources in a database that the RA will create and maintain. The sources in question are parish records that contain baptism, marriage, and death registries from the seventeenth century, starting with the island of Faial (Azores Archipelago). Once the gathering and organizing of those archival sources is complete, the RA will be trained in palaeography and assist with the deciphering of those records.
• *Duties**:
- Assist in data collection, data entry, analysis and interpretation
- Assist with duties related to the production of articles, publications, reports and presentations
- Prepare literature reviews
- Perform routine clerical and administrative duties to support research activities
• *Qualifications**:

- Preference will be given to history students, and particularly to students who have taken courses in pre-modern Europe such as Children and Childhood in Pre-Modern Europe or Slaves, Serfs, and Servants in Pre-Modern Europe.
- Preference will be given to applicants who have a 3.5 GPA or higher.
- Preference will be given to applicants who can read Spanish or Portuguese, or are willing to learn to read manuscript sources from the seventeenth century written in one of those languages.
• *Condition(s) of Employment**:
- **Must be legally entitled to work in Canada.**
The period of work will be from **October 18, 2024 - April 4, 2025 **and the estimated total hours of work will be **10-240 hours**.
• *_ Note_**_: This position is represented by the Public Service Alliance of Canada - Research Capacity Unit._

• *Position Overview**:
Research Assistant needed to assist in compiling and designing visually appealing content based on course materials and literature related to Indigenous knowledge systems.
• *Duties**:
- Excellent independent research writing and content development skills including referencing styles.
- Assist in communication and coordination with potential contributors including Indigenous communities.
- Assist in developing sections of peer-reviewed publications based on primary and secondary research.
- Ability to compile and use literature on Indigenous food systems, Indigenous healing and planetary health including course materials, books, and internet.
- Design visually appealing content based on synthesis of course materials.

- Help in designing a course on Indigenous Innovation based on compiled literature on Indigenous food systems, Indigenous healing and planetary health peer-reviewed and grey materials, books, files, documentation
• *Qualifications**:
- Senior undergraduate or first year graduate level students are preferred.

- Must have good knowledge, understanding and Interest in Indigenous knowledge systems, health and well-being, food systems, planetary health and sustainability topics either through courses, and research project involvement or community experience.

- Must have completed either IS-2401, IS-3201 or IS-2012 or IS-4026 OR similar course at University of Winnipeg/ Canadian Post secondary institution with at least B+ OR relevant experience in the topics of these courses.
- Good comprehension, research and analytical skills including researching and organizing research papers.
- Experience with conducting independent scholarly literature search, review and copy editing.
- Good knowledge of small office works, admin and familiarity with endnote or other library referencing system to prepare bibliography.
- Good interpersonal communication skills and familiarity with small office jobs.
- Excellent skills and experience in created visually appealing media on computer.
- Must be able to work independently and available for on-campus meetings.
• *Condition(s) of Employment**:
- **Must be legally entitled to work in Canada.**
The period of work will be from **October 15, 2024 - March 28, 2025 **and the estimated total hours of work will be **0-200 hours**.
• *_ Note_**_: This position is represented by the Public Service Alliance of Canada - Research Capacity Unit._
• *Note**: The work described in this posting will be conducted in-person.",,,,,,,,,research assistant,2025-01-31

zr-iJJQWlUuZpuDhO0OYHcTAg,zip_recruiter,https://www.ziprecruiter.com/jobs//j?lvk=iJJQWlUuZpuDhO0OYHcTAg,,Senior Data Engineer,Lotlinx,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-30,,direct_data,yearly,108000.0,162000.0,CAD,,,,organic,,"Since our founding in 2012, Lotlinx has consistently pioneered advancements in the automotive landscape. We specialize in empowering automobile dealers and manufacturers by providing cutting\-edge data and technology, delivering a distinct market advantage for every single vehicle transaction. Today, we stand as the foremost automotive AI and machine learning powered technology, excelling in digital marketing, risk management, and strategic inventory management.

Lotlinx provides employees with a dynamic work environment that is challenging, team\-oriented, and full of passionate people. We offer great incentives to our employees, such as competitive compensation and benefits, flex time off, and career development opportunities.
**Job Summary**

The Senior Data Engineer will be responsible for the development and deployment of cloud\-first ETL processes, Data management, Data Warehousing and more in the Automotive Digital Advertising industry. LotLinx is looking for a candidate who thrives in a fast\-paced, collaborative environment and can utilize data to improve, optimize and lead further development of our data aggregation processes.
This hybrid position is located in either our **Winnipeg** or **Hamilton** office locations.
**Key** **Responsibilities**
* Design, build, and maintain robust, scalable, and efficient data pipelines to process large\-scale datasets from multiple sources.
* Develop and manage ETL/ELT workflows for data ingestion, transformation, and loading into data lakes and warehouses.
* Architect and implement cloud\-based solutions (AWS, GCP) to ensure data security, scalability, and high availability.
* Work with stakeholders including Analytics, Product, and Design teams to assist with data related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.
* Partner with DevOps and Security teams to ensure compliance with data governance, privacy, and security standards.
* Engineer solutions for large data storage, management.
* Proactively identify and resolve performance bottlenecks, scaling challenges, and technical issues.
* Explore available technologies and design solutions to continuously improve our data quality, workflow reliability, scalability while reporting performance and capabilities.
* Act as an internal expert in each of the data sources so that you can own overall data quality.
**Qualifications:**
* 5\+ years of experience in data engineering or a similar role, with a focus on designing and managing scalable data systems.
* Proven expertise with cloud platforms, specifically AWS and/or GCP.
* Proficiency in SQL, including advanced query optimization and data modeling techniques.
* Strong programming skills in Python, Scala, or Java, with a focus on developing data processing applications.
* Experience with Data Engineering tools such as Airflow, Dataflow, DBT.
* Experience with big data frameworks like Apache Spark, Hadoop, or Beam.
* Hands\-on experience with real\-time data streaming platforms such as Apache Kafka, Pub/Sub, or Kinesis.
* Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines, version control systems (e.g., Git), and containerization technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
* Experience managing data warehouses and lakes using modern platforms such as Snowflake, BigQuery, or Redshift.
* Familiarity with data governance frameworks, security best practices, and compliance standards.
* Demonstrated ability to solve complex technical challenges, think creatively and innovate within cloud and data ecosystems.
The salary range for this position is $108,000 \- $162,000\.

Lotlinx is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.
Lotlinx is not currently able to offer sponsorship for employment visa status.
Lotlinx is headquartered in Peterborough, NH and has locations in Holmdel NJ, Manitoba, Ontario and British Columbia, Canada in addition to a large team spanning from the US to Canada.

Our success relies heavily on our customers but also our dedicated talent that continuously moves our platform forward. gd-1009618400071,glassdoor,https://www.glassdoor.ca/job-listing/j?jl=1009618400071,,Research Analyst,"Liquor, Gaming and Cannabis Authority of Manitoba (LGCA)",Winnipeg,2025-01-31,,direct_data,yearly,67198.0,81270.0,CAD,False,,,organic,resumes@LGCAmb.ca,"**Advertisement \#43740**
**Research Analyst**
**Regular / Full\-Time**
**Policy and Research Department, Strategic Services and Public Affairs Unit**
**Closing Date: February 12, 2025**
**Salary Range: $67,198 \- $81,270 per annum (6XH)**

The Liquor, Gaming and Cannabis Authority of Manitoba (LGCA) regulates the province’s liquor, gaming, cannabis, and horse racing industries. We license liquor sales, service and manufacturing, gaming employees, products and operations
column2: retail cannabis stores
column3: and horse racing. We strive to serve the public interest by regulating these industries in a respectful, impartial, and balanced manner.

column1: The LGCA is seeking a highly motivated individual to work within the Policy and Research Department, which is part of the Strategic Services and Public Affairs Unit. The Research Analyst is responsible for conducting research and analysis to support LGCA’s research agenda.
**Qualifications**
**The successful candidate must have:**

· A university degree from a post\-secondary institution in the social or health sciences or a related discipline, with a focus on quantitative and qualitative research methodologies, research design and data analysis
column2: with three to five years of research experience, preferably in a public research environment. A combination of education and experience may also be considered.

column1: · Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively communicate with staff, clients and stakeholders.
· Attention to detail, impartiality and sound judgment, with demonstrated problem\-solving, decision\- making and analytical skills.
· Demonstrated political acumen and respect for others to handle sensitive and confidential matters, including controversial and urgent matters.
· Knowledge and experience of quantitative and qualitative research methodologies and data analysis, which inform communications and policy decisions.
· Strong organizational and project management skills with the ability to plan, balance and manage multiple work demands and deadlines, and coordinate projects through to completion.
· Demonstrated ability to work independently as well as in a team environment.
· Knowledge and adherence to ethical and academic research standards.
· Proficiency with Microsoft 365 and specialized databases including SPSS.
**The following qualifications are desired:**
· Experience conducting research related to liquor, gaming or cannabis.
· Proficiency in French.
**Your cover letter and résumé must clearly indicate how you meet the qualifications.**
**Duties:**

The Research Analyst is responsible for conducting research and analysis related to LGCA’s complex research initiatives. The incumbent is responsible to conduct quantitative and qualitative research for projects that inform communications and policy decisions, and have a broad impact on the liquor, gaming, cannabis and horse racing research communities. The incumbent also conducts comprehensive literature reviews and summarizes literature to inform research reports.
**Additional Information:**
· An eligibility list may be created for similar positions and will remain in effect for 12 months.
· Applicants may be required to write a screening/selection exercise/test.
· Applicants must be legally entitled to work in Canada.
· Circumstances may arise where the competition may need to be withdrawn.
· A positive attendance record will be a consideration in the screening process.
· Satisfactory work performance in the preceding 12 months is required.
· A satisfactory criminal record check is a condition of employment.
· Successful completion of the TCPS 2: CORE research ethics training is required.

The LGCA has a comprehensive compensation and benefits package that includes extended health care, health spending account, dental care, vision care, long term disability insurance, group life insurance, maternity leave top\-up plan, family related leave and a defined benefit pension plan (some pension plans allow for portability between the Civil Service Superannuation Board and employers). Training, educational support and career development opportunities are also available.
**Apply to:**
Advertisement \#43740
Liquor, Gaming and Cannabis Authority of Manitoba
Human Resources
1055 Milt Stegall Drive
Winnipeg MB R3G 0Z6
Email: resumes@LGCAmb.ca

**Please quote your name and the advertisement number in the subject line of your email.** Please submit your cover letter, resumé and any other documents in PDF format. The LGCA does not accept .zip files or links to Google Docs, Dropbox, or any cloud\-based storage systems as a substitute for PDF documents.
**Accessibility**
LGCA will consult with all applicants requesting accommodation during the recruitment process to ensure that the accommodation provided considers the applicant’s individual accessibility needs.

Employment equity is a factor in selection. Applicants are requested to indicate in their covering letter or resumé if they are from any of the following groups: women, Indigenous people, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.
We thank all who apply. Only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.
Visit LGCAmb.ca to learn more about the Liquor, Gaming and Cannabis Authority of Manitoba.
Job Types: Full\-time, Permanent
Schedule:
* Monday to Friday
Work Location: In person
Application deadline: 2024\-10\-09",,,,,,,,,data analyst,2025-01-31

• *WINNIPEG, MB**
Manitoba Hydro is consistently recognized as one of Manitoba's Top Employers
• *_ Great Benefits_**
- Competitive salary and benefits package.
- Defined-benefit pension plan.
- Nine-day work cycle which normally results in every other Monday off, providing for a balanced approach to work, family life
- and community.- Flex-time and partially remote work schedule (providing the option to work remotely 3 days per 2 week period), depending on
nature of work, operational requirements and work location.
Manitoba Hydro is a leader among energy companies in North America, recognized for providing highly reliable service and
exceptional customer satisfaction. Join our team of Manitoba's best as we continue to build a company that supports innovation,
commitment and customer service.
We are seeking a team member to join our Enterprise Environment team. Reporting to the Sustainability and Environmental Risk
Lead, the Environmental Data and Analytics Officer will provide business support services to improve overall departmental and
enterprise performance and fulfill its mandate to provide leadership, expertise, and support at senior levels of the Corporation
towards the development and fulfillment of key measures for the Corporate Strategic Plan. This includes sourcing, preparing, and
analyzing enterprise environmental data and collaboratively developing strategies that improve Manitoba Hydro's environmental
performance. The Environmental Data and Analytics Officer also provides project direction, leadership, and support towards
business plan optimization, process improvements, performance measurement, and review aligned with corporate strategies. This
will be achieved by building strong working relationships with management and other key stakeholders throughout the corporation.
• *_ Responsibilities:_**
- Lead and/or coordinate the development of new and innovative opportunities to continuously improve corporate alignment and
performance, including the corporation's strategic planning, performance measurement, and business planning processes in
relation to environmental protection.
- Coordinate, review, and ensure the accuracy of environmental performance information provided to external parties including
regulators and industry groups.
- Compile, analyze, and prepare environmental data reports for submission to internal and external stakeholders, including
regulatory agencies.
- Develop and maintain data tracking tools, and review and analyze relevant information to identify leading and lagging
indicators and areas of improvement.
- Develop project plans, including communication strategies, implementation strategies, milestones and management system
indicators/measures for the strategic development of enterprise environmental initiatives.
- Maintain knowledge of relevant legislation in order to interpret and provide advice regarding legislated requirements to Senior
Management, the Enterprise Environment Department, and staff across the enterprise.
- Develop performance metrics related to activities within the Department and across the enterprise for monthly, quarterly, and
annual reporting and trending.
- Develop analytical reports that provide predictive modelling for incidents and document the success of mitigation strategies.
- Collaborate with and work alongside the Safety Data and Analytics Officer on shared divisional projects.
• *_ Qualifications:_**
- Four-year university degree from an institute of recognized standing in a discipline related to the duties (such as
Environmental Science or Environmental Studies) plus a minimum of five years of progressively responsible work experience.
OR
- Two-year diploma in a related discipline plus seven years' of progressively responsible work experience.
- Graduate degree and/or professional designation in a relevant field (such as Project Management or Business Analytics)

go-iTjr3qrIwitJVi1nAAAAAA==,google,https://ca.trabajo.org/job-2891-589a7c811033fd1c6bcb0ba83c336399?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,Junior Data Scientist,Laivly,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-13,,,,,,,False,,,,,"**About Laivly**

• *As a Junior Data Scientist, You Will**
- Develop models/tools required to achieve business objectives within a Kubenetes-based machine learning platform
- Analyze and experiment with ML algorithms and models (both statistical and deep learning) to determine viability of solving business challenges
- Assist in hyperparameter tuning of models for optimal performance
- Document and explain the results of experiments for relevant stakeholders
- Assist in gathering and manipulation of data, including verifying/ensuring data quality, and defining pre-processing and feature engineering

- Have fun building Skynet to take over humanity. We're joking, of course.

- Perform other duties as assigned
• *As a Junior Data Scientist, You Have**
- Bachelor’s (required) or Master’s (asset) degree/equivalent in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering or similar with practical experience in machine learning development
- An understanding of data (structured and unstructured), data storage, and data processing
- Experience performing exploratory data analysis and building machine learning models and algorithms using a variety of machine learning techniques
- Are comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams
- A passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes.
- Proficiency with a deep learning frameworks (Keras, Tensorfow, Pytorch)
- Proficiency in Python development and basic ML libraries (numpy, pandas, scikit-learn)
- Strong documentation skills and the ability to explain machine learning concepts and relevant experiments to different stakeholders
- Experience with transformer models is preferred
- Experience with data integration and reporting is preferred
- Experience working with Agile software development methodologies is an asset
- Experience with large language models is a plus
- Excellent written and verbal communication skills
• *Life at Laivly**:

Laivly gives you the opportunity to collaborate and grow your career with a diverse and passionate team. A career at Laivly is about working with a fun-loving, dedicated team of creatives, risk takers and game changers. It’s about sharing your talent and imagination to develop innovative tech that’s revolutionizing the way top brands interact with the world.
We’ve got a shared mission - and a Laivly future. Join us today

in-f8f256764e83226c,indeed,https://ca.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=f8f256764e83226c,http://ca.indeed.com/job/research-analyst-f8f256764e83226c,Research Analyst,"Liquor, Gaming and Cannabis Authority of Manitoba (LGCA)","Winnipeg, MB, CA",2025-01-30,fulltime,,,,,,False,,,,resumes@LGCAmb.ca,"**Advertisement \#43740**
**Research Analyst**
**Regular / Full\-Time**
**Policy and Research Department, Strategic Services and Public Affairs Unit**
**Closing Date: February 12, 2025**
**Salary Range: $67,198 \- $81,270 per annum (6XH)**

The Liquor, Gaming and Cannabis Authority of Manitoba (LGCA) regulates the province’s liquor, gaming, cannabis, and horse racing industries. We license liquor sales, service and manufacturing, gaming employees, products and operations
column2: retail cannabis stores
column3: and horse racing. We strive to serve the public interest by regulating these industries in a respectful, impartial, and balanced manner.

column1: The LGCA is seeking a highly motivated individual to work within the Policy and Research Department, which is part of the Strategic Services and Public Affairs Unit. The Research Analyst is responsible for conducting research and analysis to support LGCA’s research agenda.
**Qualifications**
**The successful candidate must have:**

· A university degree from a post\-secondary institution in the social or health sciences or a related discipline, with a focus on quantitative and qualitative research methodologies, research design and data analysis
column2: with three to five years of research experience, preferably in a public research environment. A combination of education and experience may also be considered.

column1: · Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively communicate with staff, clients and stakeholders.
· Attention to detail, impartiality and sound judgment, with demonstrated problem\-solving, decision\- making and analytical skills.
· Demonstrated political acumen and respect for others to handle sensitive and confidential matters, including controversial and urgent matters.
· Knowledge and experience of quantitative and qualitative research methodologies and data analysis, which inform communications and policy decisions.
· Strong organizational and project management skills with the ability to plan, balance and manage multiple work demands and deadlines, and coordinate projects through to completion.
· Demonstrated ability to work independently as well as in a team environment.
· Knowledge and adherence to ethical and academic research standards.
· Proficiency with Microsoft 365 and specialized databases including SPSS.
**The following qualifications are desired:**
· Experience conducting research related to liquor, gaming or cannabis.
· Proficiency in French.
**Your cover letter and résumé must clearly indicate how you meet the qualifications.**
**Duties:**

The Research Analyst is responsible for conducting research and analysis related to LGCA’s complex research initiatives. The incumbent is responsible to conduct quantitative and qualitative research for projects that inform communications and policy decisions, and have a broad impact on the liquor, gaming, cannabis and horse racing research communities. The incumbent also conducts comprehensive literature reviews and summarizes literature to inform research reports.
**Additional Information:**
· An eligibility list may be created for similar positions and will remain in effect for 12 months.
· Applicants may be required to write a screening/selection exercise/test.
· Applicants must be legally entitled to work in Canada.
· Circumstances may arise where the competition may need to be withdrawn.
· A positive attendance record will be a consideration in the screening process.
· Satisfactory work performance in the preceding 12 months is required.
· A satisfactory criminal record check is a condition of employment.
· Successful completion of the TCPS 2: CORE research ethics training is required.

The LGCA has a comprehensive compensation and benefits package that includes extended health care, health spending account, dental care, vision care, long term disability insurance, group life insurance, maternity leave top\-up plan, family related leave and a defined benefit pension plan (some pension plans allow for portability between the Civil Service Superannuation Board and employers). Training, educational support and career development opportunities are also available.
**Apply to:**
Advertisement \#43740
Liquor, Gaming and Cannabis Authority of Manitoba
Human Resources
1055 Milt Stegall Drive
Winnipeg MB R3G 0Z6
Email: resumes@LGCAmb.ca

**Please quote your name and the advertisement number in the subject line of your email.** Please submit your cover letter, resumé and any other documents in PDF format. The LGCA does not accept .zip files or links to Google Docs, Dropbox, or any cloud\-based storage systems as a substitute for PDF documents.
**Accessibility**
LGCA will consult with all applicants requesting accommodation during the recruitment process to ensure that the accommodation provided considers the applicant’s individual accessibility needs.

Employment equity is a factor in selection. Applicants are requested to indicate in their covering letter or resumé if they are from any of the following groups: women, Indigenous people, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.
We thank all who apply. Only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.
Visit LGCAmb.ca to learn more about the Liquor, Gaming and Cannabis Authority of Manitoba.
Job Types: Full\-time, Permanent
Schedule:
* Monday to Friday
Work Location: In person
Application deadline: 2024\-10\-09",,"https://ca.indeed.com/cmp/Liquor,-Gaming-and-Cannabis-Authority-of-Manitoba-(lgca)",,,,,,,data analyst,2025-01-31

**Rotation Calendar:**

WHC promotes personal agency and believes that all people should be empowered to take care of their mental, emotional, sexual, physical and spiritual health and wellbeing. We offer sexual, reproductive, and mental health care and support for people of all genders. Our organizational values guide our work through an anti\-racist, anti\-oppressive, intersectional, feminist, harm reduction lens.
**Position Summary:**

The Program Coordinator is responsible for leadership of the PEDPRP which includes the coordination, resourcing and implementation of programs and activities in accordance with the Women’s Health Clinic vision, mission and values. This position involves working collaboratively with the Management team, developing and overseeing program development plans that address community needs, engagement and communication with stakeholders, and program evaluation. The position will also respond to client, community and agency needs and may require evening and weekend work.
**Requirements:**

The ideal candidate is a self\-motivated, organized and detail\-oriented individual. The successful candidate will possess excellent analytical, verbal and written communication skills and be able to work to strict deadlines while contributing to a professional working environment.
**Candidates must have:**
* Bachelor’s degree in a relevant discipline and an equivalent combination of education and work experience
* 3\-5 years of experience in program development and/or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
* 3 years of experience providing counselling related to disordered eating and body image an asset.
* Experience in group facilitation, public speaking and health education.
* Demonstrated computer proficiency.
* Demonstrated understanding of weight bias and body positive perspectives.
* Must be legally able to work in Canada
* Satisfactory Criminal Record check and Child Abuse Registry check Assets:
* Understanding of child and youth mental health system, with emphasis on supports for disordered eating an asset.
* Knowledge of barriers that impact IBPOC \& 2SLGBTQIA communities accessing health care.

* Commitment to anti\-oppression, anti\-racism work practices",,https://www.glassdoor.ca/Overview/W-EI_IE3563168.htm,https://media.glassdoor.com/sql/3563168/women-s-health-clinic-squarelogo-1644491741102.png,,,,,,program coordinator,2025-01-31

gd-1009618758903,glassdoor,https://www.glassdoor.ca/job-listing/j?jl=1009618758903,,Program Services Coordinator,Palliative Manitoba,Winnipeg,2025-01-31,,direct_data,hourly,22.0,24.0,CAD,False,,,organic,,"**Job Summary**

We are seeking a dedicated and organized Program Coordinator to join our team. The ideal candidate will play a pivotal role in overseeing program operations, ensuring effective implementation, and fostering collaboration among team members. This position requires experience in conference organization, strong leadership skills, project management capabilities, and a passion for engaging with the community.
**Job Description**
Reporting to the Executive Director, and working collaboratively with the PM Staff, the Program Services Coordinator is responsible for:
1\. Coordinating the annual Provincial Palliative Care Conference, including coordination of volunteers (1/year)
2\. Coordinating and facilitating the Lunch and Learn series (4/year)
3\. Coordinating and overseeing the Memory Tree, including coordination of volunteers (month of December)
4\. Planning the Light the Memories Event (Spring 2025\)
5\. Responding to telephone and onsite inquiries regarding end\-of\-life and bereavement services on an ongoing basis
6\. Supporting Palliative Manitoba events
**Duties**
* Lead project management efforts by planning, executing, and monitoring program activities to meet established goals.
* Collect and analyze data to assess program effectiveness and identify areas for improvement.
* Recruit participants and volunteers for programs while marketing initiatives to enhance community involvement.
* Perform administrative tasks including scheduling meetings, maintaining records, and preparing reports on program outcomes.
* Collaborate with other departments to align program objectives with organizational goals.
**Experience**
Candidates should possess a background that includes:
* Proven experience in supervising teams or leading projects.
* Strong project management skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
* Experience in data collection and analysis to inform decision\-making processes.
* Excellent public speaking abilities to effectively communicate with diverse audiences.
* Familiarity with recruiting strategies and community engagement practices.
* Administrative experience that demonstrates attention to detail and organizational skills.
We Offer:
* Group Benefits and RRSP matching
column2: (after 3 months)

Join us as we work towards making a positive impact through our programs!

Youth for Christ Winnipeg's The Edge Skatepark ministry is a vibrant and dynamic program that aims to engage and equip youth to know and follow Jesus. Located in the heart of downtown Winnipeg, our skatepark provides a safe and positive space for youth to skateboard, have fun, connect with peers and mentors, and learn about Jesus.

As a Program Coordinator, you will play a significant role in the success of this ministry. Your responsibilities will include developing and implementing engaging skateboarding programs and drop-in activities, ensuring youth are welcomed and connected with volunteers, planning events tailored to the needs of youth who love to skateboard, supervising participants at the skatepark, and recruiting and equipping volunteers as required.
Requirements

To be successful in this role, you must maintain a close relationship with God as a devoted follower of Jesus Christ, be an active participant in the life of a local church, affirm and support our organization's Community Covenant and Statement of Faith, and be committed to YFC's mission. You should also possess strong communication, organizational, and administrative skills, take initiative, pay close attention to details, and be willing to adapt.
What We Offer

• *About the Program**:

Bridging the Gap is a unique non-formal educational program that seeks to bring together Indigenous and western ways of knowing in an urban context. The program aims to foster relationality to the land and each other through culturally-relevant learning experiences that are offered with mainly elementary school classrooms and other educational/recreational partners. The program strives to bring together Indigenous land-based education and western science perspectives. Participants are given opportunities to engage in a variety of activities which may include field trips to local natural areas, in-class teachings, and implementation of schoolyard or urban gardens and outdoor programs.
• *About the Position**:
Bridging the Gap is a program of Nature Manitoba and governed and supported by a steering committee.

The program is undergoing a period of planning and transition, and the program coordinator will have the opportunity to contribute to program updates and direction. The Coordinator is a largely self-directed position responsible for:
- updating and developing programs appropriate to target communities
- facilitating programming for children and educators,
- building relationships and partnerships, including with Elders and knowledge-keepers
- building partnerships with community, knowledge holders, teachers, environmental and outdoor educators, and other organizations
- supporting program administration, including report and grant writing
The position is part-time to start (20-25 hours/week) but can become full-time if additional funding is secured.
Starting rate of pay is $23/hour.

Film Training Manitoba is looking for a Communications and Outreach Coordinator to fulfill our mandate of workforce development and training for Manitoba’s growing film industry. This position requires an experienced, knowledgeable, diplomatic professional who can work collaboratively in a fast-paced work environment.
About FTM:

FTM is a non-profit charity and member of the Province of Manitoba’s sector council program (through the Department of Economic Development and Jobs). FTM conducts workforce development and training to build a highly skilled and adaptable film industry to support the activities of Manitoba production companies. - Self-starter with the ability to work independently and in a cross-functional environment.
- Good analytical and problem-solving skills.

- Highly organized and able to work on tight deadlines.
- Must be able to work in a multi-task, fast-paced environment that may also entail potential early morning, evening, and weekend work.

- As per applicable collective agreement**Position Summary**:The Regional Acute Care Education Instructor/ Inservice Education Instructor - Emergency Room (ER), SRHC is responsible for establishing evidence-based practices for clinical education. This includes the planning, development, implementation and ongoing evaluation of Acute Care Department/ Emergency Room orientation and continuing education. The Regional Acute Care Education Instructor/ In-service Education Instructor - ER, SRHC is responsible for providing clinical expertise for employees in the Acute Care Program/ ER to ensure that clinical standards of practice are met. The position collaborates with all members of the multi-disciplinary team in the provision of patient centered care and adheres to professional standards of practice, the C.N.A. Code of Ethics and applicable laws. The Regional Acute Care Education Instructor/ In-service Education Instructor - ER, SRHC functions in a manner consistent with and supports the mission, vision, values of the Interlake-Eastern Regional Health Authority.
• *Qualifications**:
- Baccalaureate Degree in nursing required.
- Master’s Degree in nursing or related discipline preferred.
- Currently registered with the College of Registered Nurses of Manitoba and a member in good standing.
- Instructor certificates in BLS, ACLS, PALS, TNCC and ENPC
- Certification in related clinical programs would be an asset, e.g. CNA certification in Emergency Nursing.
- Certification in Adult Education would be an asset.
- Demonstrated ability to review data, research and literature: to analyze, interpret and synthesize this information.
- Demonstrated leadership ability in conducting Learning Needs Assessment, planning, delivery, implementation and evaluation of education in program.
- Minimum of four (4) years’ experience in Acute Care with a minimum of 2 years of Emergency experience - applicable to Regional Acute Care Education Instructor only.
- Minimum four (4) years’ experience in Emergency Room nursing - applicable to In-service Education Instructor - ER, SRHC only.
- Two (2) years’ experience in clinical education with demonstrated competency in needs assessment, developing, implementing and evaluating education programs and managing projects.
- Experience in Quality Improvement an asset.
- Completes and maintains a satisfactory pre-employment security check.
- Satisfactory employment record.

• *As a condition of employment, all successful applicants will be required to provide a satisfactory criminal record check (with vulnerable sector screening), adult abuse and child abuse registry checks prior to commencing employment.**

Given the cultural diversity of our region, the ability to communicate in more than one language would be considered an asset. Proficiency of both official languages is essential for target and designated bilingual positions.
All health care workers are required to be immunized as a condition of employment in accordance with the Interlake-Eastern RHA Policy (GA-13-P-110 Required Immunizations for Health Care Workers).

The Interlake-Eastern Regional Health Authority delivers health-care services on First Nation Treaty Territories 1, 2, 3 and 5 and on the homeland of the Métis Nation. We respect that First Nations treaties were made on these territories, acknowledge harms and mistakes, and we dedicate ourselves to collaborate in partnership with First Nations, Inuit and Métis peoples in the spirit of reconciliation.",,,,,,,,,program coordinator,2025-01-31

in-0a86ab312a49baed,indeed,https://ca.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=0a86ab312a49baed,http://ca.indeed.com/job/program-services-coordinator-0a86ab312a49baed,Program Services Coordinator,Palliative Manitoba,"Winnipeg, MB, CA",2025-01-30,temporary,,,,,,False,,,,,"**Job Summary**

We are seeking a dedicated and organized Program Coordinator to join our team. The ideal candidate will play a pivotal role in overseeing program operations, ensuring effective implementation, and fostering collaboration among team members. This position requires experience in conference organization, strong leadership skills, project management capabilities, and a passion for engaging with the community.
**Job Description**
Reporting to the Executive Director, and working collaboratively with the PM Staff, the Program Services Coordinator is responsible for:
1\. Coordinating the annual Provincial Palliative Care Conference, including coordination of volunteers (1/year)
2\. Coordinating and facilitating the Lunch and Learn series (4/year)
3\. Coordinating and overseeing the Memory Tree, including coordination of volunteers (month of December)
4\. Planning the Light the Memories Event (Spring 2025\)
5\. Responding to telephone and onsite inquiries regarding end\-of\-life and bereavement services on an ongoing basis
6\. Supporting Palliative Manitoba events
**Duties**
* Lead project management efforts by planning, executing, and monitoring program activities to meet established goals.
* Collect and analyze data to assess program effectiveness and identify areas for improvement.
* Recruit participants and volunteers for programs while marketing initiatives to enhance community involvement.
* Perform administrative tasks including scheduling meetings, maintaining records, and preparing reports on program outcomes.
* Collaborate with other departments to align program objectives with organizational goals.
**Experience**
Candidates should possess a background that includes:
* Proven experience in supervising teams or leading projects.
* Strong project management skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
* Experience in data collection and analysis to inform decision\-making processes.
* Excellent public speaking abilities to effectively communicate with diverse audiences.
* Familiarity with recruiting strategies and community engagement practices.
* Administrative experience that demonstrates attention to detail and organizational skills.
We Offer:
* Group Benefits and RRSP matching

gd-1009618887154,glassdoor,https://www.glassdoor.ca/job-listing/j?jl=1009618887154,,"Project Manager, Client Services (PM5)",ALS Global,Winnipeg,2025-01-31,,direct_data,yearly,34632.0,39900.0,CAD,False,,,organic,,"Imagine your future with us!
At ALS, we encourage you to dream big.
When you join ALS, you join a purpose and values\-driven team that empowers you to innovate, create, and thrive.

Our global team turns up each day with passion and commitment to do amazing things, always challenging our thinking to find ways to solve some of the world’s most complex problems for a safer, healthier world.
About the role
On\-site \| Full\-time/Seasonal
**Key Responsibilities:**
* Coordinate large sized client accounts and profiles as designated by the Client Services Manager.
* Liaise with senior client personnel to maintain good regional service, to elicit feedback and to support Sales and Marketing.
* Meet with client project managers or other personnel as necessary to maintain positive customer relationships. Some travel may be required.
* Address coverage requirements/responsibilities within the team or with the Client Service Manager as required.
* Support Sales and Marketing with preparation of RFPs and large quotes for clients within the Account Manager’s portfolio as necessary.
* Be able to offer support on technical and client related matter to more junior CS staff.
* Provide service advice to clients (i.e., analytical requirements, turnaround and holding times, etc.) to assist them in meeting project or regulatory objectives.
* Ensure that client communications are returned promptly, as specified in customer service manual guidelines, or as determined by local management.
* Maintain communication between all client service personnel, both internally and externally, for projects affecting multiple clients.
* Keep regional client service and location managers apprised of developments with regional clients.
* Review client chain of custody forms in timely fashion, ensuring that all necessary information is available to enable smooth generation of invoices.
* Review, approve, and transmit data reports and invoices, including any custom client specific uploads and/or transmissions (EDDs, invoices, Watertrax, etc…)
* Write SOP’s for the Client Services Department
* Ensure any client special reporting requirements are carried out.
* Maintain communication with other client service personnel responsible for invoice uploading.
* Maintain and update client information (contacts, addresses, etc.)
* Initiate and issue Client Complaints (CC), Corrective Action Reports (CAR) and Rechecks.
* Track client projects in the ALS LIMS and provide status to clients when requested.
* Ensure timely completion and transmission of final and draft client reports.
* Prepare cost quotations or proposals.
* Prepare cost quotations or proposals with guidance from the Sales Manager, Business Manager and/or Client Services Manager.
* Provide direction, information and specifics on client samples and projects to appropriate laboratory, sample management, sales, and office services staff.
* Maintain communication with laboratory staff on general lab turnaround times and relay appropriate information to clients.
* Promote communication with staff on any special client requests.

* Use correct methods in accordance with the established procedures and schedules while ensuring analytical quality.
* Observe established safety regulations and comply with all ALS health and safety policies and procedures.
* Other duties as assigned.
**About you:**
* Excellent customer service skills
* Positive and energetic outlook
* Demonstrated time management skills
* Proven ability to work under pressure

* Organized, detailed oriented and able to work independently

Working at ALS

Our people are our most valuable asset and drive our success at ALS. We are a diverse community of dedicated professionals united by our passion to make a difference in the world. We reward excellence and uphold our values in our work and how we treat each other. At ALS, you’ll be supported to expand your skills and develop new ones so you can reach your full potential. We invest in our people with a range of programs and provide opportunities across the company, giving our people scope to grow diverse careers and develop as leaders. We want everyone to have a safe, flexible and rewarding career that makes a positive impact on our people, the planet and the communities where we work.
**Our benefits includes:**
* Additional shift premiums of $2 per hour for evening shifts and $4 per hour for night shifts, if applicable.

* Comprehensive benefit package specific to your work status (including extended medical, dental, and vision coverage, access to company perks, life and disability insurance, retirement plan with company match, employee assistance and wellness programs).
* Additional vacation days for years of service.

* Learning \& development opportunities (unlimited access to e\-learnings and more).
**Please note:** benefits vary based on employee status.
About ALS

ALS is a global leader in scientific testing, providing comprehensive testing solutions to clients in more than 60 countries across a wide range of industries, including environment, food and beverage, mining, personal care, pharmaceutical, healthcare and equipment reliability. Using state\-of\-the\-art technologies and innovative methodologies, our dedicated international teams deliver the highest\-quality testing services and personalised solutions supported by local expertise. We help our clients leverage the power of data\-driven insights for a safer and healthier world.
Everyone matters

Qualified candidates will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, military or veteran status, gender, age, disabilities, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy and pregnancy\-related conditions, genetic information and any other characteristics protected by the law. We invite resumes from all interested parties, including women, First Nations Metis and Inuit persons, members of minority groups, and persons living with disabilities.

ALS also welcomes applications from people with all levels of ability. gd-1009618750448,glassdoor,https://www.glassdoor.ca/job-listing/j?jl=1009618750448,,Environmental Project Manager,F. H. Black & Company CPA Inc.,Winnipeg,2025-01-31,,direct_data,yearly,67750.0,113250.0,CAD,False,,,organic,kmokosinski@fhblack.com,"**Environmental Project Manager**

We have partnered with a local Winnipeg based business that provides emergency restoration services to residential and commercial buildings to find a new Project Manager to add to their growing Environmental Services team!

As a Project Manager, you’ll be responsible for leading the claims service process from start to finish including reception of the claim, reviewing damaged property, estimating repairs and overseeing the entirety of the project restoration. Critical communication and timely responses are a high priority for this position when interacting with vendors, brokers, clients and all personnel.

If you are an experienced Project Manager or IAQ Consultant that has worked with property reconstruction, asbestos and mouuld removal and water damage, we invite you to consider this rewarding opportunity!
**Responsibilities**
· Prospect and acquire new business by marketing to new clientele and servicing existing contracts
· Monitor public tenders for bid opportunities and provide competitive RFP submissions
· Accept claims and respond with urgency to contract requirements as necessary
· Contact clients to acknowledge claim acceptance and arrange meetings to assess properties
· Strong understanding of the claim file process and project cycle times

· Create detailed restoration plans and estimates for client approval of in\-scope area(s), through assessing damages, accurately measuring and sketching areas, taking photos, and ensuring information is gathered where needs are required
· Provide detailed and professional reports to clients, including scope of work, technical reporting and proposals
· Lead and oversee all active projects by providing direction and setting quality of work standards with abatement technicians to ensure timelines and client expectations are met
· Oversee site and ensuring safety standards are met by all employees, sub trades and clients
· Attend bimonthly management meetings to forecast claims closing and review AR
· Ensure accuracy of closing and overall margins are reached
· Understand all contract clients’ compliance and protocols, ensuring all SLAs (Service Level Agreements) are met
· Build new and maintain existing relationships with the industry personnel
· Encourage departmental growth through development of new services in occupational hygiene and hazardous material risk assessments
· Plays a lead role on site for safety, and adherence to National COR Safety Standards which include but are not limited to PPE and or safety reposting and documentation.
**Required Skills and Experience**
· 2\-3 years previous experience in a Project Manager or Occupational Hygiene related role
· Post\-secondary education in construction or anoother related field would be an asset
· Possessing a C.E.T designation would be considered an asset
· Knowledge of the restoration industry including tools, policies, safety procedures and materials
· Excellent attention to detail
· Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, etc.)
· Proven problem\-solving abilities, with ability to practice sound judgement
· Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to communicate clearly and professionally with external clients and insurance providers
· Exceptional interpersonal skills
· Ability to adapt to and manage a constantly changing, dynamic workflow with proficiency and calm
· Valid Class 5 Drivers License
· Ability to travel and attend the construction sites on an as needed basis
· Exceptional organization skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks and deadlines with confidence
· Ability to work independently and be a strong team player.
**Benefits and Compensation**
· Competitive starting salary with ongoing salary review
· Opportunities for professional growth
· Company vehicle and cell phone provided
· Corporate and social events
· Comprehensive benefits package.
**How to Apply**
If you are interested in this exciting opportunity, please email a copy of your resume to **kmokosinski@fhblack.com**.
We thank all applicants in advance, however, only those individuals who best meet our qualifications will be contacted. All other resumes will be kept on file for future consideration.
Job Type: Full\-time
Benefits:

* Extended health care
* On\-site parking

gd-1009618866391,glassdoor,https://www.glassdoor.ca/job-listing/j?jl=1009618866391,,Senior Project Manager,Eskimo Point Lumber Supply,Winnipeg,2025-01-31,,direct_data,yearly,130000.0,140000.0,CAD,False,,,organic,,"**Job Description**

EPLS Projects is a fast\-growing division of EPLS Maintenance \& Services Ltd. that provides project facilitation and management services to northern communities in Nunavut. We are seeking a team oriented, solutions driven, Senior Project Manager to help move our division forward.

Reporting to the Manager of EPLS Projects, the Senior Project Manager provides project planning for the technical and engineering aspects pertaining to internal and external EPLS business contracts and related process initiatives. The Senior Project Manager will assist the Manager of EPLS Projects, with the daily management of the division, as well as mentor other Project Management Staff on internal and field processes. They will be responsible for providing, possessing and obtaining technical and field knowledge related to projects and ensuring applicable industry compliance, resulting in the success of EPLS projects as necessary.

The intent of this position is to facilitate a thorough planning process between Senior Management, Stakeholders and Project Management, such that project information for high\-level planned projects is defined, vetted and planned prior to the execution phase. This includes meeting with senior management and stakeholders to gather information on available land and intended use, verification of zoning and rezoning (if required), project budgets, design intent and timelines. Working with approval gates, the Senior Project Manager will progress the proposed project from concept through to actualization so that it can be transitioned over to the Project Manager to take ownership through to completion.

The Senior Project Manager will also be responsible for engineering and technical aspects of assigned EPLS business initiatives, processes and assignments as required by work load. This includes but not limited to: new and existing EPLS business contracts, liaison with key stakeholders to provide a technical presence, assisting with the creating and implementation of SOP’s, Lean initiatives, Policy Development, Work Instructions, Physical Processes and technical/ engineering documentation and retention.
**Duties \& Responsibilities**
* Assist with the daily management of the Projects team
* Use the gate approvals method for information gathering and consultation with internal and external stakeholders and design team members to realize design intent with proposed budget
* Lead the creation of proposals and budgets that outline the scope, goals and resources needed to complete a proposed project

* Conduct high level project planning, risk assessment, budget creation, define resources required, contractor pre\-selection, quality requirements, stakeholder management and project standardized documentation i.e., ITP, Field Reports, Change Orders, etc.
* Facilitate project hand\-off meetings with Project Managers, Consultants, Operations staff and other stakeholders once the project plan and budget receive final approval
* Collaborate with company departments to ensure procedures and costs are realized for the project’s development
* Continuously research construction methods and materials that will make designs and projects more efficient
* Negotiate and create contracts with suppliers, contractors and other project related sources as required
* Create and maintain project estimating template(s) to standardize project budgets
* Troubleshoot design and manufacturing problems related to project design and implementation when necessary
* Provide support for EPLS business initiatives to support quotation of new contracts
* Assist/participate in procurement of new capital equipment if requested
* Responsible for staying abreast of latest industry developments
* Assist in making recommendations for acquisition of new technology (equipment, software) that will improve the efficiency, reduce costs, for EPLS processes
* Assist Project Managers and Project Coordinators with their assigned projects as required
* Responsible to manage assigned projects during peak periods, if required
* Other duties as assigned
* **Qualifications**
* Minimum 8\-10 years demonstrated experience in construction/engineering field
* Certification in Project Management is required
* Experience in on\-site construction management and trouble shooting is required
* Experience with implementation of project management principles and methodologies
* Experience in design and construction project management, cost management, estimating, planning, scheduling and progress measurement is an asset
* Team focused, with a commitment to moving a growing division forward
* Customer service focused, with a commitment to quality, safety, and productivity
* Ability to read and interpret engineering drawings \& requirements
* Experience in developing and maintaining supplier / contractor relationships
* A methodical approach to problem\-solving and an outstanding attention to detail
* Strong planning, organizational and analytical skills
* Highly proficient in Microsoft Office and advanced software platforms
* Must be able to work in a team and independent work environment
* Ability to travel on short notice and extended duration is required
Job Type: Full\-time
Benefits:
* Dental care
* Disability insurance
* Extended health care
* Life insurance
* RRSP match
* Vision care
Schedule:
* Monday to Friday
Application question(s):
* How many years of experience in construction/ engineering do you have?
* Do you have a Certification in Project Management?
Work Location: In person",,https://www.glassdoor.ca/Overview/W-EI_IE4190161.htm,,,,,,,project manager,2025-01-31

Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) helps the Government of Canada serve Canadians. With a strong focus on quality customer service, we provide innovative common services such as real estate and building management, purchasing, banking, pay and pensions, and translation to other government departments, agencies, and boards. This common hybrid work model will consist of work on site at least 3 days each week, though some positions may require 100% in-person presence. - Experience in providing advice to clients.
- Experience in managing multidisciplinary teams in the delivery of real property projects.
- Experience in managing procurement process related to project delivery such as Design Bid Build (DBB), Design Build (DB), Construction Management (CM).

• Recent experience is defined as having managed real property projects for a minimum of five years within the last 10 years including at least three years of Canadian experience. The number of years of experience does not need to be consecutive but should cumulatively total five years or more.

- Knowledge of project management practices.
- Knowledge of technical engineering practices and codes.

- Knowledge of contract and procurement management.
Competencies
- Values and Ethics – demonstrating integrity and respect.
- Thinking things through – innovation through analysis and ideas.
- Engagement – working effectively with people, organizations, and partners.
- Excellence through results – delivering through own work, relationships, and responsibilities
- Client Service Level 1",,,,,,,,,project manager,2025-01-31

• *Key Responsibilities**
