* 3 years of experience providing counselling related to disordered eating and body image an asset.
* Experience in group facilitation, public speaking and health education.
* Demonstrated computer proficiency.
* Demonstrated understanding of weight bias and body positive perspectives.
* Must be legally able to work in Canada
* Satisfactory Criminal Record check and Child Abuse Registry check Assets:
* Understanding of child and youth mental health system, with emphasis on supports for disordered eating an asset.
* Knowledge of barriers that impact IBPOC \& 2SLGBTQIA communities accessing health care.

gd-1009620353541,glassdoor,https://www.glassdoor.ca/job-listing/j?jl=1009620353541,,Project Manager,Penn-co Construction,Winnipeg,2025-02-01,,direct_data,yearly,52000.0,75000.0,CAD,False,,,organic,,"Penn\-co is founded on the principles of inspiring and empowering communities to build a brighter future. We strive to collaborate with community leaders to achieve their goals, advocate for their needs, and provide them with the tools and resources necessary to drive positive change.

Are you looking for an exciting and challenging career path? Are you passionate about construction and building on your future? We are committed to providing opportunities for development for our employees in our growing organization.
**Project Manager**

Penn\-co Construction is a leading construction company currently hiring a Project Manager to join our team working at our Winnipeg office. As the Project Manager, you will be responsible for planning, organizing, executing and delivering corporate projects on time, within budget and in accordance with specifications. Penn\-co offers an excellent benefits package and competitive salary. If you are looking to join a leader in the construction industry and bring projects to life, then this may be the perfect fit for you.
Responsibilities
· Direct and oversee construction projects from start to finish while monitoring compliance with building and safety regulations.
· Communicate and maintain reputable relationships with owners, architects, consultants, subcontractors and the public.
· Lead and facilitate project meetings with internal and external stakeholders.
· Establish project reporting procedures and develop and monitor the project schedule and budget.
· Understand and enforce contractual responsibilities, contract documents and resolving disputes.
· Manage all change orders, including negotiating, processing and assessing cost and schedule impacts, and preparation of claims.
· Prepare and monitor progress billings to owner and from subcontractors.
· Review productivity planning, providing performance status reports regarding cost forecasts, and schedule.
· Provide a professional management style that reflects the Penn\-co image when communicating with all stakeholders.
· Build and foster a collaborative team environment with Project Coordinators and Superintendents
· Supervise, mentor, coach, train and motivate project team.
· Manage all aspects of project(s) close\-out.
· Other duties as assigned.
Qualifications
· 5\+ years of Commercial construction experience preferred on building projects of $5 million or greater.
· A diploma or degree in Project/Construction Management, a related field of study or past work experience operating at a similar level or role.
· Demonstrated leadership, communication and strong interpersonal skills is required.
· Read, interpret, and understand building blueprints, specifications, contract documents, etc.
· Ability to manage multiple projects and responsibilities and prioritize the workload appropriately.
· Strong computer skills, proficient in using Microsoft Office programs, as well as the ability and willingness to learn new software.
· Self\-motivated, ambitious and passionate about construction.
· Ability to problem solve with a can\-do attitude and a mindset of continuous improvement.
· Knowledge of construction methods, codes, and best practices in the construction environment
· Ability to work flexible hours.
· Travel is occasionally required.

Penn\-co has been in business for 65 years! Check out website www.penn\-co.com to see some of the exciting projects that we have completed and are currently working on! Empowering today for a better tomorrow.
Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
Job Type: Full\-time
Benefits:
* Dental care
* Employee assistance program
* Life insurance
* Vision care
Schedule:
* Monday to Friday
* Overtime

Work Location: In person",,https://www.glassdoor.ca/Overview/W-EI_IE4427170.htm,https://media.glassdoor.com/sql/4427170/penn-co-construction-squarelogo-1622118023787.png,,,,,,project manager,2025-02-01

Shared Health leads the planning and coordinates the integration of patient- centered clinical and preventive health services across Manitoba. The organization also delivers some province-wide health services and supports centralized administrative and business functions for Manitoba health organizations.
Position Overview

Under the direction of the Executive Leader/Director or designate, the Senior Project Manager is responsible for managing all aspects of the assigned project(s) including vendor evaluation/selection, project initiation and planning.

The Senior Project Manager applies established project management principles, tools, and templates including the executing, controlling and closing phases. Provides leadership to ensure the overall completion of project deliverables are achieved including managing project scope, resources, communications, risks/issues, budget, timelines, procurement, integration, quality and implementation. The Senior Project Manager promotes and maintains a positive, professional, and team-oriented environment demonstrating a commitment to the vision, values, goals, and objectives of the organization. Projects will span a variety of areas, often with provincial scope and focus.
Experience
- Minimum seven years’ experience in planning and implementing complex projects including:
- Leading large complex project teams through planning and implementing large scale projects with multiple, diverse internal and external stakeholders including applying change management strategies.
- Demonstrated excellent facilitation and negotiation skills.
- Experience in program development, introducing new systems and change management.
- Previous experience in a health services environment.
- Proven track record of producing results within quality, scope, time and budget constraints.

- Expertise with practical application of project planning concepts such as JDS, PERT, JDD, project estimating tools and techniques, formal project management principles, practices and techniques, and specialized enterprise project management tools such as MS Project or Workbench.
- Demonstrated expertise in one or more established project lifecycle methodologies such as BATES, PMBOK, PRINCE2 and others.
- Expertise with Enterprise Project Management tools would be an asset.
Education (Degree/Diploma/Certificate)
- Post-secondary degree in a relevant discipline from an accredited educational institution
column2: an equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered.

column1: - Formal education and training in project management is required
column2: certification in project management is an asset.

column1: Certification/Licensure/Registration
- Active member in good standing of an associated regulatory body as appropriate.
Qualifications and Skills
- Demonstrates senior leadership skills as described in the LEADS in a Caring Environment framework.
- Demonstrated proficiency with the use of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and Visio.
- Knowledge of applicable legislation, policies, procedures, protocols and guidelines.
- Demonstrated knowledge of roles and responsibilities of project team members and change management strategies.
Physical Requirements
- May be required to work extended hours.
- Periodic travel throughout Manitoba may be required.
- Must have valid driver’s license and access to a reliable vehicle.

We have a unique ability to work together to make health care better. If you want to make a difference and contribute to supporting the health of your family, friends and neighbours, please apply today.
Interested candidates should select the ""Apply"" icon below to upload their cover letter, resume and copy of licenses/certification.

This position requires a current satisfactory Criminal Records Check (including Vulnerable Sector Search), Child Abuse Registry Check and Adult Abuse Registry Check as conditions of employment. The successful candidate will be responsible for any service charges incurred. A security check is considered current if it was obtained no more than six (6) months prior to the start of employment.
Please note that an employee is not permitted to hold two or more positions in Shared Health that combine to equal more than 1.0 FTE.

Shared Health values and supports employment equity and workplace diversity and encourages all qualified individuals to apply. We thank all applicants but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
We welcome applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request during the assessment and selection process.",,,,,,,,,project manager,2025-02-01

go-LYTkcFEqzGeQF5V5AAAAAA==,google,https://ca.linkedin.com/jobs/view/superintendent-building-construction-at-ledcor-4140137090?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,"Superintendent, Building Construction",Ledcor,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-26,contract,,,,,,False,,,,,"Description

You are a seasoned Superintendent with over 8 years of field operations experience working in multi-disciplinary large-scale, commercial projects. You will lead a team of superintendents for a complex ICI project, ensuring adherence to company standards for safety, scheduling, budget, quality control, and client satisfaction. You will leverage your industry expertise to achieve project goals while contributing to the organization’s long-term success.
Watch Ledcor’s Innovation, Culture, and Community video to see what it's like working for Ledcor and apply today to join our Building’s Construction team in Brandon, Manitoba!
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fpn_YHIhP8U&t=1s
Essential Responsibilities
• Oversee staff to ensure the successful delivery of a single complex commercial construction project to completion

• Ensures that field staff are equipped with the resources required to efficiently complete projects according to approved plans, specifications and applicable building codes while ensuring that safety regulations are strictly followed
• Actively participates in the pre-bid and preconstruction process regarding site layout, logistics, scheduling, and workforce planning
• Works collaboratively with safety personnel to ensure adherence to Ledcor’s Corporate safety programs and policies
• Ensures all projects follow Ledcor’s Construction Operations Manual and lead the development of the Project Quality Program (PQP), ensuring PEP conformance
• Review and maintain schedule, ensure milestones are met, identify scheduling issues and delays and lead solution development
• Promotes the overall site safety program including subcontractor compliance with Ledcor standards, the Project Specific Safety Plan (PSSP), and all applicable OH&S acts, regulations, and codes
• Oversees the care and maintenance of internal and rental equipment on projects to maximize use while on the job sites and returns equipment to storage or the rental company when no longer required
• Participates in the hiring and managing of hourly employees as required, and maintains, approves, and submits hourly timecards with all necessary details for job costing purposes
• Maintains strong relationships with subcontractors, suppliers, and clients/consultants to ensure client needs are met and ensure future business opportunities
• Supports and promotes Ledcor’s core values of safety, quality, integrity, sustainability and success
Qualifications

• 8+ years of construction experience in a Superintendent position or similar with demonstrated ability to successfully lead a high-performing team and build solid long-term relationships with external clients and consultants
• Experience managing construction projects within high rise residential, healthcare, data centers, aircraft hangars, aviation warehousing facilities, and other complex projects
• Combination of work experience in a similar role and industry related trade certification/education
• Expertise in safety within the organization and knowledge of OH&S and Environmental standards and regulations
• Excellent communication, interpersonal and presentation skills, and the ability to work with senior management
• Strong technical knowledge of modern construction practices, documents, drawings, schedules, technologies, equipment, industry practices and contract negotiations
• Expertise in coaching and developing team members through constructive feedback and providing opportunities for development
• Ability to anticipate problems and challenges, while providing leadership in creating innovative solutions to achieve organizational objectives
• Must have and maintain a valid drivers license
Working Conditions:
• Site based position in Brandon, Manitoba
Additional Information

Ledcor Building offers full-service construction for commercial, residential, institutional, and light industrial projects, along with expertise in green building. Our depth of knowledge and expertise come from building hundreds of projects – of all sizes – across North America each year.
Our workplace culture has been recognized as one of Canada’s Best Diversity Employers, Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Cultures, and a Top 100 Inspiring Workplace in North America.

Our competitive total rewards package provides compensation and benefits that support your physical, mental and financial wellbeing. We offer exciting, challenging work with opportunities to develop your skills and knowledge.
Employment Equity

At Ledcor we believe diversity, equity, and inclusion should be part of everything we do. We are proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified individuals, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, Veteran status or any other identifying characteristic are encouraged to apply.

Our True Blue team consists of individuals from all backgrounds who contribute diverse perspectives and experiences to Ledcor. We are committed to continuing to build on our culture of empowerment, inclusion and belonging.

Adjustments will be provided in all parts of our hiring process. Applicants need to make their needs known in advance by submitting a request via email. For more information about Ledcor’s Inclusion and Diversity initiatives, please visit our I&D page.
1340 Chevrier Blvd., Winnipeg, MB",,,,,,,,,project manager,2025-02-01

go-1PkucNkwh5st7dRBAAAAAA==,google,https://ca.trabajo.org/job-2891-a17d7d6f12bcdee90f001d5bd699210f?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,Superintendent-special-projects,Cobra Enterprises Ltd.,"Beausejour, MB, Canada",2025-01-19,contract,,,,,,True,,,,,"**Responsibilities**:
Become a part of the Cobra Family:
Reports to: Senior Construction PM (Project Manager)
Job type: Permanent full-time
Travel Requirements: Yes - First Nations Communities Manitoba & Ontario, Mining and Agricultural sites across Canada. If there are slow periods work will be in Beausejour helping as a lead hand
Normal shifts:

14 days on and 7 days off, up North - First Nation Communities in Manitoba and Ontario as well as Mining and Agricultural Projects across Canada, 10 to 12 - hour shifts, overtime after 10 hours per day or 40 / hrs per week whichever is greater.
Project size & Expectation:

The role will vary depending on the size of the project. Larger scale projects will have as many as 5 carpenters on the job and requirements to be on the tools will be limited, acting as a full superintendent. Projects on a smaller scale could have as few as 1 employee and on these jobs the role will be expected to complete any work on tools required to finish the job.
Perks available:
Phone, Company Truck, $50-60 per day living allowance, Paid Accommodations, overtime
Overview of Position:

Superintendent, Special Projects oversees the construction process and are responsible for the overall construction activities within the established design, budget, and scheduling guidelines. This can include planning and scheduling, organizing, directing, and controlling activities on the construction site.

The Superintendent will spend most of their time on the construction site and safety is a top priority. While on the construction site, the Superintendent must be aware of and comply with all relevant safety policies and procedures.
The Superintendent will attend job sites on First Nation Communities in Manitoba and Ontario as well as Mining and Agricultural Projects across Canada, shifts are typically 14 days on and 7 days off.
Key Responsibilities:
- Work with the pre-construction team on-site at Cobras new Beausejour head office to create pre-construction budgeting and planning.
- Once project is started, complete on-site supervision and coordination of Cobra in-house trades and sub-contractors.
- With a collaborative style, coordinate and supervise all construction activities on site.
- Ensure project is constructed according to drawings, specifications, project schedule, and budget.
- Partner with management team, including the Project Manager and subcontractors to maintain construction schedule and identify/resolve problems as necessary and in a timely manner.
- Establish and maintain positive relationships with internal and external stakeholders, including community develop recovery strategies when project schedule or budgets are in jeopardy.
- Review and update schedule, cost forecast and cash flow with Project Manager.
- Maintain appropriate field documentation including safety, progress reports, rental records, logs etc.
- Be a leader in safety by providing leadership to peers ensuring all site staff are always adhering to the company safety culture, following appropriate policies and procedures.
- Conduct daily tailgate meetings
- Organize weekly subcontractor meetings.
- Supervise, mentor, coach, and train project personnel.
- Model the Company Values.
Preferred Qualifications:
- Extensive practicing knowledge of construction safety, regulations, legislation, and policy.
- Technical diploma or equivalent combination of technical training and experience.
- At least 5+ years previous experience working on commercial and residential building sites. Pre Eng. Building experience considered an asset.
- Supervisory and construction experience in commercial renovation projects up to $10M.
- Thorough knowledge of all aspects of construction such as
column2: technology, equipment, methods, trade agreements and jurisdiction, engineering, cost control, drawings, specifications, procedures, scheduling, and safety requirements.

column1: - Basic knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, MS projects, share point, MS Dynamics is an asset.
Other Qualifications:
- Proven creative problem-solving skills.
- Excellent communication skills, including the ability to successfully translate technical information to non-technical individuals.
- Excellent relationship building skills, with strong focus on client relationship, and a proven track record of integrity when dealing with Clients, Trades and Consultants.
- Experience working with First Nations Communities, Mining, and Agriculture projects will be considered an asset.
Work conditions:

Travel is required, ability to lift 50+ lbs, required safety equipment, hazards associated with the trade, work both indoors and outdoors, construction sites, noise, irregular hours & overtime, shifts 14 days on and 7 days off, 10 to 12-hour shifts, heights, no ability to work remotely.
• *Job Types**: Full-time, Permanent
Additional pay:
- Bonus pay
- Overtime pay
• *Benefits**:
- Casual dress
- Dental care
- Disability insurance
- Employee assistance program
- Extended health",,,,,,,,,project manager,2025-02-01

go-tvCf258DbhWgOS6KAAAAAA==,google,https://ca.trabajo.org/job-2891-4cda9991cc99c1d1c63051fe08ebac46?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,Commercial Project Manager,First Onsite,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-18,,,,,,,False,,,,,"First Onsite is seeking to hire a full-time Commercial Project Manager to scope and estimate the work required to restore properties to their pre-disaster state. This position ensures that property owners have an outstanding customer experience and are informed and satisfied throughout the process.
A DAY IN THE LIFE OF A COMMERCIAL PROJECT MANAGER

As a Commercial Project Manager, you play a key role in ensuring that commercial projects are completed on time to our quality standards. To the property owner, adjuster, and insurance company, you are the face of our company. You establish trust as you consult with clients about projects, answering their questions and following up with them to ensure complete satisfaction. You prepare accurate quotations, job costing, and estimating.

Throughout each project you manage, you inspect progress and work quality to ensure that emergency and rebuild timelines are met and limit business interruption to our clients. You manage all sorts of restoration claims including water damage, fire damage to both residential and commercial properties. As necessary, you resolve disputes and complaints cheerfully and in a professional manner. The strong relationships you build with home/business owners, adjusters, property managers, and other key players assist you in generating new leads. Your knowledge of the restoration/construction industry, your skills as an estimator, and your knack for sales help you excel in this project management position.
QUALIFICATIONS
- Restoration/renovation industry experience
- Knowledge of commercial building construction and codes
- Experience planning and monitoring budgets
- Experience with Xactimate (Strong Asset)
- Valid driver's license
- Clean criminal record
- Ability to participate in a 24/7 on-call rotation

Do you have excellent written and verbal communication skills? Are you a people person with strong interpersonal skills? Do you take accountability for your own decisions? Can you stay organized and manage your time efficiently? Do you enjoy seeing the results of a successful restoration/renovation project? If so, you may be perfect for this project management position
If you love traveling for work and working on complex projects this job may be the perfect fit.
We look forward to meeting you
• *Benefits**:
- Company car
- Dental care
- Disability insurance
- Employee assistance program
- Extended health care
- Life insurance
- Paid time off
- RRSP match
- Vision care
Flexible Language Requirement:
- French not required
Work Location: One location",,,,,,,,,project manager,2025-02-01

Reporting to the Manager, Employee Well-being, the Program Manager, Employee Mental Well-being will be part of a multidisciplinary team focused on supporting the development and management of Canada Life’s employee well-being program, with the goal of keeping employees mentally well, engaged and at work. - Actively look for opportunities to improve process efficiency and effectiveness
- In partnership with corporate health & safety, ensure alignment to the National Standard of Canada for Psychological Health and Safety in the Workplace

• *What you will bring**
- Experience:
- 6+ years in mental health field, preferably in a corporate environment with industry knowledge
- Program planning, development and evaluation
- Consultation and program facilitation
- Applied knowledge of mental health promotion, illness prevention and intervention
- Baccalaureate degree in a relevant health or social sciences field

- Experience in project management and leading project teams
• *Preferred but not required**:

Given the size and scope of our organization, we have the flexibility for this position to be located in the following head office locations: Montreal, Toronto, London, Winnipeg._**

go-928AMbVWlYHxsE41AAAAAA==,google,https://ca.trabajo.org/job-2891-c3f2091e537f0f38badffdf9e47941b2?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,ERP Project Manager,Online Business Systems,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-17,contract,,,,,,False,,,,,"We have an exciting opportunity for a Senior Project Manager specializing in ERP implementations to join our consulting team. As someone who knows how to inspire a shared vision, you will be responsible for planning, managing, monitoring, and controlling projects according to the PMBOK framework. You understand the importance of building strong teams and will mentor and coach your project teams within the context of Agile and waterfall methodologies. You are driven to do what is needed to ensure that the client sees successful project outcomes.

Working in complex client environments, you successfully navigate cultures and organizations at both the senior and operational level, ensuring alignments and driving focus towards the desired outcomes. You actively manage client expectations and are able to build and sustain key relationships that will ensure project success beyond scope, budget, and timelines, driving sustained value for the client organization.
• *Critical Competencies for Success**:Project Leadership, Team Management, Communication, Coaching, Connects Big Picture to Detail.
• *Strategy & Planning**:
- Define project scope, goals, and deliverables that support business goals in collaboration with client sponsors, teams, and stakeholders.
- Effectively communicate project expectations to team members and stakeholders in a timely and clear fashion.
- Liaise with project stakeholders on an ongoing basis through formal and informal channels.
- Set and continually manage project expectations with team members and other stakeholders, ensuring adherence to the project baseline.
- Plan and schedule project timelines and milestones using appropriate tools.
- Track project milestones and deliverables, ensuring corrective action is taken when necessary, to improve project performance.
- Determine the frequency and content of status reports from the project team, analyze results, and troubleshoot problem areas.
- Define project success criteria and disseminate them to involved parties throughout project life cycle.
- Conduct project postmortems and create a recommendations report in order to identify successful and unsuccessful project elements.
- Adapt best practices and tools for project execution and management based on unique client situations and contexts.
• *Acquisition & Deployment**:
- Estimate the resources and participants needed to achieve project goals.
- Draft and submit budget proposals and recommend subsequent budget changes where necessary.
- Where required, negotiate with other department managers for the acquisition of required personnel from within the company.
- Determine and assess need for additional staff and/or consultants and make the appropriate recruitments, if necessary, during project cycle.
• *Operational Management**:
- Direct and manage project development from beginning to end including the development of relevant artifacts.
- Develop full-scale project plans and associated communications documents.
- Delegate tasks and responsibilities when appropriate.
- Identify and resolve issues and conflicts within the project team.
- Identify and manage project dependencies and critical path.
- Develop and deliver progress reports, proposals, requirements documentation, and presentations.
- Proactively manage changes in project scope, identify potential crises, and devise contingency plans.
- Coach, mentor, motivate, and supervise project team members and contractors and influence them to take positive action and accountability for their assigned work.
- Build, develop, and grow any business relationships vital to the success of the project.
• *What we’d like**:

- Minimum 10 years’ project management experience, with a majority of that experience implementing full-cycle ERP solutions as a project manager with teams of 10 - 20 members and multi-million dollar budgets.
- Bachelor’s degree in business, computer science, or engineering is required. A Master of Business Administration would be considered an asset.
- Project Management Professional (PMP) designation and/or Prince2 Practitioner certification are required. Scrum Master certification is a desirable asset.
• *Why Work with Us?**
We offer a competitive compensation and benefits package as well as:
- Professional Development budget and time
- Tech-enablement program for home use
- Career Mentor to help you grow in your career
- RRSP/401K match program
- Bonus programs to reward you for your accomplishments
- Wellness program to keep you healthy
- Opportunities to connect - book clubs, games nights, Special Interest Groups, “Coffee & Code” for our
developer friends, Team Meetings, and much more",,,,,,,,,project manager,2025-02-01

- Competence in project scheduling, cost estimation and budget management.
- Knowledge of environmental sustainability practices in construction.
- Ability to track record of successful project delivery, client satisfaction, and adherence to timelines and budgets.
- Experience conducting and facilitating safety training programs.
- Problem-solving ability and proficiency in creating cost-effective solutions.
- Ability to work away from home during projects.

- Must be able to climb scaffoldings.

A key expectation of this position is to build and nurture relationships with the trucking industry. This position has direct reports, who will help achieve the mandate within the strategic plan.

- Assist in developing communications for the public, clients, and other stakeholders using social media platforms.
- Assist in the marketing and public relations activities relevant to RPM Safety Programs (i.e. worksite visits introducing the programs and providing progress and updates at meetings)

- Tender, negotiate, and secure sub-contracts within project timelines and budgets
- Provide technical information to employees and subcontractors ensuring projects are delivered in scope and in accordance with standards, codes, specifications and design instructions
- Identify, mitigate, and manage project risks across multiple projects concurrently
- Foster excellent collaboration within the overall project team
- Support the project team in solving construction issues in time sensitive and urgent situations
- Understand and perform efficient and effective document control functions including tracking and issuing RFIs, submittals, contracts, and change orders
- Create, implement, and monitor development and construction schedules
- Deliver projects in scope, on time, and on budget.
• *What you need to bring**:
- Degree or diploma in Construction Management, Architecture, or Engineering or certification/registration in a relevant professional discipline, or equivalent experience
- 2-3 years minimum experience in a Project Management position, preferably in a multi-family construction environment
- Advanced computer skills including intermediate to advanced knowledge of MS Office and Excel
- Ability to develop and maintain relationships with project and company stakeholders

• *THE OPPORTUNITY IS YOURS**:

This is your opportunity to become a key player in our tight knit, people orientated organization and work directly with the Director of People and Culture, Central Region to help build and drive the HR Strategy, while maintaining operational oversight of the Manitoba Branches.
• *KEY RESPONSIBILITIES**:

- Works within the context of the National policy framework to develop, implement, administer and evaluate human resources policies to meet office needs and ensure compliance to provincial legislation.

- Design and implement talent acquisition processes that are in line with our 12-step hiring process. Ensure that recruitment and onboarding practices are best practice for the region and are meeting operational needs.
- Leading in all escalated workplace investigations, maintaining records, and representing the organization at hearings.

- Manage and coordinate employee culture training, leadership development and succession planning to enhance competitive ability. Ensure that managers and employees have or are able to acquire the skills, knowledge and competencies to fulfill the office’s current and future needs.
- Implement, in collaboration with the organizational leaders and within the context of the National framework, the professional development strategy for the business unit.
- Manage the promotion process in alignment with National office procedures.
- Review, manage, monitor and make improvements to the performance review process.
- Act as a business partner with operations and safeguard that all employee needs are being looked after.
- Ensure that new employee orientation is conducted in a way that fosters a positive corporate culture toward Company goals.
- Collaborate with the leadership team to ensure successful implementation of HR Metrics is achieved according to individual branch needs and goals.
- Maintain and foster an open-door policy.
- Other duties and projects as requested.
- Note: This position will require a moderate amount of travel throughout Manitoba.
• *KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES**:
- Completion of a 4-year bachelor’s degree, and completion or working towards a diploma or degree in human resources, business administration, or equivalent.

- Minimum 5+ year progressive experience in a full cycle Human Resources role ideally focused on the security or related industry with a minimum 2+ years’ experience in management level Human Resources role.
- Results driven with a desire to work in a fast-paced environment

We strive to hire a workforce that reflects the community we serve. Employment equity will be considered therefore applicants who identify as women, Indigenous people, members of racialized groups, and persons with a disability are encouraged to apply. _**
• *_If you require an accommodation at any time during the recruitment process, please let us know how we can meet your needs._**
• *Job Purpose**:

Reporting to the Director, Corporate Risk, the Program Manager, Records and Information Compliance is responsible for management and administration of the corporate wide records and information compliance programs. This includes developing, issuing and implementing policies, guidelines, and procedures in accordance with records and privacy legislation. Records management includes managing security with the system to ensure authorized access only and ensuring records are in accordance with MBLL’s Records Authority Schedules which serve as governing documents detailing record retention and disposition as well as. This position is the Privacy Coordinator and work closely with internal and external clients to ensure compliance with Privacy Acts and Regulations. The position acts as a liaison between the Provincial Archives, Government Records Office and the Manitoba Ombudsman’s Office to ensure records and privacy obligations are fulfilled.
• *Responsibilities**:
- Manage and promote all aspects of the corporate records management program, including strong direction and guidance with electronic records management software and privacy information compliance.
- Develop a corporate wide classification scheme and departmental file plans for the management of corporate information assets.
- Manage the development and amendment of Records Authority Schedules for the approval by responsible executives and the Provincial Archivist.
- Manage the security program within records management software to ensure that corporate records are protected from unauthorized access.
- Manage the vital records program to ensure the protection of the corporation’s most critical records.
- Develop, issue, and implement policies, guidelines and procedures in accordance with current legislation and information management standards.
- Develop and implement the records management software training program.
- Investigate trends in records management practices and recommend corrective actions for significant trends or events.
- Manage litigation holds on behalf of the corporation and provide litigation support as required.
- Develop a plan and design for records protection and disaster prevention, including records recovery efforts.
- Oversee the transfer of paper records to the Government Record Centre and maintenance of appropriate documentation.
- Develop a records coordinator user group to provide direction and leadership to departmental liaisons.
- Manage the disposition of records in accordance with Record Authority Schedules (including records in both electronic and paper format).
- Serve as Government Records Officer and Privacy Coordinator on behalf of the corporation.
- Manage and promote all aspects of the corporate privacy compliance program, including training.
- Provide expertise and direction to all business units regarding the collection, storage, and use of personal information.
- Oversee the creation of privacy statements in all forms that collect personal information of internal or external customers, ensuring compliance with current legislation.
- Oversee and coordinate all procedures required ensuring all regulatory requirements are adhered to in the potential event of an information loss/breach.
- Serve as a compliance coordinator for the Canadian Anti-Spam program, including handling of inquiries, consultations, and education plan for staff.
- Manage the provision of personal information privacy awareness and training sessions to all levels of staff.
- Create and provide records management or privacy compliance information reminders and updates for all staff through internal communications networks.
- Perform other related duties as assigned.
• *Primary Qualifications**:

- A bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Arts, or Business Administration and a 2-year certificate program in Certified Records Manager (CRM) or completion of one year in Master’s degree in Archival Studies.

- Advanced understanding of principles and regulations of applicable privacy legislation (e.g. Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy (FIPPA), Personal Health Information Act (PHIA), Canadian Anti-Spam legislation, General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), as they relate to the protection and management of personal information.

- A minimum of five years related work experience, including applied knowledge of document management procedures, file plan structures, and related legislative require",,,,,,,,,project manager,2025-02-01

Reporting to the Manager, Employee Well-being, the **Program Manager, Employee Well-being** will be part of a multidisciplinary team dedicated to developing and managing Canada Life’s employee well-being program. The goal of this program is to foster a healthy, engaged workforce and support employees in staying productive and at work.
• *What you will do**:
- Collaborate on the development and implementation of a comprehensive well-being strategy to promote employee health, reduce disability claims, and enhance engagement.
- Serve as the primary contact for day-to-day well-being program management.
- Lead well-being activities, program launches, and action plans.
- Identify opportunities to streamline processes, and improve program impact.
- Conduct benchmarking and research on industry best practices and trends.
- Create and deliver accessible educational resources and tools to support employees and leaders in fostering workplace well-being.
- Act as a trusted advisor, providing consultative support on well-being matters to HR and Employee Relations teams.
- Monitor disability trends and collaborate with HR to address challenges proactively.
• *What you will bring**:
- Minimum of 5 years in the disability management/prevention, health promotion, or other relevant human resource fields.
- Able to build strong and collaborative relationships, serving as a go-to expert for well-being-related matters.
- Strong understanding of National Standards for Psychological Health and Safety in the Workplace and Accessibility
- Deliver clear and concise information tailored to diverse audiences, including senior leaders, HR partners, and employees.
- Plan and execute projects with a focus on achieving measurable outcomes that drive employee health and engagement.
- Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Word, and PowerPoint, with the ability to use data analytics and reporting tools to make data-driven decisions.
- Comfortable managing and driving change within an organization, with a focus on improving processes and outcomes.
- Adaptable in a fast-paced environment, adjusting to shifting priorities while maintaining attention to detail and delivering high-quality results.
- Proficiency in English and French is an asset.
• *12-Month Temporary Full-Time Position.**
• *This position can be located in Winnipeg, Manitoba or Toronto, Ontario. Our Human Resources team currently works on a hybrid workstyle and in-office on Monday, Tuesday and Thursdays.**

The base salary for this position is between **$61,900-$114,500** annually. This represents base salary only and does not represent other variable compensation components of our total compensation ( i.e. annual bonus, commission etc). If you are selected to move forward in our recruitment process, your recruiter will be able to discuss additional details of our total rewards program with you.
Be your best at Canada Life
Being a part of Canada Life means you have a voice. This is a place where your unique background, perspectives and talents are valued, and shape our future success.

You can be your best here. You’re part of a diverse and inclusive workplace where your career and well-being are championed. You’ll have the opportunity to excel in your way, finding new and better ways to deliver exceptional customer and advisor experiences.

Together, as part of a great team, you’ll deliver on our shared purpose to improve the well-being of Canadians. It’s our driving force. Become part of a strong and successful company that’s trusted by millions of Canadians to do the right thing.

Canada Life serves the financial security needs of more than 13 million people across Canada, with additional operations in Europe and the United States. As members of the Power Financial Corporation group of companies, we’re one of Canada’s leading insurers with interests in life insurance, health insurance, investment and retirement savings. We offer a broad portfolio of financial and benefit plan solutions for individuals, families, businesses and organizations.

We are committed to providing an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and to creating an environment where every employee has the opportunity to reach their potential.
Canada Life would like to thank all applicants, however only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted.

column1: Our Purpose

At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.
By living our Purpose, we will make an impact that matters.
• Learn from deep subject matter experts through mentoring and on the job coaching
• Experience MyFlex and an agile work environment where work is what you do not where you do it
• Be empowered to lead and have impact with clients, our communities and in the office.
• Join one of the dynamic teams at Deloitte!
Due to the nature of the role having interactions with National & Global clients, English is required for this position
What will your typical day look like?
As a manager your duties will include but not limited to:
• Lead privacy and confidentiality due diligence and integration efforts for Deloitte acquisitions and divestitures
• Accountable for maturing Deloitte’s account and engagement-specific privacy and confidentiality controls to meet client contract expectations of Deloitte
• Support the maturation of Deloitte’s privacy and confidentiality processes and materials used in pursuit / RFP processes (e.g., client / market-facing privacy and confidentiality materials)
• Advise business lines of privacy and confidentiality risks for new / changing initiatives and develop strategies with the business lines to manage those risks
• Support incident management program maturation, where required
• Coach and develop privacy and confidentiality team members
• Other privacy and confidentiality tasks / projects, as required
About The Team

The PCO’s mission is to enable Deloitte’s strategic success through the responsible use of data. By strengthening Deloitte’s culture of privacy and confidentiality, we look to protect, preserve, and enhance the Deloitte brand with everything we do. We are looking for exceptional new team members to help us achieve these goals. We develop, deliver, and monitor initiatives to enhance mitigation for our most strategic risks, acting as an advisor to the business as all Deloitte professionals work to protect, preserve, and enhance Deloitte’s reputation as an industry leader for privacy and confidentiality. We have team members across Canada and Chile.
Enough about us, let’s talk about you
You are someone who has:
• Minimum 6 years of related work experience
• Strong understanding of Canadian privacy regulations and best practices is required
• Demonstrated success in unstructured environments, including strong organization and time management skills, and self-motivated is required
• International Association of Privacy Professionals (IAPP), Information Systems Audit and Control Association (ISACA), or other similar certifications are an asset
• Familiarity with managing confidential information and contracting is an asset
• Excellent project management skills are an asset

• Experience in related areas, such as professional services delivery, artificial intelligences (e.g., GenAI) data protection, data science, risk and controls, communications and change management, or technology processes and law is an asset
Total Rewards

The salary range for this position is $85,000 - $156,000, and individuals may be eligible to participate in our bonus program. Deloitte is fair and competitive when it comes to the salaries of our people. We regularly benchmark across a variety of positions, industries, sectors, targets, and levels. Our approach is grounded on recognizing people's unique strengths and contributions and rewarding the value that they deliver.

Our Total Rewards Package extends well beyond traditional compensation and benefit programs and is designed to recognize employee contributions, encourage personal wellness, and support firm growth. Along with a competitive base salary and variable pay opportunities, we offer a wide array of initiatives that differentiate us as a people-first organization. Some representative examples include: $4,000 per year for mental health support benefits, a $1,300 flexible benefit spending account, 38+ days off (including 10 firm-wide closures known as ""Deloitte Days""), flexible work arrangements and a hybrid work structure.
Our promise to our people: Deloitte is where potential comes to life.
Be yourself, and more.
We are a group of talented people who want to learn, gain experience, and develop skills. Wherever you are in your career, we want you to advance.
You Shape How We Make Impact.

Diverse perspectives and life experiences make us better. Whoever you are and wherever you’re from, we want you to feel like you belong here. We provide flexible working options to support you and how you can contribute. Be the leader you want to be.
Be the leader you want to be
Some guide teams, some change culture, some build essential expertise. We offer opportunities and experiences that support your continuing growth as a leader.
Have as many careers as you want.

We are uniquely able to offer you new challenges and roles – and prepare you for them. We bring together people with unique experiences and talents, and we are the place to develop a lasting network of friends, peers, and mentors. Our TVP is about relationships – between leaders and their people, the firm and its people, peers, and within in our communities.
The next step is yours

At Deloitte, we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities. Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates who represent the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes, but is not limited to, people with disabilities, candidates from Indigenous communities, and candidates from the Black community in support of living our values, creating a culture of Diversity Equity and Inclusion and our commitment to our AccessAbility Action Plan , Reconciliation Action Plan and the BlackNorth Initiative .

We encourage you to connect with us at accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca if you require an accommodation for the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms or other accommodations) or indigenouscareers@deloitte.ca for any questions relating to careers for Indigenous peoples at Deloitte (First Nations, Inuit, Métis).

By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.

Deloitte Canada has 30 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.",,,,,,,,,project manager,2025-02-01

We strive to collaborate with community leaders to achieve their goals, advocate for their needs, and provide them with the tools and resources necessary to drive positive change.

Are you looking for an exciting and challenging career path? Are you passionate about construction and building on your future? We are committed to providing opportunities for development for our employees in our growing organization.
**Project Manager**

Penn\-co Construction is a leading construction company currently hiring a Project Manager to join our team working at our Winnipeg office. As the Project Manager, you will be responsible for planning, organizing, executing and delivering corporate projects on time, within budget and in accordance with specifications. Penn\-co offers an excellent benefits package and competitive salary. If you are looking to join a leader in the construction industry and bring projects to life, then this may be the perfect fit for you.
Responsibilities
· Direct and oversee construction projects from start to finish while monitoring compliance with building and safety regulations.
· Communicate and maintain reputable relationships with owners, architects, consultants, subcontractors and the public.
· Lead and facilitate project meetings with internal and external stakeholders.
· Establish project reporting procedures and develop and monitor the project schedule and budget.
· Understand and enforce contractual responsibilities, contract documents and resolving disputes.
· Manage all change orders, including negotiating, processing and assessing cost and schedule impacts, and preparation of claims.
· Prepare and monitor progress billings to owner and from subcontractors.
· Review productivity planning, providing performance status reports regarding cost forecasts, and schedule.
· Provide a professional management style that reflects the Penn\-co image when communicating with all stakeholders.
· Build and foster a collaborative team environment with Project Coordinators and Superintendents
· Supervise, mentor, coach, train and motivate project team.
· Manage all aspects of project(s) close\-out.
· Other duties as assigned.
Qualifications
· 5\+ years of Commercial construction experience preferred on building projects of $5 million or greater.
· A diploma or degree in Project/Construction Management, a related field of study or past work experience operating at a similar level or role.
· Demonstrated leadership, communication and strong interpersonal skills is required.
· Read, interpret, and understand building blueprints, specifications, contract documents, etc.
· Ability to manage multiple projects and responsibilities and prioritize the workload appropriately.
· Strong computer skills, proficient in using Microsoft Office programs, as well as the ability and willingness to learn new software.
· Self\-motivated, ambitious and passionate about construction.
· Ability to problem solve with a can\-do attitude and a mindset of continuous improvement.
· Knowledge of construction methods, codes, and best practices in the construction environment
· Ability to work flexible hours.
· Travel is occasionally required.

Penn\-co has been in business for 65 years! Check out website www.penn\-co.com to see some of the exciting projects that we have completed and are currently working on! Empowering today for a better tomorrow.
Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
Job Type: Full\-time
Benefits:
* Dental care
* Employee assistance program
* Life insurance
* Vision care
Schedule:
* Monday to Friday
* Overtime

zr-VRJWM0KWSBp57x0kpDgeCA,zip_recruiter,https://www.ziprecruiter.com/jobs//j?lvk=VRJWM0KWSBp57x0kpDgeCA,,HRIS Strategy and Operations Manager,Parrish and Heimbecker,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-02-01,fulltime,,,,,,,,,organic,,"**HRIS Strategy and Operations Manager**

Parrish \& Heimbecker  Join our team that shares your Passion \& Heart for Canadian agriculture! Parrish \& Heimbecker, Limited (P\&H) has an opportunity for a motivated, forward\-thinking, and dedicated individual as a HRIS Strategy and Operations Manager based in Winnipeg, MB.Work and grow with a family\-owned company. Join our team with Purpose \& History! P\&H’s roots go back over 115 years. We have always been a Canadian, family\-owned and managed agri\-business that understands the qualities and conditions needed for meaningful growth. Our corporate culture values are family values, honesty and integrity with a focus on listening and continuous learning. Like family, we support our staff to always do better.

With over 70 locations spanning from coast to coast, and trade links around the globe, P\&H is growth\-oriented, diversified and vertically integrated with operations spanning across grain merchandising, flour milling, crop input distribution and animal feed production. BenefitsParrish \& Heimbecker Ltd has a people\-first approach therefore, we offer many perks to our hard\-working staff! Some of our benefits include:* Learning and Development Programs
* Dental, Vision, and Extended Health Care
* Tuition Reimbursement
* Employee Assistance Program
* Paid Time Off
* RRSP Matching
* Wellness Program
* Company Events

Your RoleWe are seeking an experienced HRIS Strategy and Operations Manager to lead the strategic direction, optimization, and day\-to\-day operations of our Human Resources Information System (HRIS). In this role you will ensure our HRIS supports organizational goals, improves efficiency, and adapts to the evolving needs of the business. You will collaborate with cross\-functional teams, drive data\-driven decision\-making, and manage the integration of HR technology solutions to enhance HR and Payroll functions.Day to Day* Develop and execute HRIS strategy aligned with organizational goals.
* Collaborate with HR, Payroll, IT, and business leaders to implement technology solutions that enhance efficiency and improve employee experience.
* Lead system, module, and process improvements to optimize HR \& Payroll functionality.
* Oversee HRIS team operations, monitor system performance, troubleshoot, and ensure data integrity, security, and compliance.
* Manage system audits, process optimizations, and HRIS\-related projects including upgrades, migrations, and integrations.
* Ensure projects are completed on time, within budget, and meet scope requirements.
* Guide HRIS team in reporting for Payroll, HR, and leadership teams, and identify process improvement opportunities.
* Mentor HRIS specialists and collaborate with departments to align HRIS with business needs.
* Maintain strong vendor relationships to ensure effective support and service delivery.
Required Qualifications* Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Information Technology, Business Administration, or a related field.
* 5\-7 years of experience managing HRIS systems, ideally in a leadership role.
* Strong knowledge of payroll laws, processes, compliance requirements, and data security standards.
* Strong expertise in HRIS platforms (preferably UKG)
* Proven experience in system implementation, process improvement, and change management.
* Familiarity with integration tools and APIs
We thank all applicants, but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

*P\&H is committed to building a skilled and diverse workforce that is reflective of Canadian society. As a result, Parrish \& Heimbecker, Limited is an equal opportunity employer and is in compliance with the Employment Equity Act. P\&H welcomes and encourages applications from women, aboriginal people, people with disabilities and members of visible minorities. Accommodations in relation to the job selection process are available upon request for both internal and external candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment process.*

zr-yD8ag-bK8iW-6UWUuqGS1Q,zip_recruiter,https://www.ziprecruiter.com/jobs//j?lvk=yD8ag-bK8iW-6UWUuqGS1Q,,Professional Intern - Business Analyst - UVS,Used Vehicle Services,"Headingley, MB, Canada",2025-01-31,contract,,,,,,,,,organic,recruitment@birchwood.ca,"**Professional Intern– Business Analyst at Birchwood Used Vehicle Services**
Full\-Time, Summer Internship Position
**Start date**: April/May (Flexible), End Date: end of August
**Closing date**: March 11th, 2025

The Professional Intern – Business Analyst will support ongoing initiatives for both the Birchwood Used Vehicle Services and Business Analyst teams. Reporting to the Asset Manager, the Business Analyst will act as a resource supporting several business operations. The successful candidate will play a key role in defining Birchwood's trends and areas of opportunity.

For over 25 years, Professional Interns have been an integral part of Birchwood. The program has evolved to include an immersive experience that focuses on personal and professional development. It is designed to create a network of empowered students who gain valuable skills while supporting Birchwood’s purpose. Our internship includes professional development workshops, unique social events, and an opportunity to network with our executive team.
At Birchwood, experience is everything, and we want you to be a part of our team.
**Project Opportunities:**
* Analyze monthly client financial results using financial analysis models and tools.
* Take part in a team environment, while providing real\-time collaborative feedback on asset procurement and reallocation.
* Gain exposure to the used vehicle marketplace at an operational level, thus being strategically placed to influence decision\-making
* Assist in inventory risk assessment and mitigation activities.
* Develop initiatives to reduce inventory inefficiencies and to improve inventory Return on Investment (ROI).
**Qualifications**:
* Participating in the Asper School of Business Co\-op program, preferably in their third or fourth year of studies.
* Majoring in Business Analytics is preferred.
* Creative ability to conceptualize and articulate new approaches and solutions.
* Demonstrates an understanding of Return on Investment, micro\-economics and business acumen.
* Experience using Power BI is required.
* Strong interpersonal and collaboration skills as you will be dealing with many stakeholders within the industry.
* Thrive in a collaborative environment where team support is encouraged.
* A commitment to learning and professional development.
* Comfortable leveraging technology for most day\-to\-day functions.
* A valid class 5 driver’s licence and reliable transportation to work is required.

Birchwood is Manitoba’s largest automotive retailer. Our 24 franchises are in addition to four state\-of\-the\-art collision repair centres and four Birchwood Credit Solutions locations. We offer sales, services, and parts to meet our customers’ automotive needs. We’re a recognized leader in the retail automotive industry, not only for our diverse workforce reflecting our community, but also for our unparalleled commitment to team members, customers, partners, and neighbourhoods. At Birchwood, our days begin and end with gratitude, personal leadership, trust, respect, continuous improvement, and generosity.

Birchwood is committed to creating a diverse workplace and is proud to be an equal\-opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. Reasonable accommodation is available to applicants with disabilities upon request. Please email your request to: recruitment@birchwood.ca",,,,,,,,,project manager,2025-02-01

zr-rPJ_rC8PCbLZJSCWfUNe2w,zip_recruiter,https://www.ziprecruiter.com/jobs//j?lvk=rPJ_rC8PCbLZJSCWfUNe2w,,IoT Solutions Architecture Manager,Canonical - Jobs,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-31,,,,,,,,,,organic,,"Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200\+ colleagues in 75\+ countries and very few office based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
The company is founder\-led, profitable and growing.

We are hiring an **IoT Solutions Architecture Manager** to lead a regionally\-focused team of Field engineers in Presales and Professional Services activities, by helping customers with solution architecture, design and delivery.

**Location:** This is a remote role, running a team in one of three Geos, Americas, EMEA or APAC. You will therefore need to be located in one of those three Geos to manage that specific team that spans few timezones from you

Our Internet of Things mission is to enable companies to make fleets of very secure connected devices. Canonical provides the base Ubuntu OS and kernel, with secure update and management mechanisms. Our customers create mission\-critical control systems, gateways and appliances that need to meet stringent quality and security requirements, and we aspire to bring this level of security to the wider consumer electronics and device market.

Our Field Engineers are thought leaders helping our customers solve hard problems. They are accomplished technologists that take a hands\-on approach to embedded Linux strategy and delivery. They have a passion to help customers achieve ambitious technical and business goals, and to show how the Canonical approach to open source and connected devices brings best\-of\-breed thinking to the emerging field of edge compute. They also care to develop their colleagues, helping them deepen their understanding of the technology, their ability to manage time, and their awareness of customer business thinking for continuous improvement and personal development.

This career opportunity requires a unique blend of skills. Successful candidates will know Linux well and be proficient coders and scripters. They will have experience of low\-level Linux boot, BIOS, firmware and embedded software development methodologies. They also enjoy the pace of change and diversity of client engagements with driven and ambitious technology entrepreneurs. Competitive, business\-focused technologists at heart, they are also team drivers that take pride in team and company wins.
The role entails* Lead and develop a team of Field engineers, ranging from graduate to senior, in the areas of Presales and Professional Services
* Solve customer problems by promoting our technologies and being a trusted advisor
* Work remotely in a single major time zone
* Coach, mentor, and offer career development feedback
* Identify and measure team health indicators
* Implement disciplined engineering processes
* Represent your team and product to stakeholders, partners, and customers
* Develop and evangelise great engineering and organisational practices
* Plan and manage progress on agreed goals and projects
* Be an active part of the leadership team, collaborating with other leaders
What we are looking for in you* Exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
* Bachelors degree in Computer Science or related technical field
* Extensive embedded Linux experience \- Yocto or other
* Extensive Linux experience \- Debian or Ubuntu preferred
* Fluency in at least one of Golang, Python, C, C\+\+, or Rust
* Ability to manage a small team
* Experience with customer engagements
* Professional written and spoken English
* Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability
* Result\-oriented, with a personal drive to meet commitments
* An ability to communicate the business benefits of technology
* An humble learner and quick study
Other desirable traits include RTOS experience, additional languages (both the programming and human kinds), and previous experience working in a remote\-first, diverse, distributed company.

What we offer youWe consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance\-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
* Distributed work environment with twice\-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues from your team and others
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events

About CanonicalCanonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence \- in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004\.​ Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.
\#LI\-remote",,,,,,,,,project manager,2025-02-01

* Strong project management skills with the ability to define done and keep deliverables on track

* Fluent in business English (written and spoken)

Nice to have skills* Experience with immigration policies and mobility processes

**Department:** Encore
**Employment Type:** Full\-Time/Permanent
**Location:** Winnipeg, Manitoba
**Who Are We?**

Founded in 1944 by A.A. DeFehr in Winnipeg, Palliser has grown into one of North America's leading furniture manufacturers. We value our employees, clients, our communities, our natural environment and providing the best customer experience possible. At Palliser, we produce quality and demand excellence.
**What Would You Do?**

Palliser Furniture Ltd. is currently seeking an energetic and dedicated individual to fill the role of Technical Services Specialist. The Technical Services Specialist will possess strong technical expertise, excellent customer service skills, and the ability to manage multiple tasks effectively. The role will involve traveling to customer locations, assessing technical needs, and delivering tailored maintenance solutions.
**The duties and responsibilities of this position would include:**
* Provide exceptional customer service in person, over the phone, and via email to address inquiries, resolve issues, and build strong relationships.
* Collaborate with the sales and technical teams to ensure customer satisfaction and align services with company goals.
* Manage service schedules, ensuring timely visits and efficient use of resources.
* Conduct on\-site assessments of customer installations to evaluate technical needs and identify maintenance requirements.
* Collaborate with the sales and technical teams to ensure customer satisfaction and align services with company goals.
* Manage service schedules, ensuring timely visits and efficient use of resources.
* Conduct on\-site assessments of customer installations to evaluate technical needs and identify maintenance requirements.
* Perform technical audits on aging recliners and other furniture to assess performance, wear, and safety.
* Prepare detailed reports on findings, including recommendations for improvement, cost estimates, and timelines.
* Maintain a comprehensive understanding of Encore's products and services to effectively communicate value to customers.
* Stay informed about industry trends and best practices to continuously improve service offerings.
* Develop and present tailored maintenance project quotes and recommendations to customers.
* Identify opportunities to upsell or cross\-sell additional products and services to meet customer needs.
**What Do You Bring?**
* Strong mechanical and technical aptitude with the ability to diagnose and solve issues effectively.
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to manage customer relationships professionally and empathetically.
* Proven ability to work independently and manage time effectively in a fast\-paced environment.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and familiarity with CRM systems.
* Willingness and ability to travel extensively (50\-70%).
* Valid driver's license and passport.
**Why Work with Us?**
As Palliser grows, we recognize the importance of investing in our people, as well as the people who will bring us to the next level in the furniture industry.

Palliser is committed to fostering an inclusive environment where all employees and customers feel valued, respected, and supported. We are dedicated to creating a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and an environment where every employee has the opportunity to excel.
We offer plenty of benefits to the people who made us what we are today
* Employee Family Assistance Program
* Comprehensive benefits package, including life, health, dental, disability
* Potential RRSP Match Program
* Employee Furniture Purchase Program
* Professional Development Opportunities
* Free Parking
**What's Next?**
Apply now and tell us why you'd make an excellent fit for this position.",,,,,,,,,project manager,2025-02-01

go-J4DYhkWXU0Zth1J6AAAAAA==,google,https://ca.bebee.com/job/eec19a1dc35f4cbf7df2f9f48cbafe1e?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,Medical Laboratory Specialist,Dynacare,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-22,,,,,,,False,,,,,"Job Summary
Mission-Driven Professionals Sought for Key Laboratory Role

In this critical laboratory position, you will be responsible for performing a variety of routine laboratory procedures to obtain data for use in the diagnosis and treatment of disease. As a Medical Laboratory Technologist, you will work closely with our team to maintain high-quality results and ensure patient care.
Responsibilities:
• Process Microbiology specimens and perform bench work according to daily schedule or as otherwise needed.
• Follow established Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and departmental guidelines for all procedures.
• Maintain accurate records for all test and control results, ensuring compliance with quality standards.
• Perform equipment maintenance and calibrations, preparing chemical solutions as required.
• Develop and implement training programs to enhance skills of new employees.
Skill Requirements:
• Strong knowledge of Quality Control documentation and microbiology specimen processing is essential.
• Excellent communication and organizational skills are necessary for success in this role.

go-9QV9ItXjqv9RxkaRAAAAAA==,google,https://ca.bebee.com/job/462d13049d63ef4339476939cd781ae0?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,Medical Laboratory Professional with Clinical Expertise,Winnipeg Regional Health Authority,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-20,,,,,,,False,,,,,"Company Overview
Shared Health leads the planning and coordination of patient-centered clinical and preventive health services across Manitoba.

Salary and Benefits
A competitive salary range is available, including $33.593, $35.144, $36.755, $38.478, $40.274, and $42.143 per annum.
Job Description
As a General Duty Medical Laboratory Technologist, you will be responsible for clinical analysis and reporting on patient samples according to established protocols.

Required Skills and Qualifications
• Graduate of an approved Medical Laboratory Technology program.

• Current registration or eligibility for registration with the College of Medical Laboratory Technologists of Manitoba (CMLTM) required.
• Current membership with the Canadian Society for Medical Laboratory Science (CSMLS) considered an asset.
• Must be able to communicate effectively in English, both written and oral.
• Windows computer environment required.
• Microsoft Office programs preferred.
• Familiarity with quality assurance programs and accreditation standards.
Working Conditions
This position requires working shifts, weekends, and holidays, and participating in standby and callback duty.
Exposure to all hazards and dangers incumbent in working in a laboratory is expected.
For more definitive information, refer to the Job Hazard Analysis Assessment of this position within the specific laboratory.",,,,,,,,,laboratory technician,2025-02-02

go-aR-i5fVeJsb38mggAAAAAA==,google,https://ca.trabajo.org/job-2891-42246cedeef64287ce2f00226b8ea517?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,Project & Research Facilitator,City of Winnipeg,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-16,,,,,,,False,,,,,"Under the general direction of the Administrative Coordinator of Safety and Wellbeing, the Project and Research Facilitator is responsible for the administration of funding and grant agreements created and maintained by the Safety and Wellbeing Branch of the Community Development Division. - GIS Certification would be an asset.
- A minimum of three (3) years in a related field.
- A minimum of three (3) years administering grants and working within granting programs.
- A minimum of three (3) years of diverse and progressively more responsible experience in Community Social Development, or Social Support service delivery systems, in an administrative capacity.
- A minimum of three (3) years prior related experience in the field of analytics, neighbourhood profiling.
- Demonstrated strong analytical skills.
- Demonstrated knowledge of best practices in research standards.
- Strong written and oral presentation and communication skills.
- Ability to work independently with mínimal direction, and within a team environment.
- Demonstrated ability to write and produce statistical and market analysis reports.
- Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Access, Word, Project, and PowerPoint.
- Working knowledge of SPSS, GeoMedia, experience in Adobe products would be an asset.
- Demonstrated project management ability.
- Demonstrated relationship and consensus building.
- Strong interpersonal skills.
- Knowledge of and experience working with/in support of vulnerable populations.
- Knowledge of and experience working with/in support of Indigenous-led organizations.
- Knowledge of and experience in crime prevention and community safety.
- Knowledge and experience in the area of community social development.
- Lived experience as a person from a First Nations, Metis, Inuit, Black or Racialized community is an asset.
- Valid Manitoba Class 5 Drivers License is desired.
• *Conditions of employment**:
