go-sHwBnLywVGG9cGGZAAAAAA==,google,https://ca.trabajo.org/job-2891-a038a60c2bad28b06f38e0e13d4c4f8a?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,"Research Assistant, Asian Americans and Settler",University of Winnipeg,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-14,,,,,,,False,,,,,"**This posting will be used to hire 2 positions**

Research Assistants are normally students, in a University of Winnipeg undergraduate program, employed to assist with tasks related to research. Work is performed within defined guidelines and under supervision of a more senior researcher or faculty member.
• *Position Overview**:
The Research Assistant will assist the Senior Research Assistant to support the research needs of this project and knowledge mobilization activities.
This research project is funded by a two-year grant from the Social Sciences and Humanities Research Council (SSHRC). The primary focus of the research is to further our understanding of:
- the role of Asian Americans in the U.S. settler colonial project in Hawai?i
- the impact of that settler colonial project on Asian American life in U.S. occupied North America and Hawai?i
- the historical relationships between Asian Americans and Kanaka Maoli (Indigenous people of Hawai?i)
- the potential for political coalition between Asian North Americans and Indigenous peoples in pursuit of decolonization
- Brief professional resume or CV

- 1-page cover letter (single-spaced) detailing your educational research experience and qualifications, any important skills and professional experience you would bring to the role, your career and academic goals, and your interest in and/or familiarity with the research topics
- University transcripts
- A short academic writing sample or excerpt (3-10 pages)
• *Duties**:
- Assisting the book project by conducting literature reviews
- Identifying and gathering archival material using online databases
- Organizing, annotating, and indexing digitized archival material
- Reviewing primary/cultural sources such as TV shows, films, recordings, and/or photographs
- Working with the Senior Research Assistant to conduct visual/textual/cultural analysis
- Assisting the preparation of knowledge mobilization activities, such as panel discussions and conference presentations
• *Qualifications**:
- Advanced Honours and Undergraduate History majors (Cultural Studies and other humanities disciplines will be considered
column2: M.A. students will be considered).

column1: - Strong academic writing skills.
- Experience conducting literature review/secondary source analysis.
- Experience with primary source analysis.
- Familiarity with Chicago citation style.
- Familiarity with Zotero.
- Familiarity with cultural/textual analysis (film, television, literature).
- Familiarity with archival research.
- Interest in a research-focused or activism-focused career related to the arts/humanities.
- Existing relationships with Asian North American, Indigenous, and/or other racialized communities.
- Familiarity with or desire to learn about the core histories and theories of settler colonialism and/or Asian North American studies in the U.S., Canadian, and/or Pacific contexts.
• *Condition(s) of Employment**:
- **Must be legally entitled to work in Canada.**
The period of work will be from **December 2, 2024 - July 1, 2025 **and the estimated total hours of work will be **0-120 hours**.
• *_ Note_**_: This position is represented by the Public Service Alliance of Canada - Research Capacity Unit._
• *Note**: The work described in this posting will be conducted in-person.",,,,,,,,,research assistant,2025-02-02

go-X5sZGR-XfqvtX5d4AAAAAA==,google,https://ca.trabajo.org/job-2891-a5d4072fe7bc6e9d030931171319b919?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,Cova - QA Analyst,Cova,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-17,,,,,,,True,,,,,"**About Cova**:

Cova has been the fastest-growing software solutions company in the history of the legal cannabis industry and is now the #1 POS in North America. After launching commercially less than 4 years ago, we surpassed over 50 other companies as the industry preference. Through constant product innovation, execution of a clear growth strategy, and high integrity in everything we do, Cova delivers a premium service to its clients.

We design and build products on an open API architecture platform that elevates the dispensary retail experience. Our point-of-sale solution (POS) is purpose-built for cannabis retail and is based on years of experience in high growth/high complexity industries.

The legal marijuana market is on a fast growth trajectory with more new states legalizing every year. 5 more just passed in Nov 2020 and 2 additional states legislatively opted for retail operations in 2021.

Cova operates as a young company that spun out of a solid, well-established 20+ year old software company called iQmetrix. Collectively, our software can be found in over 20,000 stores across North America in several verticals, and we support retailers with one location and others who have thousands. Cova has invested heavily to have the industry-leading platform for enterprises and is technologically ahead of where the industry is heading.
Let's shape the next generation of cannabis retailers together and own it.
• *Job Summary**:
• *Responsibilities**:
- Testing & validating acceptance criteria for user stories.
- Testing & validating defect fixes.
- Performing exploratory testing to discover regressions.
- Championing quality assurance during all phases of the product development lifecycle.
- Identifying and recommending components that could be covered via automation
- Validating hardware and documentation of hardware testing
- Providing feedback to your team on design and user experience considerations.
- Supporting the investigation of reported development or production issues.
- Developing and maintaining the regression test suite for the areas your team is focused on.
- Triaging bugs with your product manager and technical lead.
- Working with the product manager to contribute acceptance criteria and test plans for upcoming projects.
- Participate in the co-ordination of Android app releases
• *Qualifications**:
- 3+ years of experience in a QA analyst or similar role.
- Experience working in an agile development environment and a clear understanding of how to operate within that framework.
- Experience writing test plans and creating test data.
- Experience testing APIs
- Sharp analytical, data analysis, and problem-solving skills.
- Excellent written and oral communication skills.
- Excellent organizational and time management skills.
• *Nice to Have**:
- Familiarity with Azure, Cosmos, Mongo, and/or SQL
- Experience writing or running automated tests
• *What Really Matters**:
A lot can be learned or trained, but there are a few things that can't.
- Strongly self-motivated with a drive to succeed
- Caring about our clients and their customers
- Being able to collaborate with others to ensure that we all succeed together
• *Want to Join the Team?**

If you're interested in a career with Cova, please submit your resume and cover letter. We are an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, faith, colour, cultural background, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
We are a hybrid work environment, remote and in-office for all employees in an office city.",,,,,,,,,quality control analyst,2025-02-02

go-Bv61Zuqf2anC0vuCAAAAAA==,google,https://ca.trabajo.org/job-2891-9930f06dfc1dee8f6815f442877e838b?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,Quality Assurance Supervisor 12-month Contract,Dunn-Rite Food Products,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-16,contract,,,,,,False,,,,,"**Quality Assurance Supervisor - 12 Month Contract**

Provides direct supervision and daily support to the various Quality Assurance Technicians. Assists the QA Manager and/or HACCP coordinator with the implementation and enforcement of food safety and quality programs to all departments. Ensures adherence to required food safety laws, regulations, and company/customer policies and procedures. Has the authority to suspend operations when serious food safety and quality risks are identified.
• *POSITON RESPONSIBILITIES**:
Assists in the implementation, program review, maintenance and validation of the Food Safety and Quality System: HACCP, BRC, Animal Welfare (GMPs, Prerequisite Programs, Policies, SOPs, etc.)
- Direct supervision of QA Technicians and indirect supervision all departments
- Provides food safety and quality direction to Production, R&D, Purchasing, Shipping & Receiving, Maintenance, Planning and Sanitation
- Advises department managers and supervisors of non-compliances/deviations
- Assists the HACCP coordinator and QA Manager with site audits and takes appropriate action to ensure the integrity of HACCP and BRC Systems
- Perform internal audits and on-site inspections GMP’s, Sanitation, Animal welfare
- Ensures that regulatory compliance with CFIA, BRC and Customer requirements are met and maintained
- Monitors and verifies food safety programs and practices and overall SOP compliance within the facility
- Assists with GMP and Technical training of personnel on HACCP/BRC functions
- Ensures supplier compliance and for any deviation non-conformity reports are issued, communicated to the supplier, tracked, trended, and managed
- Identifies trends related to food safety (foreign material, Holds, deviations, etc.) and communicates findings to management
- Ensures appropriate product holds, and timely dispositions
- Provides technical documentation for testing of products and raw materials
- Responsible for schedule review and allergen management
- Responsible for maintaining the verification schedule and ensuring verification compliance including record reviews, on-site observations, interviews, etc.
- Assists with the creation and revision of product specifications to ensure food safety and quality
- Develops and maintains incoming specifications and online profiling spreadsheets to track and trend quality parameters
- Other duties assigned by QA Manager
• *KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS**
Ø Strong understanding of QA, Food Safety principles.
Ø Knowledge of SFCR, GFSI
• *EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATION**
Ø Bachelor’s degree in Science or related field.
Ø 2-3 years’ experience in a related field.
Applicants must be legally entitled to work in Canada to apply.
12 Month Contract
• *Job Type**: Fixed term contract
• *Benefits**:
- Dental care
- Extended health care
- Life insurance
- Vision care
Flexible Language Requirement:
- French not required
Schedule:
- 8 hour shift
• *Education**:
- Bachelor's Degree (preferred)
• *Experience**:
- quality assurance: 1 year (preferred)
Work Location: One location",,,,,,,,,quality control analyst,2025-02-02

go-1fDGyNIvbUcjHt0gAAAAAA==,google,https://ca.trabajo.org/job-2891-2c0168bfc330dd18f5be1513b8260663?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,Applied Data Scientist,Arcurve Inc.,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-17,contract,,,,,,True,,,,,"Arcurve is one of North America’s leading full-service technology, advisory and software development companies. In 2006, we began with a belief that there was a better way to deliver professional services in the technology industry. Since then, we have completed more than 700 projects for clients ranging from start-ups to Fortune 500 companies. From our office in Calgary and hubs in Halifax, Houston and Vancouver we deliver exceptional results for our clients in a diverse range of industries including telecommunications, oil and gas, transportation, private equity, gaming, infrastructure, software, financial and hospitality.

At Arcurve, we believe that work should be an enjoyable experience, and that the best “aha” moments come through team learning and continuous motivation. We know the key to success is collaboration, and that you can’t put a value on accountable, transparent, and authentic interactions. We strive to deliver exceptional service while creating lasting relationships with our employees, our students, our clients, and our community.
We’re looking for an authentic, collaborative, accountable and experienced Applied Data Scientist to join the Arcurve team.
YOU ARE
- Passionate about technology
- An authentic and creative human
- Driven to succeed
- A believer in the importance of teamwork
- Community-minded
- An expert problem solver
- Someone who thrives on challenge
- Motivated by exception results
- Someone who cares about your clients
THE GOAL

In this role, you will be highly analytical with a knack for analysis, math and statistics. Critical thinking and problem-solving skills are essential for interpreting data. You will also be expected to have some programming skills, an ability to design new algorithms, handle big data, with some expertise in the domain knowledge. You will be asked to interpret the results of your findings, and to explain how the model or technique works to our clients.
THE RESPONSIBILITES
- Identify valuable data sources and automate collection processes
- Undertake preprocessing of structured and unstructured data
- Analyze large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns
- Build predictive models and machine-learning algorithms
- Collaborate with data engineering and business intelligence analysts
- Propose solutions and strategies to resolve business challenges
- Present information using data visualization techniques
- Combine models through ensemble modeling
- Interact with stakeholders
- Model design and testing
- Algorithm assessment, design, and testing
THE REQUIREMENTS
- Proven experience as an Applied Data Scientist, working with external clients
- Technical expertise with data models, data mining, and segmentation techniques
- Experience of end-to-end Machine Learning system design (including data pipelines and M/L Ops)
- Knowledge of R, SQL, Python, and Jupyter notebooks
- Experience using Databricks, Spark, Hadoop, Neo4j/Graph Databases or equivalent
- Experience using business intelligence tools (e.g. PowerBI, Tableau, Qlik)
- Experience with cloud infrastructure platforms (Azure, AWS, GCP)
- Strong math skills (e.g. statistics, algebra)
- Analytical mind and business acumen
- Excellent communication and presentation skills
- BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant field
column2: graduate degree in Data Science or other quantitative field is preferred

go-HQfu-J9zeFf_-ozEAAAAAA==,google,https://ca.trabajo.org/job-2891-5995bb55e1ec1c3e3f20458e403337aa?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,Data Integrity Analyst,Health Sciences Centre,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-14,,,,,,,False,,,,,"**Requisition ID**: 366582
• *Position Number**: 20066560

• *City**: Winnipeg
• *Employer**: Shared Health
• *Site**:Health Sciences Centre
• *Department / Unit**: Neuro and Resp Section Administration
• *Job Stream**: Non-Clinical
• *Union**: Non Union
• *Anticipated Start Date**: 09/23/2024
• *FTE**: Casual
• *Anticipated Shift**: Days
• *Work Arrangement**: Hybrid
• *Daily Hours Worked**: 7.00
• *Annual Base Hours**: 2015

Grow your career in the Winnipeg Health Region Our team provides a spectrum of health care services through an integrated network of sites, services and organizations. We’re united by a shared commitment to excellent and equitable health care.
• *Position Overview**:
Digital Health focuses on supporting clinical and business systems as the foundation for leveraging electronic data in the delivery of health-care services.

We have opportunities for data integrity analysts who may be assigned within any area of Digital Health to provide data quality support to facilitate a cross-system view of client information throughout the province to improve health services.
Reporting to a supervisor, data integrity analysts:
- Monitor data quality, collaborate and provide regular communication and support to source system organizations to resolve data quality issues.
- Facilitate continuous improvement in the quality of client information across source systems and processes relating to registration, health records, and client data integrity.
- Work independently with mínimal direction and protect confidential information.
- Use analytical and methodical approach to investigate and resolve concerns and ensure technology systems are running optimally to meet user needs.
• *Experience**:

- 5 years of experience using and training others on admissions/discharge/transfer (ADT) systems in a health information services environment, and using spreadsheets, databases, general office systems, and registration and digital records management systems to analyze and manage data, and to promote data quality and integrity.
- 2 years of experience facilitating, developing and implementing business processes and policies, and monitoring emerging multi-jurisdictional trends in data management and naming conventions.
- Experience working under the Manitoba Personal Health Information Act and working with report development tools are assets.
• *Education (Degree/Diploma/Certificate)**:
- A post-secondary diploma in health information management.
- An equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered.
• *Certification/Licensure/Registration**:
- Active member in good standing and current certification from the Canadian Health Information Management Association.
- PHIA (Patient Health Information Act) certification.
• *Qualifications and Skills**:
- Demonstrated leadership capabilities at the staff level. The provincial health system in Manitoba has adopted the LEADS in a Caring Environment framework.
• *Physical Requirements**:
- Must be able to work safely in a typical computerized office environment with frequent meetings, and to lift and carry items of up to approximately 10 kg.
- Interruptions to respond to questions are common
column2: dedicated and focused time for planning and concentration can be scheduled.

column1: - Travel throughout the province requiring a valid Manitoba driver’s license and use of a personal motor vehicle.

- Must be able to work flexible hours to accommodate the service requirements of source system and client organizations and support our 24/7/365, province-wide client needs through scheduled overtime and on call work as required.

Please note that an employee is not permitted to hold two or more positions across the WRHA legal entity that combine to equal more than 1.0 EFT. The WRHA legal entity includes Churchill Health Centre, Deer Lodge Centre, Golden West Centennial Lodge, Grace Hospital, Middlechurch Home of Winnipeg, Pan Am Clinic, River Park Gardens, Victoria General Hospital, WRHA corporate programs, and WRHA community health services.",,,,,,,,,data analyst,2025-02-02

go-r9_BX7_1y7y1RO0jAAAAAA==,google,https://ca.bebee.com/job/d869263634023b349a2e3aa26f948aec?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,Application Architect – Digital Analytics and Reporting,BQ INTERNATIONAL LTD.,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-13,,,,,,,False,,,,,"Application Architect – Digital Analytics and Reporting

This position involves developing a corporate data analytics strategy that keeps pace with MPI's modernization activities and adoption of cloud technologies. The strategy must consider the existing legacy infrastructure, changing reporting needs, and the new technologies being adopted. It will also need to address the complex aspects of information management, decision support, and analytics from user experience and performance, infrastructure, security, and governance.
The role requires developing a multi-year roadmap that aligns with the approved Data Analytics Strategy. Additionally, documenting the Data Analytics conceptual and logical architectures is crucial.
Mandatory Minimum Skill Requirements include:
• Leveraging the organization's information and infrastructure environment as well as a modern, emerging technology landscape to design a holistic and optimized analytics platform.

• 5+ years' experience establishing business intelligence technology standards, creating an analytics roadmap, infrastructure, and tools in a hybrid (Cloud and on-premise) environment, including but not limited to:
• Data Warehouse and Data Marts setup and organization.
• Analytic processing.
• Predictive Analytics, Big Data, and Data Lakes.
• Adhoc and Static Reporting.
• Working experience planning and setting up Business Intelligence tools: Tableau and PowerBI are required. Working with SAP is beneficial.
• Experience deploying analytics in a Microsoft environment.
• Experienced working with Agile delivery teams.
• Preference will be given to candidates with experience modernizing legacy data analytics and reporting technologies.
A Certified Data Management Professional Certification (CDMP – DAMA) and experienced working with Agile SAFe Framework are valuable assets.
The responsibilities could include but are not limited to:
• Developing application architectures, frameworks, and strategies to meet the business and application requirements.
• Defining architecture to be used in web-based projects.
• Identifying policies and requirements that drive out a particular solution.
• Analyzing and evaluating alternative technology solutions to meet business problems.
• Ensuring the integration of all aspects of technology solutions.
• Monitoring industry trends to ensure that solutions fit with government and industry directions for technology.
• Analyzing functional requirements to identify information, procedures, and decision flows.
• Evaluating existing procedures and methods, identifying and documenting database content, structure, and application sub-systems, and developing a data dictionary.
• Defining and documenting interfaces of manual to automated operations within application sub-systems, to external systems, and between new and existing systems.
• Defining input/output sources, including a detailed plan for the technical design phase, and obtaining approval of the system proposal.
• Identifying and documenting system-specific standards relating to programming, documentation, and testing, covering program libraries, data dictionaries, naming conventions, etc.
• Performing architectural modeling to ensure consistency of the design with existing work.
• Assessing the impact of new requirements on existing web applications.
• Ensuring functionalities have been implemented according to specifications.
• Defining assumptions and constraints of architecture with regard to physical structure and data collection.
• Developing a post-implementation plan for monitoring/tracking architecture stability.
7+ years of relevant experience in this role – Preferably with a recognized professional certification.",,,,,,,,,data analyst,2025-02-02

• Experience with local and national-based building, electrical, and fire safety codes
• Strong communication, interpersonal, and relationship skills
• Strong leadership skills to collaborate and execute projects effectively
• Valid Passport with ability to travel domestically and internationally
• Demonstrated mechanical/electrical aptitude in large-scale industrial facilities
Richardson International is committed to providing a supportive work environment and competitive compensation package.",,,,,,,,,program coordinator,2025-02-02

go-n35kpTCYUSIWMj0yAAAAAA==,google,https://ca.bebee.com/job/27e07093d0a356ef60689fcea754fefb?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,Young Dads Program Coordinator,Youth for Christ Canada,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-17,,,,,,,False,,,,,"Job Title: Young Dads Program Coordinator

• Support and equip volunteers, ensuring that volunteer time and assignments are managed well.
• Pursue meaningful partnerships with community organizations, businesses, and resource agencies to build relationships and provide better support and care for the young parents.
Requirements:
• Maintain a close, intimate relationship with God as a devoted follower of Jesus Christ.
• Be an active participant in the life of a local church.
• Affirm and support our organization's Community Covenant and Statement of Faith, and be committed to YFC's mission.
• Experience working with families in a social service or non-profit setting would be an asset.
• Education in Social Work, Counseling, and any other related fields would be an asset.
• Embrace YFC's core values with a strong heart for evangelism.
• Strong communication, organizational, and administrative skills.
• Take initiative, pay close attention to details, and be willing to adapt.
• Able to work well in a team as well as on your own.
• Ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines while maintaining high standards of quality.",,,,,,,,,program coordinator,2025-02-02

• *Responsibilities**:

Together, we can build success and a better future. Let’s get started

go-FfoCAE6xKhuJ6UGeAAAAAA==,google,https://ca.trabajo.org/job-2891-841df0374c22d8b439cd5540e8a7fac1?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,Records & Information Management Coordinator,City of Winnipeg,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-16,,,,,,,False,,,,,"The Records and Information Management Coordinator is responsible for the overall life cycle management of all records created and maintained in the Department and for the coordination of access to information and protection of privacy matters within the Department under The Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act (FIPPA) and the Personal Health Information Act (PHIA). This includes planning, implementing and administering the department’s records policies, procedures and standards
column2: managing projects related to records management software including implementations and upgrades
column3: training end-users and managing related vendor relationships
column4: responding to departmental FIPPA requests and supporting Privacy Impact Assessments. This would also include adherence to the City’s overall archives control system (both hard copy and electronic).

column1: • *As the Records & Information Management Coordinator, you will**:
- Manage the records and information management program for the department.
- Coordinate access to information and protection of privacy matters within the department as per legislation (FIPPA and PHIA).
• *Your education and qualifications include**:
- University degree in Business or Public Administration or another related field. A combination of relevant education and experience may be considered.
- Master's Degree in Archival Studies preferred.
- Two (2) years of related experience in records and information management (RIM) in the public sector or for a large private sector organization.
- Experience dealing with, providing consulting services, and implementing solutions relating to RIM best practices to multiple client areas with various lines of business.
- Experience working with senior level management providing RIM advice, implementation, and related services in a diverse, unionized environment.
- Leadership abilities along with previous experience involving RIM activities, building capacity, and promoting continuous learning and development.
- Experience managing requests for access to information (FIPPA) including but not limited to: Monitoring and tracking the processing of access requests
column2: Ensuring time limits and notice requirements are met
column3: Contacting third parties whose privacy or business interests may be affected by the release of information, to determine their positions
column4: Estimating, calculating, and collecting fees, when required
column5: Reviewing preliminary access recommendations from program directors and managers
column7: and Preparing Departmental responses to Ombudsman complaints, where required.

column1: - Experience providing innovative and effective strategic advice to management on RIM issues.
- Ability to consult, mediate, negotiate, and work with a variety of teams/ groups, (i.e. Senior Management, Unions / Associations).
- Well-developed knowledge of Corporate RIM programs, internal processes, and systems.
- Ability to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing, with a variety of internal and external stakeholders.
- Strong political acumen.
- Ability to carry-out responsibilities of the job with a high degree of confidentiality and professionalism in accordance with existing and evolving FIPPA and PHIA standards and legislation
• *Conditions of employment**:
- The successful applicant must maintain legal eligibility to work in Canada. If the successful applicant possesses a work permit, it is their responsibility to ensure the permit remains valid.
- Information Governance Professional (IGP) Certification - Must be able to obtain IGP certification within 24 months of appointment to the position
column2: OR, must be able to obtain the designation of Certified Records Manager within 24 months of the appointment.

column1: • *CORE COMPETENCIES**: FOR ALL EMPLOYEES OF THE CITY OF WINNIPEG**:
- Citizen & Customer Focus
- Respecting Diversity
- Ethics and Values
- Integrity and Trust

go-yyqaWxZK3I0fUQ0fAAAAAA==,google,https://ca.trabajo.org/job-2891-4b6dad98786a8ba8ea4a67280be08cb9?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,Student Engagement Coordinator,BOOTH UNIVERSITY COLLEGE,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-14,,,,,,,False,,,,,"**OVERVIEW**:

The Student Engagement Coordinator is responsible to promote student engagement in the Booth UC community, support the needs of international students, support students generally as they transition into university, and serve as an effective member of the Student Services team supporting achievement of student retention goals.
• *SUPERVISORY FUNCTIONS**:Provides guidance and direction to several part-time student staff
column2: gives leadership to members of the Student Council and supervises their activity. Note: responsibility for matters such as budget, discipline, staff supervision, and strategic planning rests with the Dean of Students.

column1: • *ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS OF THE JOB/ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**:

- In cooperation with the Dean of Students, and other Booth UC staff and students, plan, implement, promote, monitor, and assess programs to increase student engagement and improve their sense of belonging within the Booth UC community.
- Collaborate with others on campus to plan and execute events that promote Booth UC community engagement.

- Provide leadership and guidance to the Booth UC Student Council, including event planning, managing the election process, providing leadership training, coordinating an annual Constitution review, and managing the Student Council budget and expenditures.
- Provide leadership and guidance to Booth UC Chapel Coordinator, including managing related licenses, streaming services, facility set-up, and promotions.
- Advise international students at Booth UC, ensuring their smooth transition to Booth UC campus and culture, and supporting their needs throughout their degree program.
- Support international students through their journey to Winnipeg and help them to settle well in preparation for studies at Booth UC.
- Prepare a detailed orientation that will set international students on a path for success at Booth UC, including cultural adjustments, academic expectations, and settlement in Winnipeg.
- Serve as the point person for international student supports on campus.
- Communicate regularly with international students and develop feedback mechanisms to maintain good understanding of their needs and experiences.
- Stay current on new government regulations and decisions that impact international students at Booth UC
column2: advise the Dean of Students accordingly.

column1: - Coordinate specialized supports for visiting international students from Booth UC partner institutions.
- In cooperation with the Dean of Students and other Booth UC staff, plan, implement, and evaluate an Orientation Program for all new students attending Booth UC at the start of each term.
- Review and edit the Booth 100 Orientation Course together with the Dean of Students
- Plan programming to welcome new students to campus and become connected with the Booth UC community.
- Provide guidance and direction to the Student Services Assistant in compiling information and resources to help students in the following areas:
- Connect with meaningful employment opportunities.
- Secure appropriate off-campus housing.
- In cooperation with the Dean of Students and Communications Specialist, promote events, activities and supports on campus that are of interest to the Booth UC student body:
- Review the Student Services website and maintain its currency.
- Communicate general interest items to the student body via Populi.
- Manage social media accounts for Student Council.
- Be available as an emergency contact to address urgent Booth UC student situations.
- Participate in various committees including Safety Committee, Privacy Committee, and other committees as assigned.
- Keep current on student services practices and trends, and relevant government regulations (e.g. immigration, safety, privacy, etc.).
- Contribute to Student Services team initiatives and other activities and responsibilities as assigned.
• *QUALIFICATIONS**
• *1. Required**
- Satisfactory criminal record check (vulnerable sector) (see note below)
- Fully support the integration of faith and learning in a Christian university-level setting and a commitment to the Mission of Booth University College
- Ability to integrate your Christian faith within the workplace
- Must be valid to work in Canada
- Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., education, social work, behavioral sciences)
- 3 years of related work experience
- Event and program planning experience and/or training
- Strong interpersonal skills and ability to facilitate conflict resolution effectively
- Ability to lead teams and manage team activity effectively
- Ability to plan and build support for new initiatives within community
- Excellent communication skills with ability to relate well with students in a post-secondary setting
- Cross-cultural acumen and ability to communicate effectively to students of different ethnicities and cultures
- Ability to handle sensitive matters with discretion, good judgment, and attention to privacy considerations
- Valid driver’s license
- A",,,,,,,,,program coordinator,2025-02-02

go-UkFiJkCqb6t7ZqwRAAAAAA==,google,https://ca.trabajo.org/job-2891-719642db95a413dad8fd05d15a3018db?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,Construction Project Coordinator,Tri-Core Projects,"Oak Bluff, MB, Canada",2025-01-14,contract,,,,,,True,,,,,"**About Us**

Tri-Core Projects Ltd. is a Manitoba-based general contractor and construction company. Our operations include demolition, site preparation, excavation, underground service installation, remediation services, telecom, and special projects.
• *Position Summary**

A **Project Coordinator** in our **Utilities and Telecom Division** is responsible to administer and organize all types of projects, from simple activities to more complex plans. This role works closely with Project Managers and Division Managers to prepare action plans, including assisting with resources, timeframes, and budgets for projects.
• *Primary Accountabilities**
- Assist with estimates.
- Coordinate equipment, material, and labour resources.
- Track field quantities on day of delivery, compare list of items to the drawings, and submit confirmation to Project Manager.
- Underground utility locating
- Attend project management meetings
- Assist PM with updating MS Project schedules
- Provide onsite takeoffs to Site Supervisor prior to starting new task
- Site documentation (photos, construction plans, daily reports, RFIs, etc )
- QAQC inspections (i.e. keeping track of restoration sites).
- Assist with project cost and quantity tracking.
- Development and implementation of GPS survey models
- Onsite survey duties, as required.
- Data entry (aggregate tickets, piling records, etc )
- Administer miscellaneous/small projects (as assigned by the Project Management Team)
• *General Accountabilities**
- Communicate effectively verbally and in writing with supervisors, peers, and clients.
- Ability to think logically about work at hand and compare site conditions with project designs.
- Understand construction drawings and specifications.
- Detect errors, determine causes, and make corrections as appropriate.
- Team player, able to get along with a diverse group of people working towards a common goal.
- Must be in good physical condition with the ability to stoop, crawl, bend at the knees and waist, and lift 50 lbs.
- Ability to work independently and self-motivated.
• *Competencies**
- **Communication Skills**: Excellent verbal and written communication skills to effectively communicate with supervisors, peers, and clients.
- **Interpersonal Skills**: Strong interpersonal abilities for effective employee engagement, conflict resolution, and building rapport with diverse teams.
- **Problem-Solving**: The ability to analyze surveying challenges, offer solutions, and navigate complex issues.
- **Attention to Detail**: Meticulous handling of client information and keeping accurate documentation.
- **Negotiation Skills**: Savvy in negotiation to resolve conflicts and provide any needed information.
- **Time Management**: Strong organizational skills to manage multiple tasks, prioritize responsibilities, and meet deadlines effectively.
- **Adaptability**: Flexibility to adapt to evolving surveying practices with industry changes and embrace new technologies or methodologies.
- **Ethical Standards**: Upholding ethical standards, integrity, and confidentiality in handling sensitive information.
• *Qualifications**
- 1 - 3 years experience as a Project Coordinator
- Bachelor in Civil Engineering, Civil Engineering Technology Diploma, or Bachelor of Technology, Construction Management degree.
- Combination of education and experience will be considered
- Preference will be given to those with underground experience
• *Working conditions**:
- Fast paced work environment.
- Ability to flex working hours, including evenings and weekends to meet the demands of the role.
- Must be able to work in all weather conditions.
- Ability to work remotely for extended periods of time.
• *Reporting to**:Division Manager

We offer a competitive wage along with a comprehensive benefit package. If you are an enthusiastic and hard-working individual who is interested in being a part of our Team, then we want to hear from you
• *We thank all applicants, but we will only contact those short-listed for interviews and those who are eligible to work in Canada.**
Note: This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. The employee may perform other related duties as assigned by the supervisor to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.
Pay: $28.00-$33.00 per hour
Expected hours: 50 per week
Ability to commute/relocate:
- Oak Bluff, MB R4G 0A4: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)
• *Experience**:
- Project management: 1 year (required)
Licence/Certification:
- Class 5 Licence (preferred)
Willingness to travel:
- 25% (required)
Work Location: In person
Application deadline: 2024-09-22",,,,,,,,,program coordinator,2025-02-02

zr-_Dj9kcHwUhyxZOgftxydig,zip_recruiter,https://www.ziprecruiter.com/jobs//j?lvk=_Dj9kcHwUhyxZOgftxydig,,Bids Cost and Pricing Specialist,New Flyer,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-02-01,,,,,,,,,,organic,,"New Flyer is North America’s heavy\-duty transit bus leader, providing sustainable mobility solutions through transit buses, technology, and infrastructure. New Flyer is a subsidiary of NFI Group, a leading independent bus and coach manufacturer and a leader in electric mass mobility solutions. Building on its 90\+ year legacy of innovation, New Flyer is the only manufacturer offering all three types of zero\-emission transit buses, with over 1,900 zero\-emission buses delivered to date. Proudly serving all 25 of the largest transit agencies in North America, New Flyer actively supports over 35,000 heavy\-duty transit buses currently operated by approximately 500 agencies.

This position is responsible for ensuring accurate Materials Costs to support the pricing of Bids, Options, and SRCR’s. This position will also analyze the margins achieved at build as compared to the targets established at the time of Bid or Option pricing and coordinate activities related to achieving the margin target with Strategic Sourcing and other cross functional groups. This position will also establish controls over and monitoring of purchased parts item pricing as well as monitor and validate material cost on the reference buses in coordination with Strategic Sourcing team. This position will be responsible for all customer specific financial reporting requirements, maintaining all supplier and financial administration for the programs, and leading customer audits.
**Requirements**
**WHAT YOU WILL DO:**
**· Accurately complete bids, costs, forms, and other tasks**
**· Strategize with sales, marketing and supply teams to increase costs efficiency**
**· Validate material, purchasing and sales costs**
**· Coordinate contractual quotes and supplier documentation**
**· Prepare management summary for material costs and supply risks**
**· Prepare and review supplier, state content and contractual agreements**
**· Coordinate internal activities for audit closure**
**· Other tasks as assigned for specific program from supply management, sales and finance**
**WHAT YOU NEED TO BE SUCCESSFUL:**
**· University or related training and experience**
**· Strong analytical abilities**
**· Process oriented and attention to detail**
**· Proficiency with excel and PDFs**
**· Financial background related to cost accounting**
**· Supply management**
**OUR WHY:** We exist to move people. Our mission is to design, deliver, and support market\-leading bus and motor coach solutions that are safe, accessible, efficient, and reliable.
**NFI Group \| We Move People \- YouTube**

Leveraging 450 years of combined experience, NFI is leading the electrification of mass mobility around the world. With zero\-emission buses and coaches, infrastructure, and technology, NFI meets today’s urban demands for scalable smart mobility solutions. Together, NFI is enabling more livable cities through connected, clean, and sustainable transportation. News and information is available at www.nfigroup.com, www.newflyer.com, www.mcicoach.com, nfi.parts, www.alexander\-dennis.com, arbocsv.com, and carfaircomposites.com.
**Benefits**
**WHY JOIN US:**
· Be a part of a team leading the world’s electrification of mass mobility
· Competitive Wages and comprehensive benefit package with Immediate benefit eligibility
· Paid holidays and vacation
· Passionate about creating a better product, a better workplace, and a better world
· Inclusive workplace culture that values and empowers team members.
· On\-the\-job training in a continuous learning environment (we’ve invested 10\.9 million in 2023\)
· Advancement opportunities within our family of companies

***New Flyer is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity, ensure equitable experiences and are committed to creating an inclusive environment reflective of the communities we operate. Accommodations are available at all stages of the recruitment process, at the candidates’ request****.*",,,,,,,,,program coordinator,2025-02-02

column1: gd-1009622274782,glassdoor,https://www.glassdoor.ca/job-listing/j?jl=1009622274782,,Landscape Construction Project Manager,Clintar Winnipeg,Winnipeg,2025-02-02,,direct_data,yearly,60000.0,75000.0,CAD,False,,,organic,,"**Benefits:**
* Bonus based on performance
* Company car
* Company parties
* Competitive salary
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Training \& development
* Vision insurance
**What we offer**

This job will offer you the opportunity to work on some large landscape Construction projects. The pace, challenges and problem\-solving opportunities will mean you are never bored. You will have the chance to develop and refine a wide variety of skills in our rapidly growing business.

We want you to be successful, and we believe in rewarding our staff for exceptional work. In addition to excellent on\-the\-job training in project management and site supervision, a safe and inclusive work environment for you and your colleagues, we offer:
**Who are we looking for?**

We are looking for a **Manager** to support our crews . This role will require 75% of your time as a project manager and 25% working in the field assisting the crews. In this role, you will schedule, monitor and close\-out landscape construction projects while providing organization, management and logistical support to crews as well as on\-going communication with clients. You will coordinate crews and subcontractor scheduling, monitor project schedule and budget, and supervise, coordinate, and schedule the day to day work activities of a landscape construction crew. You will also plan labour requirements, equipment requirements and material deliveries and timing to ensure completion of job(s) within the deadline. In addition, you will maintain and enforce standards of safety. cleanliness and organization in assigned trucks, trailers, equipment, jobsites, and shop/yard areas. This is a full\-time, permanent position.
**To be the successful candidate you:**
* Align with Clintar core values of integrity, hard work, team work, the pursuit of excellence and loving what we do
* Have 5\+ years of experience in construction
* Have 5\+ years of experience across a broad range of landscaping construction site work, including concrete, masonry, carpentry, site layout, site grading
* Have 5\+ years of experience in landscape or construction project management (PMP not required)
* Have experience reading and interpreting scaled drawings
* Demonstrates leadership by example and the ability to engage others in the accomplishment of tasks in an efficient and organized way
* Are looking for something new, exciting and creative to be a part of
* Have a big imagination, and great problem solving skills
* Recognize the importance of building to high quality standards
* Want to be proud of your employer and work for a highly regarded industry\-recognized leader
* Communicate effectively with supervisors, colleagues and clients
* Thrive in a busy work environment and respect project timelines
* Are comfortable and skilled operating a variety of landscaping machinery

*By using this site, you acknowledge that if you are offered employment, your sole and exclusive employer is the local franchised business that hired you, not Clintar Commercial Outdoor Services. Clintar Commercial Outdoor Services does not participate in any local employment decisions or practices within its franchised businesses. Each franchise is independently owned and operated.*",,https://www.glassdoor.ca/Overview/W-EI_IE889261.htm,https://media.glassdoor.com/sql/889261/clintar-landscape-management-squarelogo-1542191375531.png,,,,,,project manager,2025-02-02

go-8uVTMkXjluL1BfL0AAAAAA==,google,https://ca.bebee.com/job/7510b7078a5660bfdac02c27a5d9a4bc?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,Compliance Risk Manager,Maarut Inc,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-30,,,,,,,False,,,,,"We are looking for a highly skilled Compliance Risk Manager to join our team at Maarut Inc. In this role, you will be responsible for managing compliance risk across our organization.

The successful candidate will have minimum 10 years of experience as an IT Risk and Compliance Management Specialist, including 5 years of experience leading an IT Risk and Compliance Management function. They should be familiar with security, IT process, and control frameworks such as COBIT, ISO 27002, ITIL, and TOGAF.

A strong background in Microsoft Azure cloud infrastructure configuration and management is essential, along with experience implementing the Government of Canada's Medium Profile for Cloud (PBMM) and Cloud Guardrails. The ideal candidate will also have hands-on experience with the Government of Canada's Security Assessment and Authorization (SA&A) process.

You will work closely with our leadership team to develop and implement strategies for managing compliance risk across our organization. This includes identifying areas for improvement, developing recommendations for mitigation, and working with teams to implement changes.
Key Responsibilities:
• Manage compliance risk across our organization.
• Identify areas for improvement and develop recommendations for mitigation.
• Work with teams to implement changes and ensure compliance with regulatory requirements.",,,,,,,,,project manager,2025-02-02

At Real Canadian Superstore, we succeed through collaboration and commitment and set a high bar for ourselves and those around us. Whether you are just starting your career, re-entering the workforce, or looking for a new job, this is where you belong.
What you'll do:
Oversee the day-to-day operations of the Bakery department within the store
Ensure the department meets or exceeds sales and profitability goals
Train and develop department associates in customer service, product knowledge, and merchandising
Ensure merchandise is stocked, displayed, and priced appropriately
Monitor inventory levels and coordinate with other departments to ensure timely replenishment
Maintain a clean and safe department for customers and employees
Manage departmental expenses and assist in budget preparation
Communicate regularly with store management and other department managers to ensure store-wide goals are being met
Be constantly on the lookout for great talent to join our team
Lead, coach and motivate colleagues to improve productivity, engagement and retention
Be committed to maintaining merchandising and operational standards
Building and leading diverse teams that foster a workplace of inclusiveness and belonging
What you bring:
High school diploma or equivalent
column2: some college coursework preferred

column1: Previous retail management experience, preferably in a departmental or specialty store setting
Strong leadership and interpersonal skills with the ability to motivate and develop associates
Excellent organizational and time management skills
Ability to work a flexible schedule, including nights and weekends
Proficiency in basic computer skills, including Microsoft Office
Knowledge of retail operations, including merchandising, inventory management, and customer service
Ability to lift and move up to 50 pounds and stand for extended periods of time.

Our commitment to Sustainability and Social Impact is an essential part of the way we do business, and we focus our attention on areas where we can have the greatest impact. Our approach to sustainability and social impact is based on three pillars - Environment, Sourcing and Community - and we are constantly looking for ways to demonstrate leadership in these important areas. Our CORE Values - Care, Ownership, Respect and Excellence - guide all our decision-making and come to life through our Blue Culture. We offer our colleagues progressive careers, comprehensive training, flexibility, and other competitive benefits - these are some of the many reasons why we are one of Canada’s Top Employers, Canada’s Best Diversity Employers, Canada’s Greenest Employers & Canada’s Top Employers for Young People.

If you are unsure whether your experience matches every requirement above, we encourage you to apply anyway. We are looking for varied perspectives which include diverse experiences that we can add to our team.

We have a long-standing focus on diversity, equity and inclusion because we know it will make our company a better place to work and shop. We are committed to creating accessible environments for our colleagues, candidates and customers. Requests for accommodation due to a disability (which may be visible or invisible, temporary or permanent) can be made at any stage of application and employment. go-TCBn5usyWxCvXjcSAAAAAA==,google,https://ca.bebee.com/job/21d898c7d492da3f1a1b610f658588ee?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,Chief Operations Manager - Engineering Excellence,Harris Leadership Strategies,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-25,contract,,,,,,False,,,,,"Exceptional Opportunity in Project Leadership

We are seeking a highly experienced Senior Project Manager to join our team at Arnason, a renowned engineering and construction company with a rich history of delivering successful projects across Manitoba, Saskatchewan, and Northern Ontario.
About Us

With over 50 years of expertise in northern projects, we specialize in civil, concrete, and infrastructure sectors, offering services in winter roads, water treatment plants, sewage treatment, underground water and sewer pipe installation, aggregate crushing, and commercial builds.
The Role of Chief Operations Manager
• Oversight of construction projects from start to finish.
• Budget management and resource allocation for optimal availability.
• Strategic planning of construction operations.
• Evaluation and maintenance of safety regulations and quality standards.
• Collaboration with owners, subcontractors, engineers, and key stakeholders.
Key Qualifications and Skills Required
• 5-10 years of experience in construction management of diverse projects.
• Degree or Diploma in Construction Management, Engineering, or related fields (PMP certification beneficial).
• Proven expertise in estimating and managing construction budgets.
• Excellent leadership skills, including team management and mentoring.
• Highly organized with exceptional time management, attention to detail, and interpersonal abilities.
• Northern and Indigenous relations experience is crucial.
• Strong communication skills and negotiation abilities.
• Commitment to workplace safety and adherence to established practices.
• Ability to work independently and collaboratively as part of a team.
• Advanced MS Office skills (Word, Excel, Outlook) and valid driver's license.

Salary: $80,000 - $120,000 per annum, based on qualifications and experience. Our comprehensive benefits package includes group health insurance, onsite gym access, and opportunities for professional growth and development.",,,,,,,,,project manager,2025-02-02

- Effective verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills.

Your salary, which considers your unique qualifications and experience, is just one component of the robust total rewards you'll enjoy at PCL. This may include an employee share purchase offering, discretionary annual performance bonus, comprehensive benefits and wellness programs, retirement plan plus matching, and career development programs.
Together, we can build success and a better future. Let’s get started

go-aR-i5fVeJsb38mggAAAAAA==,google,https://ca.trabajo.org/job-2891-42246cedeef64287ce2f00226b8ea517?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,Project & Research Facilitator,City of Winnipeg,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-16,,,,,,,False,,,,,"Under the general direction of the Administrative Coordinator of Safety and Wellbeing, the Project and Research Facilitator is responsible for the administration of funding and grant agreements created and maintained by the Safety and Wellbeing Branch of the Community Development Division. The Project and Research Facilitator will establish and maintain collaborative working relationships with external funding bodies, City, and community stakeholders, identifying opportunities to assist, prepare and share relevant statistical information, project evaluation, and related analysis. The Project and Research Facilitator will develop and maintain safety and wellbeing-focused research and analysis, including geospatial analysis, preparation of Statistics Canada Census Profiles, Target Group Profiles, and Infographics specific to the understanding and prevention of violent crime.
The Project and Research Facilitator will also assist, when required, in other tasks for the Community Development Division. This position is part of a temporary project that ends in 2026.
• *As the Project and Research Facilitator you will**:

- Administer Safety and Wellbeing funding agreements on behalf of Community Development Division, including but not limited to those awarded through Public Safety Canada’s Building Safer Communities Fund and the City of Winnipeg’s Community Safety and Crime Prevention Program.
- Data collection, analysis, and sharing information associated with public safety and wellbeing projects and services.
- Collaborate within Community Development Division and with all areas of Winnipeg’s Public Service to achieve Council-directed goals, particularly those relating to public safety and wellbeing.
• *Your education and qualifications include**:
- Bachelor’s Degree in Geography, Economics, Political Science, Public Administration, Social Sciences preferred, or equivalent combination of training and experience.
- GIS Certification would be an asset.
- A minimum of three (3) years in a related field.
- A minimum of three (3) years administering grants and working within granting programs.
- A minimum of three (3) years of diverse and progressively more responsible experience in Community Social Development, or Social Support service delivery systems, in an administrative capacity.
- A minimum of three (3) years prior related experience in the field of analytics, neighbourhood profiling.
- Demonstrated strong analytical skills.
- Demonstrated knowledge of best practices in research standards.
- Strong written and oral presentation and communication skills.
- Ability to work independently with mínimal direction, and within a team environment.
- Demonstrated ability to write and produce statistical and market analysis reports.
- Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Access, Word, Project, and PowerPoint.
- Working knowledge of SPSS, GeoMedia, experience in Adobe products would be an asset.
- Demonstrated project management ability.
- Demonstrated relationship and consensus building.
- Strong interpersonal skills.
- Knowledge of and experience working with/in support of vulnerable populations.
- Knowledge of and experience working with/in support of Indigenous-led organizations.
- Knowledge of and experience in crime prevention and community safety.
- Knowledge and experience in the area of community social development.
- Lived experience as a person from a First Nations, Metis, Inuit, Black or Racialized community is an asset.
- Valid Manitoba Class 5 Drivers License is desired.
• *Conditions of employment**:
- The successful applicant must maintain legal eligibility to work in Canada. If the successful applicant possesses a work permit, it is their responsibility to ensure the permit remains valid.
• *CORE COMPETENCIES**: FOR ALL EMPLOYEES OF THE CITY OF WINNIPEG**:

go-mIaUIXdzfF0SNCw6AAAAAA==,google,https://ca.trabajo.org/job-2891-1f18ad455f97a12657eefdc096e79745?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,"Program Manager, Csc and Ccc",Manitoba Possible.,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-15,,,,,,,False,,,,,"**We are**

Manitoba Possible. We believe an inclusive and accessible society is possible. That is why we work together to eliminate barriers to full and equal participation. Manitoba Possible provides programs and services throughout the province. The way we do that is by working collaboratively, diversifying in every way possible, and innovating at every level.
• *You are**

A **_Program Manager, Children’s Service Coordination and Communication Centre for Children (CSC & CCC)_**. You will provide policy direction, financial and human resource planning and monitoring and program development and evaluation to the provincial Children’s Service Coordination program and the Communication Centre for Children who are Deaf or Hard of Hearing.
• *Your Role**
- Plans, directs and manages the service provision of the assigned programs/departments, in consultation with the Director of Provincial Services.
- Develops and applies departmental goals, and objectives to ensure program activities are aligned with best practices.
- Provides team leadership and development, ensuring all staff (direct reports) have a clear understanding of a shared commitment to the program and Manitoba Possible’s mission, vision and values.
- Directs timely and responsive decision making through the practice of delegation and accountability.

- Initiates and develops collaborative relationships with service partners, funders and key stakeholders having an interest in or contributing to the delivery of services for children with disabilities and children who are Deaf or Hard of Hearing.

- Prepares and develops annual operating budgets within the resources available for all assigned departments, in support of the development of the Manitoba Possible Services Consolidated budgets for review and approval by the Director of Provincial Services. Budgets will respect Service Purchase Agreement (SPA) requirements and other funding obligations for reporting and assignment of funding.
- Maintains current knowledge of external services relevant to program clients and their families and to promote and obtain feedback on Manitoba Possible services.
- Establishes a collaborative relationship with other Manitoba Possible programs.
- Promotes Manitoba Possible in a positive manner within the organization and externally.
- Conducts formal program evaluations to measure program efficiency and effectiveness and identify any service gaps.

- Participates in the strategy, writing and negotiation of Service Purchase Agreements and provides both Manitoba Possible and funders with appropriate feedback and reporting as required under those agreements.
- Conducts regular scheduled meetings with staff to review program activities, communicate expectations, advise on policy changes and to share information of general interest to the program.
- Supports/contributes to public relations, public education or community liaison requests.
- Ensures adherence to Manitoba Possible policies and procedures and ensures service provision meets the requirements of external regulatory bodies.
- Coordinates monthly and annual reports on program activity and performance.
- Participates in workshops, courses and professional development activities to upgrade skills and stay current with job related information and methods.
- Other duties (that fall within the scope of this position) as may be assigned.
• *What You Know**
- Bachelor of Social Work Degree with 3 - 5 years of supervisory and program management related experience is required. A combination of education and experience will be considered
- Experience in social service program development and evaluation
- Experience working with regulated health professionals
- Demonstrated knowledge of community resources that support the needs of individuals with disabilities
- Demonstrated knowledge of community resources that support the needs of children who are Deaf or Hard of Hearing
- Valid Manitoba Drivers License
- Fluency in American Sign Language (ASL) preferred",,,,,,,,,project manager,2025-02-02

go-l-vjY3IoxETrWWdLAAAAAA==,google,https://stantec.jobs/winnipeg-mb/project-architect-industrial/3CAF07813AA04010966F70B68311C756/job/?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,"Project Architect, Industrial",Stantec,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-10,contract,,,,,,False,,,,,"Project Architect, Industrial - ( 240003JD )
Description

Stantec Buildings is on a mission to become the world’s leading integrated design practice. Our architects, engineers, interior designers, sustainability specialists, and technologists are passionate about the power of design. We take an innovative, collaborative approach to projects, sharing a common belief that sustainable design for the built environment can make the world a better place for future generations. Join us and design your place with Stantec.
Stantec Architecture

Our local Buildings Practice reflects our corporate structure, bringing together an integrated, highly motivated, dynamic, and diverse team of Architects, Interior Designers, Landscape Architects, Structural, Mechanical, Energy, Electrical and Sustainability Specialists, and support staff. Working together with our clients as an integrated practice, we believe we are better able to ask the right questions, establish common outcomes, and collectively evaluate and advance meaningful solutions that reflect value, program clarity, and technical astuteness.
As a growing practice, we are driven to achieve Design Excellence through Brilliant Delivery, founded in Communication, Collaboration, Expertise, Research, Technology and Culture.

As an integrated Practice, we also specialize in studios such as Civic [including Culture and Transportation], Commercial [including Retail, Residential, Hospitality, and Mixed-Use], Defense, Healthcare, Industrial, K-12, Post-Secondary, Sport & Recreation, and Workplace. While our office is local, our success and the nature of our broader global practice routinely leads to opportunities to travel and work on projects across North America and beyond.
Your Opportunity

We are looking for a Project Architect for our Military, Industrial, and Manufacturing Practices. Working closely and in collaboration with the Project Manager, you will be responsible for leading the Architectural design, technical deliverables, and coordination of these projects, each with varying levels of complexity and scale. You will be working within fully integrated design teams throughout all project phases, from pre-design through to post-construction services.
Projects typically include new construction, building additions or upgrades, building envelope upgrades and building condition assessments.
Some of our project types include new construction and/or renovations to:
• Aircraft hangars
• Military Facilities
• Vehicle Maintenance Facilities
• Data Centers
• Food & Beverage Processing
• Transit Stations
• Commercial
• Manufacturing
• Operations Maintenance & Storage Facilities,
• Warehousing and Distribution Centres
• Light Industrial Projects
• Medium and Large-scale Component Manufacturing and Assembly Facilities
• Power Plant buildings
• Blast-resistant Facilities
• Storage for dangerous goods
• Buildings for hazardous processes
• Industrial laboratories
• Industrial Maintenance Buildings, and switchgear or other power-related structures.
Your Key Responsibilities
• Assist with developing or leading project proposals, including Project Approach, Methodology, Workplan, Resourcing, Scheduling and Fees.
• Assist with preparing marketing materials including presentations, awards, etc.
• Build and inspire strong, efficient, effective, and driven Project Teams.
• Lead, direct, and/or assist with client meetings and stakeholder engagement workshops.
• Establish project deliverables through a collaborative approach with the team to meet project schedules.
• Lead interdisciplinary project team meetings, peer reviews, independent reviews, and advance a collaborative approach to design, technical solutions and project delivery.
• Lead, direct, and/or assist the Project Manager with monitoring and managing project financials including workplan, resources, deliverables, invoicing, and change orders.
• Lead, direct, and/or assist with site analysis and evaluations.

• Lead, direct, and/or assist with investigating/verifying existing conditions including documentation, measurement, and verification, as well as building and property condition assessments including verification of zoning by-laws with local Authorities Having Jurisdiction (AHJ’s), National Building Code (NBC), National Fire Code (NFC), and other appliable codes and standards.
• Ability to collaborate with Clients to analyze needs and develop program requirements.
• Ability to develop design options/approach.
• Understanding of general concepts around industrial/manufacturing processes, including site planning, functional operations, and client requirements.
• Ability to work within BIM model set up, utilizing BIM technologies to design and develop projects and renderings.
• Assist with the evaluation and selection of building systems and materials.
• Refined ability to prepare Project/Design Reports, including graphic communication, writing, and coordination.
• Firm understanding of coordination of building systems.
• Ability to implement sustainable design principles.
• Ability to analyze Quantity Survey data and develop value engineering options and strategies.
• Demonstrated ability to lead the development of Contract Documents, including drawings and coordinating specifications, from schematic design to construction issue documents.
• Ability to assist with tendering process, issuance of Addenda, pre-bid meetings, bid evaluations, negotiations, and preparation of owner-contractor contracts.

• Ability to provide Contract Administration services, including meetings, Field Observations and Reports, preparation of Supplemental Instructions, Contemplated Change Notices, Change Orders, and Change Directives.

• Ability to oversee that the design intent/vision is maintained throughout the project, from conception through system and material selection, visualization, implementation, documentation, coordination, and construction.
Qualifications
Your Capabilities and Credentials
• Excellent verbal, written, and graphic communication skills.
• Driven to achieve Design Excellence through brilliant and collaborative design.
• Proven ability to lead, solve complex multi-stakeholder problems, and inspire project teams, clients, users, consultants, contractors, and trades.
• Proven ability to engage and work within a creative and critical integrated design practice.
• Good understanding of structural, mechanical, and electrical systems for buildings.
• Demonstrated interest in holistic design, systems thinking, construction, materials, sustainability, and technical design detailing.
• Proven ability to check work of others for accuracy and completeness and manage team to meet project budget and schedule.
• Proven knowledge and understanding of accessibility codes, applicable building and life-safety codes for a wide variety of project types and complexity.
• Experience with and understanding of hazardous environments and processes.
• Excellent knowledge of construction costing and quantity surveying from cost planning through cost control.
• Excellent knowledge of building construction systems, constructability, materials, and industry associated standards.
• Excellent knowledge of construction procurement models, contracts, and delivery (e.g. Design-Bid-Build, Construction Management, and Design/Build).
• Requires understanding of Microsoft Office, Revit, AutoCAD.
• Ability to acquire required Security Clearances for a variety of institutional project types.
• Ability to travel and work in other provincial jurisdictions and collaborate with other Stantec offices across North America.
Education and Experience
• Master of Architecture required.
• MAA License, or equivalent Provincial Registration required.
• Minimum of 5 years of experience preferred.

This description is not a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that may be required of the employee and other duties, responsibilities and activities may be assigned or may be changed at any time with or without notice.

Stantec Architecture is a place where the best and brightest come to build on each other’s talents and strengths, to achieve design excellence together, to advance a more meaningful, purposeful, and sustainable environment for ourselves, our families, friends, and communities to thrive. Join us and help us shape a better world.

Benefits Summary: Regular full-time and part-time employees will have access to health, dental, and vision plans, a well-being program, health care spending account, wellness spending accounts, group registered retirement savings plan, employee stock purchase program, group tax-free savings account, life and accidental death & dismemberment (AD&D) insurance, short-term/long-term disability plans, emergency travel benefits, tuition reimbursement, professional membership fee coverage, and paid time off.
Temporary/casual employees will have access to group registered retirement savings plan, employee stock purchase program, and group tax-free savings account.
The benefits information listed above may not apply to union positions because benefits for such positions are governed by applicable collective bargaining agreements.

* Bonus based on performance
* Company car
* Company parties
* Competitive salary
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Training \& development
* Vision insurance
**What we offer**

This job will offer you the opportunity to work on some large landscape Construction projects. The pace, challenges and problem\-solving opportunities will mean you are never bored. You will have the chance to develop and refine a wide variety of skills in our rapidly growing business.

We want you to be successful, and we believe in rewarding our staff for exceptional work. In addition to excellent on\-the\-job training in project management and site supervision, a safe and inclusive work environment for you and your colleagues, we offer:
**Who are we looking for?**

We are looking for a **Manager** to support our crews . This role will require 75% of your time as a project manager and 25% working in the field assisting the crews. In this role, you will schedule, monitor and close\-out landscape construction projects while providing organization, management and logistical support to crews as well as on\-going communication with clients. You will coordinate crews and subcontractor scheduling, monitor project schedule and budget, and supervise, coordinate, and schedule the day to day work activities of a landscape construction crew. You will also plan labour requirements, equipment requirements and material deliveries and timing to ensure completion of job(s) within the deadline. In addition, you will maintain and enforce standards of safety. cleanliness and organization in assigned trucks, trailers, equipment, jobsites, and shop/yard areas. This is a full\-time, permanent position.
**To be the successful candidate you:**
* Align with Clintar core values of integrity, hard work, team work, the pursuit of excellence and loving what we do
* Have 5\+ years of experience in construction
* Have 5\+ years of experience across a broad range of landscaping construction site work, including concrete, masonry, carpentry, site layout, site grading
* Have 5\+ years of experience in landscape or construction project management (PMP not required)
* Have experience reading and interpreting scaled drawings
* Demonstrates leadership by example and the ability to engage others in the accomplishment of tasks in an efficient and organized way
* Are looking for something new, exciting and creative to be a part of
* Have a big imagination, and great problem solving skills
* Recognize the importance of building to high quality standards
* Want to be proud of your employer and work for a highly regarded industry\-recognized leader
* Communicate effectively with supervisors, colleagues and clients
* Thrive in a busy work environment and respect project timelines
* Are comfortable and skilled operating a variety of landscaping machinery

*By using this site, you acknowledge that if you are offered employment, your sole and exclusive employer is the local franchised business that hired you, not Clintar Commercial Outdoor Services. Clintar Commercial Outdoor Services does not participate in any local employment decisions or practices within its franchised businesses. Each franchise is independently owned and operated.*",,https://ca.indeed.com/cmp/Clintar-Winnipeg,,,,,,,project manager,2025-02-02
