zr-BnKW-FlcRIUXexhjw2ECWw,zip_recruiter,https://www.ziprecruiter.com/jobs//j?lvk=BnKW-FlcRIUXexhjw2ECWw,,Custodial and Environmental Services Manager (19373001),Sodexo Canada Ltd,"Steinbach, MB, Canada",2025-02-01,,,,,,,,,,organic,,"Company Description

Grow your career with a company that shares your passion! Our Corporate Division is seeking a **Custodial and Environmental Services Manager** for our Pharmaceutical Production site located in Steinbach, MB.

Sodexo offers a competitive salary range $75,000\.00 \- $85,000\.00\. as well as Extended Benefits (Medical, Dental, Optical, Prescription Drug Plan) from day one of your new role. We also offer paid vacation and so much more!

At Sodexo, our purpose is to create a better everyday for everyone to build a better life for all. As the global leader in services that improve the Quality of Life, we operate in 55 countries, serving over 100 million consumers each day through our unique combination of On\-Site Food and FM Services, Benefits \& Rewards Services and Personal \& Home Services.
Job Description
**Job Description**

In your new role as our Custodial and Environmental Services Manager for our team, you will be responsible for the oversight of all Soft Services, Environmental Services, Grounds Keeping, Snow Removal, Administration, and Food Services functions for the assigned area or site. As a hands on leader supporting our client , you will lead, develop, motivate, direct and supervise front line and supervisory employees. You will assign work to employees based on client and service requirements, perform audits ensuring client standards are adhered to. You will ensure proper training, provide recommendations and/or remedial training as required. Maintains and tracks inventory levels of supplies and related costs, provides recommendations on quantity and timing of supply orders.

Scheduling – Dispatch and prioritize work assignments within assigned area/shift ensuring client needs and expectations are met in accordance with contract. Oversee, plan and ensure completion of special project cleaning assignments.

HR Related – Supervise, coach, motivate and develop employees and supervisors to ensure all are appropriately trained and adhering to proper procedures. Ensure completion of safety training and compliance. Audits performance, provides or arranges for new and remedial training, performs coaching discussions, performance management and discipline as required. Participates in hiring and staffing for the area of responsibility to ensure appropriate staffing levels are maintained.

Inventory – Maintains supply levels for consumables ensuring the adequate distribution of supplies and equipment. Maintain and report on inventory levels, provides recommendations related to alternative options, quantity and timing of orders

Other – Participates in the implementation plans for environmental service programs, ensures compliance to programs and provides reports and recommendations regarding adjustments to plans and/or additional requirements

Safety \- Perform daily safety checks and inspections, perform safety observations on employees, conduct safety walks and trainings, conduct safety investigations, complete reporting on safety related tasks, ensure compliance within IMS system for training and physical safety tasks.
Qualifications
* Post secondary diploma or degree in operations or related field or equivalent education and experience
* Proven track record of hands on leadership of teams driving operational excellence for your client
* 3\-5 years’ experience within a Soft Services, Environmental Services and Food Services environment in a manufacturing environment is a very strong asset
* Superior communication skills, written, verbal and interpersonal
* Prior experience and proven success with training methods and techniques
* Strong organizational, problem solving and multi\-tasking skills
* Working knowledge of GMP cleaning processes is a very strong asset
* Initiative, good judgement and leadership abilities, supervisory capabilities.
* Good communication skills
column2: both oral and written

zr-MIfPeQlJAVCjS7lOzsxAFw,zip_recruiter,https://www.ziprecruiter.com/jobs//j?lvk=MIfPeQlJAVCjS7lOzsxAFw,,Director of Embedded Systems,Smartrend Manufacturing Group,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-02-01,,,,,,,,,,organic,,"**DIRECTOR OF EMBEDDED SYSTEMS**
**WHO WE ARE**

As one of Manitoba's fastest growing companies, Smartrend Manufacturing Group (SMG), Inc. through our various divisions, is increasing safety in the school bus industry and reducing emissions in the electric vehicle charge systems arena. We work on exciting, patented, innovative technology that impacts our environment. What has remained constant throughout this compelling history of growth is our dedication to our customers, our team members, and to the values on which we built SMG:
* **People** our team is what makes us special
* **Passion** from our hearts and minds, demonstrated through our actions
* **Priority** we put the customer first, everyday, in everything we do
* **Partnership** with each other, our customers, and our suppliers
We offer a competitive benefits package in an environment that is supportive, respectful, and fun! Join an innovative, growing, and diverse organization where your voice matters.
**THE POSITION**

The ***Director of Embedded Systems*** will lead the development of cutting\-edge embedded systems that integrate seamlessly with modern software solutions. The ideal candidate will possess a strong background in hardware design and architecture, with a complementary understanding of software development for embedded applications. This role will guide a multidisciplinary team of engineers to create innovative products, ensuring seamless hardware\-software integration and world\-class performance.
**HOW YOU WILL BE MAKING AN IMPACT**
* Lead the embedded hardware design team, establishing goals, priorities and timelines.
* Collaborate with cross\-functional teams to align hardware design with software development and overall product objectives.
* Drive innovation and stay ahead of emerging trends in embedded systems.

* Architect, design, and oversee the development of embedded hardware, including PCB design with integration of microcontrollers (ARM, AVR, Microchip), FPGAs, sensors, communication protocols (I2C, SPI, UART), and communication modules.
* Ensure compliance with industry standards, regulatory requirements, and certifications.
* Conduct design reviews, simulations, and testing to ensure reliability and quality.
* Collaborate with software engineers to ensure optimal integration between hardware and firmware/software.
* Support the development of low\-level drivers, APIs, and real\-time operating systems (RTOS) for embedded platforms.
* Drive improvements in system performance, power consumption, and user experience through software optimization.
* Oversee project timelines, budgets, and deliverables, ensuring that products meet specifications and deadlines.
* Identify and mitigate risks throughout the hardware and software development cycle.
* Work closely with other stakeholders and departments.
**WHAT SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE YOU REQUIRE**
* Education: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or a related field.
* Minimum 10 years of experience in embedded hardware design and minimum 3 years in management/leadership role.
* Expertise in designing embedded systems such as Altium Designer and OrCAD and software development tools such as Git and Jira.
* Strong knowledge of software development for embedded systems, including proficiency in C/C\+\+, Python, Linux, or similar languages.
* Demonstrated ability to manage complex projects, budgets, and cross\-functional teams.
* Excellent communication and leadership skills.
* Works well under pressure and under tight timelines.
* High level of organizational skills, detail\-oriented, and analytical.
* Able to travel within Canada, the USA as required.
**THE BENEFITS OF BEING PART OF OUR TEAM**

Share with us your passion and drive towards your career objectives, and we will provide an environment where your valuable contributions are rewarded and celebrated with professional growth and job satisfaction. We offer an attractive benefits package for our team members including:
* Competitive salary based on experience
* Annual bonus up to 30% on salary based on performance
* Opportunity to participate in ESOP program
* RRSP matching up to 3%
* Group Insurance Plan with Health Spending Account
* Paid Vacation \- Includes company paid shutdown from Christmas to New Year
*We would like to thank all applicants who apply, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.*",,,,,,,,,project manager,2025-02-02

Founded in 1978 and headquartered in Edmonton, Alberta, All Weather Windows Ltd. (AWW) is a dynamic leader in the window and door industry in Canada. Operations include two manufacturing plants located in Edmonton and Customer Solution Centres located in Langley, Edmonton, Calgary, Lethbridge, Red Deer, Saskatoon, Regina, and Winnipeg.
We are currently recruiting for a **Warehouse Technician I **for our Winnipeg Shipping team.
• *In this position, you will be responsible for**:
- Scan and load trailers with finished product
- Assess loading list and place product in sequential order for loading
- Monitor safety aspects of load
- Measure and cut wood for bracing the product
- Organize product in the bin
- Direct delivers in locating sites
- Unload trailers
- Help with warehouse duties as assigned
- Must pass pre-employment Drug & Alcohol Testing
• *Primary Qualifications Required**:
- Good communication skills
- Able to read and follow maps
- Good area knowledge of city
- Able to follow directions
- Basic computer skills
- Minimum of High School Diploma
- Strong work ethic and physically fit
- Able to handle product with a weight range of 100 lbs.
- Able to use a chop saw, pressure nail and staple guns

- An exceptional company is founded upon exceptional people. At All Weather Windows, we invest in our people and are always looking for new opportunities for our employees to grow alongside our business, working together as part of a team to achieve success. We’ve been continually recognized by our attention to employee satisfaction and, as a result, the commitment and hard work of our employees has been acknowledged through awards and media recognition._ _If you embrace variety and change and are looking for a growth environment favouring the development of competencies, then come join us_

At All Weather Windows, we continuously work together to build and promote an inclusive environment that attracts talented individuals and shows our commitment to celebrate and promote diversity. Our dedication to diversity, equity and inclusion means that whatever the visible or invisible differences, we are fostering an environment where everyone has equal opportunity to bring their best selves to work, to be heard and be valued. We believe that our differences are what make us great. If you believe this role is the right next step for you, regardless of the criteria we’ve listed, we encourage you to apply.",,,,,,,,,laboratory technician,2025-02-03

go-wa5Elc1c_H_I_VMoAAAAAA==,google,https://ca.trabajo.org/job-2891-c8f377e28267db73bb11c953db2dc878?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,Research Technician Iii,CancerCare Manitoba,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-16,,,,,,,False,,,,,"**CancerCare Manitoba** is a provincial agency which provides clinical and academic services and leadership for cancer control and the treatment of blood disorders. Our shared vision of a **world free of cancer** drives every member of our team. CancerCare Manitoba is the perfect place to thrive if you're seeking a fulfilling career in an organization that is committed to its employees' well-being and professional development.
• *Posting End Date**:October 18, 2024
• *City**:Winnipeg
• *Work Location**:MacCharles
• *Department**:Paul Albrechtsen Research Institute CancerCare Manitoba
• *Union**: Non-Union
• *Hiring Status**:Term
• *Reason for Term**: Other
• *Anticipated Start **and End **Date**:January 06, 2025 - January 06, 2026 (may expire with two weeks notice)
• *Anticipated Shift**:Days
• *Daily Hours Worked**:7.50
• *Annual Base Hours**:1950
• *Job Summary**:

The successful applicant will join the Michaels laboratory at the Paul Albrechsten Research Institute and contribute to the lab's mission of developing safe, effective and accessible cellular therapies for cancer and immune disease. The Research Technician 3 is expected to become an integral member of a fast-paced and highly collaborative research team.

General supervision is provided by a scientist, postgraduate researcher, or more senior technician. Positions at this level provide skilled technical services or assistance. This includes performance of a wide variety of laboratory tasks, including primary cell culture, advanced techniques in molecular biology, complex imaging and protein and immune-assays. Incumbents operate and maintain moderately complex equipment or operate specialized equipment in carrying out work related to the research being conducted.
Technical training, guidance and orientation of employees at the same or lower levels is a responsibility of this position. This also includes training of undergraduate and graduate students.
Incumbents are expected to perform any duties performed by Research Technician 1s and 2s as required to support the activities of the unit.
• *Qualifications**:
• *Required**:
- Level of Formal Education & Experience_
- Masters degree in a related discipline.
- or
- Bachelor’s Degree in a related study area, with a minimum of 3 years of directly-related experience.
- or
- High school completion with job-related options with a minimum of 7 years of directly-related experience.
An acceptable equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered.
- Skills and Abilities_
- Experience with job-related software such as Word, Excel PowerPoint, and statistical/analytical programs.
- Ability to adapt techniques, to plan and carry out experiments and procedures under general direction and to keep within budget and schedule guidelines.
- Ability to master new and difficult techniques through further education or training.
- Ability to work effectively both independently and as a member of a team.
- Ability to train staff and students in techniques used in the workplace.
- Effective communication skills, both written and verbal.
- Ability to oversee the work of others.
- Knowledge of WHMIS and hazardous materials, animal/human ethics protocols and regulations.
- Physical Requirements_
- Physically capable of performing the duties as assigned, which may include mobility and/or moderate to heavy lifting.
- Other_
- Some positions require incumbent to possess philosophy compatible with animal-based research.
- Ability to complete relevant courses and/or obtain relevant certifications (e.g., WHIMIS, Animal User Training, human/animal ethics)
- Must have satisfactory employment record
- Must be legally able to work in Canada
• *Preferred**:
- Experience with high-throughput sequencing assays such as amplicon sequencing, RNA-seq and ChIP-seq
- Mammalian cell culture
column2: aseptic culture, cryopreservation and characterization of cells such as suspension and adherent cell lines, primary immune cells and stem cells

column1: - Familiarity with flow cytometry
- Experience with nucleic acid extraction
- Expertise in primer design and PCR
- Experience with agarose gel electrophoresis
- Experience and/or enthusiasm for working with animals
- Strong publication record
- Experience with tumour models and killing assays
- Ability to speak French

Interested and qualified applicants are invited to submit a detailed and current resume, plus a cover letter demonstrating how you meet the above qualifications and the above competition number.",,,,,,,,,research assistant,2025-02-03

- Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel.
- Experience in the hospitality industry. particularly in a sports or entertainment venue is an asset.

Position Summary

The Daniel McIntyre / St. Matthews Community Association (DMSMCA) is a community-driven not-for-profit Neighbourhood Renewal Corporation that services the Daniel McIntyre and St. Matthews neighborhoods in West Central Winnipeg, Manitoba, Canada. Our mission is to empower the community of Daniel McIntyre / St. Matthews to achieve social, cultural, economic, and environmental wellbeing. We are looking for an individual to be our next Community program Coordinator (CPC) and support the Organization's efforts towards providing support to members of our community.
• *Responsibilities**:
Supervision Tasks
- The CPC is responsible for the coordination of support services to participants and the supervision of programming staff.
- They will act as a key point of contact for the direct service team, community and partners

- The CPC will coordinate staff and activities in the Drop In, interact and facilitate respectful communication among the participants, respond to escalating situations when needed, ensure covid-19 protocols are in place and being followed, and ensure the supportive drop-in space runs in a safe and organized way.
- Support the Director and HR with recruitment, orientation, and training of staff
column2: and in determining appropriate staffing requirements for programs and services.

column1: - Coordinate volunteers' events, including outreach and appreciation.
- Volunteer recruitment, on-boarding, orientation, training and assign tasks.

Program Development
- Coordinate, monitor and assess day to day activities at the Drop-in Centre, overseeing the delivery and logistics of programs.
- Attend Community Partner information sessions and external meetings and share takeaways with the team to ensure up-to-date best practices for drop-in service implementation.
- Work with front-line team, strategic initiatives team and partners on coordinating logistics, onsite management and evaluation of special events and promotional activities.
- Build and coordinate the relationship with partner agencies for program activities.
- Oversee the delivery and implementation of services and activities in the Drop In, evaluate the deliverables and outcomes of the programs and report to Leadership with recommendations.
- Coordinate with other Manager for programming for participants across all services.
Administrative Tasks

- Ensure the facility and services adequately meet the physical, social and development needs of all participants and that there is an adequate protection of everyone’s health, safety, comfort and well
- being.
- Manage your team’s budget and process invoices related to front line services.
- Assists with operational research and reports upon request from the Director.
- Responsible of the drop-in report, Mid-term, and Final report
- Observe organizational policy and all current legislation and regulations.
Education and Requirements

- Bachelor’s in social work and/or university degree in a relevant field or discipline (public administration, social services) and/or comparable work experience. a combination of education and experiences
- Has 3+ years of demonstrated knowledge and experience in the social services sector
- Has a counseling, Addiction and Harm-reduction work experience
- a strong experience with programming, crisis management, good communication skills and computer skills,
- supervisory experience and proven experience in supporting participants from all ethnic backgrounds and gender.
- Understands relevant approaches: trauma-informed, harm -reduction, anti-racism, and anti
- oppression
- Has an excellent understanding of substance use, mental health, and harm reduction gained through direct experience working with individuals
- Can work effectively with staff, participants, service providers, the public, students, and volunteers to address service inquiries, requests and/or complaints,
- working with participants from marginalized communities, with strong ties and connections in the sector and a strong understanding of existing standards and trends
column2: and experience supervising and coaching staff.

column1: - Has excellent verbal and written communication skills, and facilitation skills.
- Has strong organizational skills, time management, attention to detail, multi-tasking skills and ability to prioritize and work well under pressure.
- Has excellent computer skills in a Microsoft Windows environment.
- Has the ability to work as part of a team or work independently and under mínimal supervision.
Additional Requirements
- Driving license and access to a car is an asset.
- Satisfactory clearance under the Vulnerable Sector Police Check Program.
- Must be qualified to legally work in Canada.
- Willing to work at a flexible schedule to accommodate the needs of the organization, working eve",,,,,,,,,program coordinator,2025-02-03

• *ABOUT SIGFUSSON NORTHERN**:

Sigfusson Northern is a third-generation family-owned business, which now has a portion of the company being employee-owned. Our primary focus is on building strong and lasting relationships with our employees, our clients, and the communities we serve. Ongoing growth and diversification have led Sigfusson Northern to the forefront of general contracting and heavy civil construction where we incorporate trust, respect, integrity, and commitment to our community in every decision we make and everything we do.

Reporting to the Project Manager, the Project Coordinator will be working on a rotational basis in a remote location where camp accommodations will be provided. The Project Coordinator will support the Project Managers, Superintendents, Engineers, and Foremen by providing project administration support.
• *CORE RESPONSIBILITIES & DUTIES**:
- Follow all requirements of the company health and safety program and support a safe work environment
- Provide support to the Project Manager, Superintendent, and Foreman on a technical or as needed basis
- Work closely with field personnel on construction specific issues to ensure all information is effectively presented to facilitate proper installation
- Ensure compliance with technical specifications and project drawings
- Involvement in project administration activities including pricing of change orders, shop drawing review, and subcontractor coordination
- Maintain job diaries and site photos
- Maintain project documentation in a manner consistent with contract deliverables and Sigfusson Northern’s file structure
- Monitor and track production, hourly work etc.
- Assist in preparing RFI’s, NCR’s, change orders, daily reports and other project related reports
- Create and maintain critical path method (CPM) Primavera schedules
- Assist Project Manager to enforce the construction schedule and cost controls
- Involvement in project status reports and on-going cost projections
- Assist with invoicing and preparing of supporting documentation for monthly reporting
- Support the Field Engineer/Project Manager in developing punch lists describing work to be completed with associated material requirements
- Assist Project Manager in preparing project close out reports to ensure sign off by all required parties
- Attend project site meetings when required
- Other duties and responsibilities as assigned by Supervisor
• *EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE & SKILLS**:
- Minimum 2+ years’ experience working in the construction industry
- Construction related education will be considered an asset
- Experience with Primavera P6 and AutoCAD will be considered an asset
- Experience working with First Nations communities will be considered an asset
- Ability to read and understand construction documents and drawings

go-xpA7smpFhWhEb6M5AAAAAA==,google,https://ca.trabajo.org/job-2891-0180cbf30de7fcd1ba406eb3aa1a14e8?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,Integrated Construction Technology Coordinator,PCL Construction,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-19,,,,,,,False,,,,,"**THE FUTURE YOU WANT IS WITHIN REACH.**

At PCL, we build the places where life happens and find camaraderie in the process. We’re a community of builders committed to building better communities. That’s why we’re always looking ahead, and not just for the next project or what’s next in our industry.
We’re also looking at what’s next for you and how we can help you build a career you’re proud of. As a PCL employee, your personal and professional growth comes first.
Here's how an Integrated Construction Technology Coordinator for our Winnipeg office contributes to our team:
• *RESPONSIBILITIES**:
- Builds virtual models from plans, specifications, and elevations with direct supervision.
- Collaborates with the project team on the development of construction site logistics models.
- Collaborates on the trade partner model coordination process and reports to the project management team, as appropriate.
- Assists with model updates.
- Supports the project team in the creation and processing of RFIs.
- Promotes the use of virtual construction tools and processes to project staff.
- Shares new technologies with project teams and seeks to drive adoption of PCL technologies through operational processes.
- Develops and maintains strong customer-focused relationships with all stakeholders.
• *WHAT YOU WILL BRING TO THE ROLE**:
- Post-secondary education in a buildings-industry-related discipline (e.g., architecture, engineering, and construction (AEC), civil, architectural).
- Some co-op or relevant experience in a construction environment preferred.
- Drafting and modeling experience.
- Ability to read and understand 2D and 3D construction drawings and specifications is an asset.
- Working knowledge and training in 3D modeling software and the ability to create content in VDC software is an asset.
- Exposure to 4D scheduling software and planning tools is an asset.
- Ability to read and interpret markups to construction drawings.
- Ability to participate in trade coordination meetings and understand trade partner deliverables and scope.
- Effective verbal and written communication skills
- Organizational skills, high level of detail orientation, and ability to multitask and prioritize conflicting deadlines.
PCL is an innovative, employee-owned company comprised of people who find passion in their profession and take pride in doing great work every day. Our work powers the infrastructure and

utilities that are essential to daily life and our projects are the scenes of vacations, careers, education, and healing. We are consistently ranked among the best companies to work for because we are committed to supporting and developing our teams.

The PCL Companies celebrate diversity and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to creating equitable opportunities and an inclusive environment for all employees and applicants. We make employment-related decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, or veteran status.

Safety is a core value that guides everything we do. As such, all PCL salary and student employees based in Canada are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Employees may request an exemption due to medical condition(s) and other applicable human rights grounds.
• *TOGETHER, WE CAN BUILD SUCCESS AND A BETTER FUTURE. LET’S GET STARTED",,,,,,,,,program coordinator,2025-02-03

go-vhz-hYxunq7HkTE9AAAAAA==,google,https://ca.trabajo.org/job-2891-0f15f3a290f7dc481e5953145d5272fe?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,"Program Coordinator, Talks",Jack.org,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-16,,,,,,,True,,,,,"Embark on a transformative journey with Jack.org, where you will play a pivotal role in reshaping youth mental health across Canada, **with a particular focus on expanding our impact in the Prairies region.** Our mission is to empower young individuals with community, knowledge, and tools to champion mental well-being. We envision a world where youth experience mental well-being, not distress. We stand poised and empowered for this crucial task, fortified by dedicated donors, a robust financial reserve, visionary leadership, and a high-performing team eager to drive change.

Focused on addressing the prevalent issue of mental health distress among youth, particularly those systematically excluded from mental health dialogue and action, we adapt programming to cater to diverse youth demographics and communities across Canada. Our approach centers on upstream prevention of mental distress and the promotion of mental well-being.

• *Ready to play a vital role in supporting the growth of youth mental health programs across the Prairies? **Join us in ensuring our dedicated staff is well-supported, enabling them to deliver on our mission with excellence for the benefit of the youth we serve
• *Position**:Program Coordinator, Talks (Prairies) - Remote
• *Reporting to**:Manager, Program Implementation
• *Head Office**:Toronto, ON
• *About You**:
- Organized and detail-oriented, you excel at managing multiple tasks and keeping things on track.
- You have experience working with youth and delivering impactful programs.
- A strong communicator who connects effectively with diverse stakeholders.
- Proactive and adaptable, you take initiative and navigate challenges with ease.
- You are connected to the Prairie region, understand its communities and mental health landscape, and have the ability to build strong, meaningful connections to expand our program’s reach.
• *Your Impact**:

As the Program Coordinator, Talks, you will be instrumental in overseeing the logistics and processes of our Jack Talks program within the Prairies region of Canada. You will serve as the main point of contact for our network of young people, ensuring the successful implementation and growth of our programs in this region.
• *Key Duties and Responsibilities**:
• *Program Coordination - Jack Talk Presentations (50%)**
- Oversee Jack Talk logistics and processes, including selecting and preparing speakers, coordinating with organizers, and troubleshooting any issues.

- Actively engage with Prairie communities to ensure their inclusion and representation in Jack Talks programming and establish long-term partnerships with local organizations to expand the program’s outreach.
- Maintain professional and timely communications, providing end-to-end support via post-Talk debrief calls with organizers and speakers.
- Support program evaluation by confirming audience attendance and distributing and monitoring digital surveys.
• *Speaker Training and Support (30%)**
- Ensure a positive experience for speakers by fostering relationships, distributing opportunities fairly, and maintaining organized data on Salesforce.
- Prioritize speaker recruitment and training in the Prairie region, building a strong, representative network of speakers who can engage with local communities effectively.
• *Outreach and Growth in the Prairies (10%)**
- Build and maintain relationships with local community leaders, schools, and organizations across the Prairies to enhance Jack.org's presence and ensure the program is reaching youth in these areas.
- Lead initiatives to identify and engage new communities in the Prairies, ensuring that Jack Talks reflect the diverse needs of the region.
- Collaborate with regional stakeholders to assess the effectiveness of our programs and tailor approaches to the unique challenges facing youth in the Prairies.
• *General (10%)**
- Support the promotion and implementation of Be There and Be There Certificate workshops.
- Collaborate with the Jack Chapters team to transition stakeholders between programs and cross-promote initiatives.
- Develop regional awareness to effectively support speakers and organizers.
- Support cross-functional projects as needed, including outreach and adapting programming to better align with the needs of Prairie communities and content creation.
• *Desired Skills, Competencies**:
- Excellent organizational and time management skills.
- Experience in youth engagement and program delivery.
- Strong communication skills for internal and external stakeholders.
- Experience with administrative tasks and data integrity.
- Flexibility for occasional evening or weekend events.
• *What’s in it for you?**
- A full-time, permanent position starting at **$52,000 **per annum
- A competitive, comprehensive benefits package
- Working for an organization that supports personal and professional development and that will invest in your growth
- A flexible, trust-based culture: we offer uncapped sick days and flex hours
-",,,,,,,,,program coordinator,2025-02-03

Youth for Christ Winnipeg is seeking a highly motivated and organized individual to serve as a Young Dads Program Coordinator in our Young Parents ministry. 2. Provide administrative support, ensuring logistics are managed effectively, including arranging for drivers, babysitters, and snacks.

4. Recruit, mobilize, and support volunteers, optimizing volunteer time and assignments.
5. Equip volunteers with the necessary tools and resources to excel in their roles.
6. Develop partnerships with community organizations, businesses, and resource agencies to enhance support and care for young parents.
Requirements:

2. Be an active participant in the life of a local church.
3. Affirm and support Youth for Christ's mission, values, and statement of faith.
4. Experience working with families in social service or non-profit settings would be beneficial.
5. Education in Social Work, Counseling, or related fields can be an asset.
6. Embody YFC's core values, with a strong heart for evangelism and outreach.
7. Possess excellent communication, organizational, and administrative skills.
8. Demonstrate initiative, attention to detail, and adaptability.
9. Ability to work collaboratively within a team environment and independently when needed.
10. Effective project management and deadline handling, maintaining high standards of quality.
This position offers a unique opportunity to make a lasting impact on the lives of young parents and contribute to the success of YFC Winnipeg.",,,,,,,,,program coordinator,2025-02-03

The successful candidate will play a significant role in the success of YFC Winnipeg, impacting the lives of young parents who engage with our ministries.
Responsibilities
• Coordinate and lead programming and events for young parents.
• Provide administrative support, including arranging drivers, babysitters, and snacks.
• Build relationships and provide mentorship and discipleship for young moms.
• Equip young moms in life and parenting skills, goal setting, and planning.
• Recruit, mobilize, and support volunteers to ensure effective time management.
• Pursue partnerships with community organizations, businesses, and resource agencies to enhance support for young parents.
Requirements
• Maintain a close relationship with God as a devoted follower of Jesus Christ.
• Be an active participant in the life of a local church.
• Affirm and support YFC's Community Covenant and Statement of Faith.
• Experience working with families in a social service or non-profit setting is an asset.
• Education in Social Work, Counseling, or related fields is also beneficial.
• Embody YFC's core values with a strong heart for evangelism.
• Strong communication, organizational, and administrative skills are essential.
• Take initiative, pay attention to details, and be willing to adapt.
• Ability to work well in a team and manage multiple projects while maintaining high standards of quality.
Our Team

As a member of our team, you will have the opportunity to make a meaningful impact on the lives of young parents and their children. If you are passionate about helping others and using your experience, skills, and knowledge to support the ministry of YFC, then this may be the position for you.",,,,,,,,,program coordinator,2025-02-03

go-8QxLSvfnswU1QLmXAAAAAA==,google,https://ca.trabajo.org/job-2891-7bb67c75e26703c586283b4195f39e1f?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,"Project Coordinator, Civil",Sigfusson Northern Ltd.,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-19,contract,,,,,,True,,,,,"**PROJECT COORDINATOR, CIVIL**
• *ABOUT SIGFUSSON NORTHERN**:

Sigfusson Northern is a third-generation family-owned business, which now has a portion of the company being employee-owned. Our primary focus is on building strong and lasting relationships with our employees, our clients, and the communities we serve. Ongoing growth and diversification have led Sigfusson Northern to the forefront of general contracting and heavy civil construction where we incorporate trust, respect, integrity, and commitment to our community in every decision we make and everything we do.

Reporting to the Project Manager, the Project Coordinator will be working on a rotational basis in a remote location where camp accommodations will be provided. The Project Coordinator will support the Project Managers, Superintendents, Engineers, and Foremen by providing project administration support.
• *CORE RESPONSIBILITIES & DUTIES**:
- Follow all requirements of the company health and safety program and support a safe work environment
- Provide support to the Project Manager, Superintendent, and Foreman on a technical or as needed basis
- Work closely with field personnel on construction specific issues to ensure all information is effectively presented to facilitate proper installation
- Ensure compliance with technical specifications and project drawings
- Involvement in project administration activities including pricing of change orders, shop drawing review, and subcontractor coordination
- Maintain job diaries and site photos
- Maintain project documentation in a manner consistent with contract deliverables and Sigfusson Northern’s file structure
- Monitor and track production, hourly work etc.
- Assist in preparing RFI’s, NCR’s, change orders, daily reports and other project related reports
- Create and maintain critical path method (CPM) Primavera schedules
- Assist Project Manager to enforce the construction schedule and cost controls
- Involvement in project status reports and on-going cost projections
- Assist with invoicing and preparing of supporting documentation for monthly reporting
- Support the Field Engineer/Project Manager in developing punch lists describing work to be completed with associated material requirements
- Assist Project Manager in preparing project close out reports to ensure sign off by all required parties
- Attend project site meetings when required
- Other duties and responsibilities as assigned by Supervisor
• *EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE & SKILLS**:
- Minimum 2+ years’ experience working in the construction industry
- Construction related education will be considered an asset
- Experience with Primavera P6 and AutoCAD will be considered an asset
- Experience working with First Nations communities will be considered an asset
- Ability to read and understand construction documents and drawings
- Advanced MS Office (Word, Excel, Outlook) is required
- Critical thinking and effective decision-making skills are required
- Ability to work independently and as part of a team
- Ability to work under pressure and meet strict deadlines
- Strong communication skills both verbal and written as well as electronically
- Strong accuracy and attention to detail
- Must hold a valid driver’s license
If you are interested in this opportunity and meet the requirements for the role, please click **Apply** and send your resume directly to **Sherri Bowles.**
• *Benefits**:
- Dental care
- Extended health care
- RRSP match
- Vision care
Schedule:
- 12 hour shift
- Overtime
Work Location: One location",,,,,,,,,project manager,2025-02-03

go-xpA7smpFhWhEb6M5AAAAAA==,google,https://ca.trabajo.org/job-2891-0180cbf30de7fcd1ba406eb3aa1a14e8?utm_campaign=google_jobs_apply&utm_source=google_jobs_apply&utm_medium=organic,,Integrated Construction Technology Coordinator,PCL Construction,"Winnipeg, MB, Canada",2025-01-19,,,,,,,False,,,,,"**THE FUTURE YOU WANT IS WITHIN REACH.**

At PCL, we build the places where life happens and find camaraderie in the process. We’re a community of builders committed to building better communities. That’s why we’re always looking ahead, and not just for the next project or what’s next in our industry.
We’re also looking at what’s next for you and how we can help you build a career you’re proud of. As a PCL employee, your personal and professional growth comes first.
Here's how an Integrated Construction Technology Coordinator for our Winnipeg office contributes to our team:
• *RESPONSIBILITIES**:
- Builds virtual models from plans, specifications, and elevations with direct supervision.
- Collaborates with the project team on the development of construction site logistics models.
- Collaborates on the trade partner model coordination process and reports to the project management team, as appropriate.
- Assists with model updates.
- Supports the project team in the creation and processing of RFIs.
- Promotes the use of virtual construction tools and processes to project staff.
- Shares new technologies with project teams and seeks to drive adoption of PCL technologies through operational processes.
- Develops and maintains strong customer-focused relationships with all stakeholders.
• *WHAT YOU WILL BRING TO THE ROLE**:
- Post-secondary education in a buildings-industry-related discipline (e.g., architecture, engineering, and construction (AEC), civil, architectural).
- Some co-op or relevant experience in a construction environment preferred.
- Drafting and modeling experience.
- Ability to read and understand 2D and 3D construction drawings and specifications is an asset.
- Working knowledge and training in 3D modeling software and the ability to create content in VDC software is an asset.
- Exposure to 4D scheduling software and planning tools is an asset.
- Ability to read and interpret markups to construction drawings.
- Ability to participate in trade coordination meetings and understand trade partner deliverables and scope.
- Effective verbal and written communication skills
- Organizational skills, high level of detail orientation, and ability to multitask and prioritize conflicting deadlines.
PCL is an innovative, employee-owned company comprised of people who find passion in their profession and take pride in doing great work every day. Our work powers the infrastructure and

utilities that are essential to daily life and our projects are the scenes of vacations, careers, education, and healing. We are consistently ranked among the best companies to work for because we are committed to supporting and developing our teams.

The PCL Companies celebrate diversity and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to creating equitable opportunities and an inclusive environment for all employees and applicants. We make employment-related decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, or veteran status.

Safety is a core value that guides everything we do. As such, all PCL salary and student employees based in Canada are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Employees may request an exemption due to medical condition(s) and other applicable human rights grounds.
• *TOGETHER, WE CAN BUILD SUCCESS AND A BETTER FUTURE. LET’S GET STARTED",,,,,,,,,project manager,2025-02-03

• Lead large- and small-scale bridge projects throughout Canada, focusing on opportunities across the Prairies and Northwestern Ontario.

What We Offer

• *ABOUT SIGFUSSON NORTHERN**:

Sigfusson Northern is a third-generation family-owned business, which now has a portion of the company being employee-owned. Our primary focus is on building strong and lasting relationships with our employees, our clients, and the communities we serve. Ongoing growth and diversification have led Sigfusson Northern to the forefront of general contracting and heavy civil construction where we incorporate trust, respect, integrity, and commitment to our community in every decision we make and everything we do.

Reporting to the Division Manager, General Contracting, the Operations Manager, General Contracting is responsible to oversee all aspects of the General Contracting Division related to field operations. The Operations Manager will develop and maintain the framework as to which field personnel will be led, managed, and supported. This position will be based out of the Winnipeg, MB office, with regular travel to project sites in Northern Manitoba and Northern Ontario.
• *CORE RESPONSIBILITIES & DUTIES**:
- Lead, mentor, and support Superintendents, Foreman, and Field Managers within the General Contracting Field Operations team.
- Coordinate with the Division Manager, General Contracting for all assignments of Superintendent and Foreman positions.
- Promote the company safety program and lead by example daily.
- Direct and assign all trade field assignments for various projects.
- Provide technical direction and professional support to Superintendents throughout the duration of the job.
- Review project schedules with Superintendents and Foreman.
- Ensure all critical activities and decisions remain on task and are being performed to company and client standards.
- Document project field issues that impact budget, quality, and schedule, and provide updates to the project management team.
- Provide oversight for the Superintendent and Foreman for the development and maintenance of a Resource Allocation System.
- Provide guidance in the implementation of the Project Quality Assurance/Quality Control (QA/QC) program.
- Identify projects with self-performed opportunities and assist in the development of the self-performed proposals.
- Direct and manage self-performed performance.
- Collaborate with Director, Health, Safety, and Environmental, and the Safety Advisor, General Contracting to implement and promote the Sigfusson Northern Safety Program.
- Manage the professional development and progress for field trades people.
- Collaborate with the Division Manager, General Contracting to maintain and manage the succession planning initiatives for all the high-performing tradesmen.
- Collaborate with the Training Coordinator to maintain and manage training for tradesmen.
- Support Business Development, Estimating and Senior Leadership with development of operational plans for all pursuits within the General Contracting realm of the business.
- Collaborate with the senior-level project staff to support development of logistics plans and schedules during pre-construction and early project activities.
- Provide regular oversight of all general contracting operations with an emphasis on removing barriers and gaining process efficiencies for operations personnel.
- Collaborate with the People & Culture Department with recruitments and employee relations and oversee the department-specific onboarding process of new team members.
- Allocate resources including personnel, budget, and technology, to general contracting projects as needed.
- Follow and promote interdepartmental processes and liaise with all departments to provide input to innovate, streamline, and ensure departmental synergies.
- Provide input on personnel, material, and equipment resources related to project pursuits and securement.
- Collaborate with the Division Manager, General Contracting to forecast the future needs to meet the business and division goals.
• *EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE & SKILLS**:
- Minimum 15+ years of progressive construction experience in the field and general operations.
- Minimum 5+ years of experience in general contracting working with major projects.
- Must have a clear understanding of contract administration and Canadian Contract Law.
- Experience coaching, mentoring, and leading a large team.
- Experience with Microsoft Project, Primavera P6 and AutoCAD will be considered an asset.
- Certification & experience with lean construction practices will be considered an asset.
- Ability to read and understand construction documents and drawings.
- Advanced MS Office (Word, Excel, Outlook) is required.
- Critical thinking and effective decision-making skills are required.
- Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
- Ability to work under pressure and meet strict deadlines.
- Strong communication skills both verbal and written as well as electronically.
- Strong accuracy and attention to detail.
- Must hold a valid driver’s license.
- Must",,,,,,,,,project manager,2025-02-03

in-cc8fa520d83344d1,indeed,https://ca.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=cc8fa520d83344d1,https://www.applicantpro.com/openings/oakenbuilders/jobs/3636097-1031853,Residential Construction Project Manager,,"Rosenort, MB, CA",2025-02-01,fulltime,,,,,,False,,,,,"**Residential Construction Project Manager**
**Manitoba, Canada**
**Oaken Builders**
**Join Oaken Builders: Where Trust is the Foundation**

At Oaken Builders, we believe trust is the most essential building material\-not just in our projects, but in our relationships with clients, team members, trade partners, and our community. As a small but dynamic residential contractor in Manitoba, we are committed to delivering high\-quality craftsmanship while fostering a workplace built on collaboration, integrity, and accountability.
**About the Role**

We are looking for an experienced **Residential Construction Project Manager** to join our team. This is more than just a job\-it's an opportunity to bring your construction expertise, leadership skills, and passion for building to a company that values craftsmanship, professionalism, and meaningful relationships. Our ideal hire is a team focused construction professional ready to apply their God given talents to their craft and our mission.

At Oaken, trust empowers decision\-making, fuels confidence, and drives responsibility. We seek a Project Manager who embodies these values, someone who takes ownership, communicates effectively, and is proactive in making Oaken Builders even better. If you're a hardworking leader who believes in quality workmanship and reliability, we invite you to be part of our mission: Building Trust.
**What You'll Do**
* **Manage all phases of residential construction projects** from planning and permitting to execution and final walkthrough, ensuring projects are completed on time and within budget.
* **Coordinate with clients, subcontractors, and internal teams** to maintain clear communication, set expectations, and ensure smooth project execution.
* **Oversee scheduling, budgeting, and on\-site supervision**, ensuring efficient resource allocation and adherence to project timelines.
* **Ensure high standards of safety, quality, and craftsmanship** by conducting regular site inspections and enforcing best practices.
* **Identify and resolve project challenges proactively**, adapting to changes and keeping progress on track.
* **Mentor and support team members**, fostering a collaborative, accountable, and productive work environment.
**What You Bring**

* **3\-5\+ years of experience as a Project Manager in residential construction**, with a strong track record of delivering projects successfully. Previous experience in the construction industry is considered a strong plus!
* **Deep understanding of construction methods, building codes, and industry best practices**, ensuring high\-quality work and compliance.
* **Strong leadership, communication, and organizational skills**, with the ability to coordinate teams and manage multiple moving parts effectively.
* **Problem\-solving mindset**, able to navigate challenges and make sound decisions under pressure.
* Familiarity with project management software (e.g., JobTread, BuilderTrend, Procore) is a plus but not required.
* Valid driver's license and reliable transportation for site visits and meetings.
**Why Join Oaken Builders?**
* Competitive salary and flexible benefits package.
* A supportive, team\-oriented workplace culture.
* Opportunities for professional growth and development.
* The chance to work on meaningful projects that make a difference in our community.
**How to Apply**

If you're ready to bring your expertise to a team that values your contributions, we'd love to hear from you. Please send your resume and a brief cover letter highlighting your experience and why you're a great fit for this role.
Oaken Builders is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.",,,,,,,,,project manager,2025-02-03
